analyzed: eka aṅgena api kamma araha bhāva dassana attham vuttam sesam ettha uttāna attham ca iva tajjanīye ca vutta nayam eva
translated: is said in order to show that one who is deserving of a formal act is so even if he has only one of these characteristics. The rest of the meaning here is the same as that of the offense entailing suspension.

original: Adhammakammādidvādasakakathā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: adhamma kamma ādi dvādasaka kathā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the twelve kinds of illegitimate legal procedures, etc., is finished.

original: Āpattiyā adassane ukkhepanīyakammakathā
analyzed: āpattiyāḥ a dassane ukkhepanīya kamma kathā
translated: The discussion of the legal procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense

original: 46. Channavatthusmiṃ – āvāsaparamparañca bhikkhave saṃsathāti sabbāvāsesu ārocetha.
analyzed: channa vatthusmim āvāsa paramparam ca bhikkhave saṃsatha ati sabba āvāsesu ārocetha
translated: In the case of Channa, “You should announce it in all the monasteries, monks, by means of an announcement that is passed on from ear to ear.”

original: 50. Bhaṇḍanakārakotiādīsu bhaṇḍanādipaccayā āpannaṃ āpattiṃ ropetvā tassā adassaneyeva kammaṃ kātabbaṃ. Tikā vuttappakārā eva.
analyzed: bhaṇḍana kārakā uti ādīsu bhaṇḍana ādi paccayā āpannam āpattim ropetvā tassāḥ a dassaneya iva kammam kātabbam tikā vutta ppakārā eva
translated: In the case of the terms “a maker of quarrels, disputes, and issues in the Sangha,” etc., the offense that is the condition for the legal procedure of demotion should be laid out. The three sub-chapters are as already described.

original: 51. Sammāvattanāyaṃ panettha tecattālīsa vattāni. Tattha na anuddhaṃsetabboti na
analyzed: sammāvattanāyam pana ittha tecattālīsa vattāni tattha na
translated: The right behavior: there are thirty-four rules. “He should not stir up”:

original: codetabbo. Na bhikkhu bhikkhūhīti añño bhikkhu aññehi bhikkhūhi na bhinditabbo. Na🔽gihiddhajoti odātavatthāni acchinnadasapupphadasāni ca na dhāretabbāni. Na titthiyaddhajoti
analyzed: codetabbaḥ na bhikkhu bhikkhūhi iti aññaḥ bhikkhu aññehi bhikkhūhi na bhinditabbaḥ na  gihiddhajoti odāta vatthāni acchinna dasa puppha dasāni ca na dhāretabbāni na titthiyaddhajoti
translated: he should not accuse. “He should not split a monk from other monks”: one monk should not cause a division between a monk and other monks.🔽“He should not wear white clothes”: he should not wear light-colored clothes, uncut cloth, or dyed cloth. “He should not wear the robes of the monastics of other religions”:

original: kusacīrādīni na dhāretabbāni. Na āsādetabboti na apasādetabbo. Anto vā bahi vāti
analyzed: kusa cīra ādīni na dhāretabbāni na āsādetabbaḥ iti na apasādetabbaḥ antar vā bahi vā ati
translated: he should not wear the clothes of ascetics of other religions, such as a topknot, a peacock’s tail, or a flame-patterned shawl. “He should not disparage”: he should not criticize. “Either inside or outside”:

original: vihārassa anto vā bahi vā. Na titthiyādipadattayaṃ uttānameva. Sesaṃ sabbaṃ pārivāsikakkhandhake
analyzed: vihārassa antar vā bahi vā na uttānam eva sesam sabbam pārivāsika khandhake
translated: either inside or outside the monastery. The three terms “monastics of other religions”, etc., are just synonyms. The rest we will explain in the chapter on the trial period. The rest is as in the case of the legal procedure of condemnation.

original: vaṇṇayissāma. Sesaṃ tajjanīye vuttanayameva. Āpattiyā appaṭikamme ukkhepanīyakammaṃ iminā sadisameva.
analyzed: vaṇṇayissāma sesam tajjanīye vutta nayam eva āpattiyāḥ appaṭikamme ukkhepanīya kammam iminā sadisam eva
translated: The legal procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense is similar to this one.

original: 65. Ariṭṭhavatthu khuddakavaṇṇanāyaṃ vuttaṃ. “Bhaṇḍanakārako”tiādīsu yaṃ diṭṭhiṃ🔽nissāya bhaṇḍanādīni karoti, tassā appaṭinissaggeyeva kammaṃ kātabbaṃ. Sesaṃ tajjanīye
analyzed: ariṭṭha vatthu khuddaka vaṇṇanāyam vuttam bhaṇḍana kāraka uti ādīsu yam diṭṭhim  nissāya bhaṇḍana ādīni karoti tassāḥ a paṭinissaggā iva kammam kātabbam sesam tajjanīye
translated: The sub-commentary on the account of Ariṭṭha says, “In the case of the words ‘a maker of quarrels, a maker of disputes, a maker of issues in the Sangha,’ if he does the quarrelling, etc.🔽on the basis of a view, then the legal procedure should be done without his admission of the view. The rest is in the same way as in the case of the legal procedure of condemnation.

original: vuttanayameva. Sammāvattanāyampi hi idha tecattālīsaṃyeva vattānīti.
analyzed: vutta nayam eva sammāvatta nāyam pi hi idha vattāni iti
translated: For here there are just the forty-three kinds of proper conduct.”

original: Āpattiyā adassane ukkhepanīyakammakathā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: āpattiyāḥ adassane ukkhepanīya kamma kathā niṭṭhitā
translated: The discussion of the legal procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense is finished.

original: Kammakkhandhakavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽2. Pārivāsikakkhandhakaṃ
analyzed: kammakkhandhaka vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  pārivāsika khandhakam
translated: The commentary on the chapter on legal procedures is finished.

original: Pārivāsikavattakathā
analyzed: pārivāsika vatta kathā
translated: The chapter on those on probation🔽The discussion of the proper conduct for those on probation

original: 75. Pārivāsikakkhandhake – pārivāsikāti parivāsaṃ parivasantā. Tattha catubbidho
analyzed: pārivāsika khandhake pārivāsikā ati parivāsam parivasantā tattha catubbidhaḥ
translated: In the chapter on those on probation: Those on probation are those who are undertaking a probation. There are four kinds of probation:

original: parivāso – appaṭicchannaparivāso, paṭicchannaparivāso, suddhantaparivāso, samodhānaparivāsoti.
analyzed: parivāsaḥ appaṭicchanna parivāso paṭicchanna parivāsaḥ suddhanta parivāso samodhāna parivāso ti
translated: probation for unconcealed offenses, probation for concealed offenses, pure-at-the-end probation, and concurrent probation.

original: Tesu “yo, bhikkhave, aññopi aññatitthiyapubbo imasmiṃ dhammavinaye ākaṅkhati pabbajjaṃ,
analyzed: tesu yaḥ bhikkhave aññaḥ api añña titthiya pubbaḥ imasmin dhamma vinaye ākaṅkhati pabbajjam
translated: “Monks, if anyone else who has been previously in another sect wants the going forth in this Dhamma and Discipline,

original: ākaṅkhati upasampadaṃ, tassa cattāro māse parivāso dātabbo”ti evaṃ mahākhandhake
analyzed: ākaṅkhati upasampadam tassa cattāraḥ māse parivāso dātabbo ti evam mahākhandhake
translated: “If he wants the full ordination, probation for four months should be given to him.”🔽This is called probation for a schismatic.

original: vutto titthiyaparivāso appaṭicchannaparivāso nāma. Tattha yaṃ vattabbaṃ taṃ vuttameva.
analyzed: vuttaḥ titthiya parivāsaḥ appaṭicchannaparivāsaḥ nāma tattha yat vattabbam tat vuttam eva
translated: This is called probation for one who has not confessed.🔽But this is not intended here.

original: Ayaṃ pana idha anadhippeto. Sesā tayo yena saṅghādisesāpatti āpannā ceva hoti paṭicchāditā
analyzed: ayam pana idha yena saṅgha ādi sesa āpatti āpannā ca iva hoti paṭicchāditā
translated: The other three are given to one who has both committed an offense entailing suspension and concealed it.🔽What is to be said about them will be explained in the chapter on the combined process.

original: ca, tassa dātabbā. Tesu yaṃ vattabbaṃ taṃ samuccayakkhandhake vakkhāma. Ete pana
analyzed: ca tassa dātabbā tesu yam vattabbam tam samuccaya kkhandhake vakkhāma ete pana
translated: But these are intended here.

original: idha adhippetā. Tasmā etesu yaṃkiñci parivāsaṃ parivasantā “pārivāsikā”ti veditabbā.
analyzed: idha adhippetā tasmai etesu yaṃkiñci parivāsam parivasantā pārivāsikā ati veditabbā
translated: Therefore, those who are undertaking any of these probations should be understood as “those undertaking probation”.

original: Pakatattānaṃ bhikkhūnanti ṭhapetvā navakataraṃ pārivāsikaṃ avasesānaṃ antamaso mūlāyapaṭikassanārahādīnampi.
analyzed: pakata ttānam bhikkhūnan ti ṭhapetvā navakataram pārivāsikam avasesānam antamasaḥ mūlāya paṭikassana araha ādīnam pi
translated: To the other resident monks: except for a probationer who is more junior, to the rest, even to those deserving to be sent back to the beginning.

original: Abhivādanapaccuṭṭhānanti yaṃ te abhivādanādiṃ karonti, taṃ sādiyanti, sampaṭicchanti;
analyzed: abhivādana paccuṭṭhānam ti yam te abhivādana ādim karonti tam sādiyanti sampaṭicchanti
translated: Bowing down and rising: they consent to, agree to, the other monks bowing down to them and rising for them.

original: na paṭikkhipantīti attho. Tattha sāmīcikammanti ṭhapetvā abhivādanādīni aññassa anucchavikassa🔽bījanavātadānādino ābhisamācārikassetaṃ adhivacanaṃ. Āsanābhihāranti āsanassa abhiharaṇaṃ,🔽āsanaṃ gahetvā abhigamanaṃ paññāpanameva vā. Seyyābhihārepi eseva nayo. Pādodakanti
analyzed: na paṭikkhipanti iti attho tattha sāmīcikamman ti ṭhapetvā abhivādana ādīni aññassa anucchavikassa  bījana vāta dāna ādinaḥ ābhisamācārikassa etam adhivacanam āsana abhihāranti āsanassa abhiharaṇam  āsanam gahetvā abhigamanam paññāpanam eva vā seyyā abhihāre pi esā iva nayo pāda udakanti
translated: The meaning is that he does not refuse. Herein, the proper duties are the duties of hospitality such as the offering of a seat, water for the feet, a foot stool, a foot scraper, water for the hands, and so on, except for the duties of saluting, etc.,

original: pādadhovanaudakaṃ. Pādapīṭhanti dhotapādaṭṭhapanakaṃ. Pādakathalikanti adhotapādaṭṭhapanakaṃ
analyzed: pāda dhovana odakam pāda pīṭhanti dhota pāda ṭṭhapanakam pāda kathalikanti a dhota pāda ṭṭhapanakam
translated: which are proper for a pupil. The offering of a seat is the bringing of a seat. The meaning is, taking a seat, he should approach and offer it. The same method applies in the case of the offering of a bed. Water for the feet is water for washing the feet. A foot stool is a foot stand for washing the feet. A foot scraper is a foot wiper for wiping the feet after washing them.

original: pādaghaṃsanaṃ vā. Āpatti dukkaṭassāti saddhivihārikānampi sādiyantassa dukkaṭameva,🔽tasmā te vattabbā – “ahaṃ vinayakammaṃ karomi, mayhaṃ vattaṃ mā karotha, mā maṃ gāmappavesanaṃ
analyzed: pāda ghaṃsanam vā āpatti dukkaṭassa ati saddhivihārikānam pi sādiyantassa dukkaṭam eva  tasmā te vattabbā aham vinaya kammam karomi mayham vattam mā karotha mā mama gāma ppavesanam
translated: There is an offence of wrong-doing for those who consent.

original: āpucchathā”ti. Sace saddhāpabbajitā kulaputtā “tumhe, bhante, tumhākaṃ vinayakammaṃ
analyzed: āpucchatha ati sace saddhā pabbajitā kula puttā tumhe bhante tumhākam vinaya kammaṃ
translated: Therefore they should be told, “I am doing a legal procedure of the Community. Do not do the duties to me. Do not ask me about entering the village.” If they are faithful, they may say, “Venerable sir, we are not doing the duties to you because we want to, but because the Buddha has laid down that the duties should be done to the preceptor.”

original: karothā”ti vatvā vattaṃ karonti, gāmappavesanampi āpucchantiyeva, vāritakālato paṭṭhāya
analyzed: karotha ati vatvā vattam karonti gāma pavesanam pi āpucchantiyā iva vārita kālato paṭṭhāya
translated: and they do it. They also ask permission to enter the village. There is no offense if they do it from the time they are stopped.

original: anāpatti. Mithu yathāvuḍḍhanti pārivāsikabhikkhūnaṃ aññamaññaṃ yo yo vuḍḍho tena
analyzed: anāpatti mithu yathāvuḍḍhanti pārivāsika bhikkhūnam aññamaññam yaḥ yaḥ vuḍḍho tena
translated: As the most senior: the resident monks should be in order of seniority, and the newly arrived monks should be in order of seniority.

original: tena navakatarassa sādituṃ.🔽Pañca yathāvuḍḍhanti pakatattehipi saddhiṃ vuḍḍhapaṭipāṭiyā eva. Tasmā pātimokkhe
analyzed: tena navakatarassa sāditum  pañca yathāvuḍḍhanti saddhim vuḍḍha paṭipāṭiyā eva tasmā pātimokkhe
translated: The newly arrived monks should be in order of seniority with the resident monks.🔽The five as the most senior: the resident monks should be in order of seniority, and the newly arrived monks should be in order of seniority.

original: uddissamāne hatthapāse nisīdituṃ vaṭṭati. Mahāpaccariyaṃ pana “pāḷiyā anisīditvā
analyzed: uddissamāne hattha pāse nisīditum vaṭṭati mahā paccariyam pana pāḷiyā a nisīditvā
translated: Therefore, when the Monastic Code is being recited, it is allowable to sit within arm’s reach. But the Great Observance says that you should not sit down until the recitation of the Monastic Code is finished,

original: pāḷiṃ vihāya hatthapāsaṃ amuñcantena nisīditabba”nti vuttaṃ. Pārisuddhiuposathe karīyamāne🔽saṅghanavakaṭṭhāne nisīditvā tattheva nisinnena attano pāḷiyā pārisuddhiuposatho
analyzed: pāḷim vihāya hattha pāsam a muñcantena nisīditabban ti vuttam pārisuddhi uposathe karīyamāne  saṅgha navaka ṭṭhāne nisīditvā tattha iva nisinnena attano pāḷiyā pārisuddhi uposatho
translated: and that you should not leave your seat until the recitation of the Monastic Code is finished.🔽When the observance-day ceremony of purity is being done,🔽you should sit in the most junior position in the Sangha and do the observance-day ceremony of purity with the recitation of the Monastic Code by those who are sitting there.

original: kātabbo. Pavāraṇāyapi saṅghanavakaṭṭhāne nisīditvā tattheva nisinnena attano pāḷiyā
analyzed: saṅgha navaka ṭṭhāne nisīditvā tattha iva nisinnena attanaḥ pāḷiyā
translated: When the invitation ceremony is being done,🔽you should sit in the most junior position in the Sangha and do the invitation ceremony with the recitation of the Monastic Code by those who are sitting there.

original: pavāretabbaṃ. Saṅghena ghaṇṭiṃ paharitvā bhājīyamānaṃ vassikasāṭikampi attano pattaṭṭhāne gahetuṃ vaṭṭati.
analyzed: pavāretabbam saṅghena ghaṇṭim paharitvā bhājīyamānam vassika sāṭikam pi attano pattaṭṭhāne gahetum vaṭṭati
translated: He should invite. When the robe-cloth is being distributed by the Sangha after it has been rung, he should take the rainy-season robe at his proper place in the row.

original: Oṇojananti vissajjanaṃ vuccati. Sace hi pārivāsikassa dve tīṇi uddesabhattādīni pāpuṇanti,
analyzed: oṇojanam ti vissajjanam vuccati sace hi pārivāsikassa dve tīṇi uddesa bhatta ādīni pāpuṇanti
translated: The word “transferred” means “given up”. If a probationer receives two or three invitations to meals,

original: aññā cassa puggalikabhattapaccāsā hoti, tāni paṭipāṭiyā gahetvā “bhante, heṭṭhā gāhetha,
analyzed: aññā cassa puggalika bhatta paccāsā hoti tāni paṭipāṭiyā gahetvā bhante heṭṭhā gāhetha
translated: and he has a private invitation, he should take the first two in order and say, “Venerables, take this one.

original: ajja mayhaṃ bhattapaccāsā atthi, sve gaṇhissāmī”ti vatvā vissajjetabbāni. Evaṃ tāni🔽punadivasesu gaṇhituṃ labhati. Punadivase sabbapaṭhamaṃ etassa dātabbanti kurundiyaṃ
analyzed: ajja mayham bhatta paccāsā atthi sve gaṇhissāmi iti vatvā vissajjetabbāni evam tāni  puna divasesu gaṇhitum labhati puna divase sabba paṭhamam etassa dātabbanti kurundiyam
translated: Today I have a private invitation. I’ll take it tomorrow.” In this way he should give up the first two.🔽In this way he gets to take them on the following days. It is said in the Kurundī story,

original: vuttaṃ. Yadi pana na gaṇhāti na vissajjeti, punadivase na labhati, idaṃ oṇojanaṃ
analyzed: vuttam yadi pana na gaṇhāti na vissajjeti puna divase na labhati idam oṇojanam
translated: “On the following day, he should be given the first choice.” But if he doesn’t take it or give it up, he doesn’t get to take it on the following days. This is called “transferred”.

original: nāma pārivāsikasseva odissa anuññātaṃ. Kasmā? Tassa hi saṅghanavakaṭṭhāne nisinnassa
analyzed: nāma pārivāsikassa iva odissa anuññātam kasmā tassa hi saṅgha navaka ṭṭhāne nisinnassa
translated: This is allowed only for a probationer. Why is that? Because a probationer sits in the lowest position in the Sangha.

original: bhattagge yāgukhajjakādīni pāpuṇanti vā na vā, tasmā so “bhikkhāhārena mā kilamitthā”ti
analyzed: bhattagge yāgu khajjaka ādīni pāpuṇanti vā na vā tasmā so bhikkhāhārena mā kilamittha ati
translated: He may or may not get rice gruel, etc., in the meal hall. So this was allowed by the Blessed One “in order to prevent his being exhausted by the alms round.”

original: idamassa saṅgahakaraṇatthāya odissa anuññātaṃ.
analyzed: idam assa saṅgaha karaṇa atthāya odissa anuññātam
translated: This is the purpose for which it was allowed.

original: Bhattanti āgatāgatehi vuḍḍhapaṭipāṭiyā gahetvā gantabbaṃ vihāre saṅghassa catussālabhattaṃ,
analyzed: bhattanti āgata āgatehi vuḍḍha paṭipāṭiyā gahetvā gantabbam vihāre saṅghassa catussālabhattam
translated: “Meal” : the meal of the Community in the monastery, which is taken in the four-monasteries order by those who have arrived and who are present,

original: etaṃ yathāvuḍḍhaṃ labhati. Pāḷiyā pana gantuṃ vā ṭhātuṃ vā na labhati, tasmā pāḷito
analyzed: etam yathāvuḍḍham labhati pāḷiyā pana gantum vā ṭhātum vā na labhati tasmai pāḷito
translated: is what he gets in the order of seniority. But he is not allowed to go or stay according to the rule.🔽So he should stand within hand’s reach of the rule,

original: osakkitvā hatthapāse ṭhitena hatthaṃ pasāretvā yathā seno nipatitvā gaṇhāti, evaṃ
analyzed: osakkitvā hattha pāse ṭhitena hattham pasāretvā yathā senaḥ nipatitvā gaṇhāti evam
translated: and he should stretch out his hand and receive the food as a hawk swoops and seizes it.

original: gaṇhitabbaṃ. Ārāmikasamaṇuddesehi āharāpetuṃ na labhati. Sace sayameva āharanti,
analyzed: gaṇhitabbam ārāmika samaṇa uddesehi āharāpetum na labhati sace sayam eva āharanti
translated: He is not allowed to have it brought by monastery attendants or novices. If they bring it themselves,

original: vaṭṭati. Rañño mahāpeḷabhattepi eseva nayo. Catussālabhatte pana sace oṇojanaṃ kattukāmo
analyzed: vaṭṭati raññaḥ mahāpeḷa bhatte pi esa iva nayaḥ catussālabhatte pana sace oṇojanam kattu kāmo
translated: it is allowable. The same method applies in the case of the king’s great distribution of food. But if he wants to make a choice in the four-monasteries meal,

original: hoti, attano atthāya ukkhitte piṇḍe “ajja me bhattaṃ atthi, sve gaṇhissāmī”ti vattabbaṃ.
analyzed: hoti attanaḥ atthāya ukkhitte piṇḍe ajja me bhattam atthi sve gaṇhissāmi iti vattabbam
translated: he should say, “Today I have food; I will take it tomorrow.”

original: Punadivase dve piṇḍe labhatīti mahāpaccariyaṃ vuttaṃ. Uddesabhattādīnipi pāḷito osakkitvāva
analyzed: puna divase dve piṇḍe labhati iti mahā paccariyam vuttam uddesa bhatta ādīni pi pāḷitaḥ osakkitvā ava
translated: and the next day he gets two alms-meals. The “alms-food by indication” and the rest should be taken after rejecting them according to the text.

original: gahetabbāni. Yattha pana nisīdāpetvā parivisanti, tattha sāmaṇerānaṃ jeṭṭhakena bhikkhūnaṃ
analyzed: gahetabbāni yattha pana nisīdāpetvā parivisanti tattha sāmaṇerānam jeṭṭhakena bhikkhūnam
translated: But where they serve after making them sit down, there the novices should sit down in order of seniority,

original: saṅghanavakena hutvā nisīditabbaṃ.🔽76. Idāni yā ayaṃ sammāvattanā vuttā, tattha na upasampādetabbanti upajjhāyena hutvā🔽na upasampādetabbaṃ; vattaṃ nikkhipitvā pana upasampādetuṃ vaṭṭati. Ācariyena hutvāpi🔽kammavācā na sāvetabbā, aññasmiṃ asati vattaṃ nikkhipitvā sāvetuṃ vaṭṭati. Na nissayoti
analyzed: saṅgha navakena hutvā nisīditabbam  idāni yā ayam sammāvattanā vuttā tattha na upasampādetabbanti upajjhāyena hutvā  na upasampādetabbam vattam nikkhipitvā pana upasampādetum vaṭṭati ācariyena hutvā api  kamma vācā na sāvetabbā aññasmin asati vattam nikkhipitvā sāvetum vaṭṭati na nissayaḥ ti
translated: and the monks in order of seniority of seniority of ordination.🔽Now, as to the right conduct stated here, “He should not give Acceptance”: he should not give Acceptance acting as preceptor; but it is allowable for him to give Acceptance after laying aside the duties. Acting as teacher,

original: āgantukānaṃ nissayo na dātabbo. Yehipi pakatiyāva nissayo gahito, te vattabbā – “ahaṃ🔽vinayakammaṃ karomi, asukattherassa nāma santike nissayaṃ gaṇhatha, mayhaṃ vattaṃ
analyzed: āgantukānam nissayaḥ na dātabbaḥ yehi pi pakatiyā ava nissayaḥ gahito te vattabbā aham 🔽vinaya kammam karomi asuka ttherassa nāma santike nissayam gaṇhatha mayham vattam
translated: he should not recite the formal kammavācā; but if there is no one else, it is allowable for him to recite it after laying aside the duties. “He should not give dependence”: dependence should not be given to incoming bhikkhus. But those who have already taken dependence should be told, “I am doing a legal procedure. Take dependence on so-and-so, a senior elder. Take the duties from him. I am laying aside the duties.”

original: mā karotha, mā maṃ gāmappavesanaṃ āpucchathā”ti. Sace evaṃ vuttepi karontiyeva, vāritakālato
analyzed: mā karotha mā mama gāma pavesanam āpucchatha ati sace evam vutte pi karontiyā iva vārita kālataḥ
translated: If they still do, then from the time of being refused,

original: paṭṭhāya karontesupi anāpatti.
analyzed: paṭṭhāya karontesu pi anāpatti
translated: there is no offense in doing it.

original: Na sāmaṇeroti añño sāmaṇero na gahetabbo. Upajjhaṃ datvā gahitasāmaṇerāpi vattabbā
analyzed: na sāmaṇeraḥ ti aññaḥ sāmaṇeraḥ na gahetabbaḥ upajjham da tvā gahita sāmaṇerā api vattabbā
translated: He should not take another novice monk: even if he has taken a novice monk by giving him the full ordination, he should tell him

original: – “ahaṃ vinayakammaṃ karomi, mayhaṃ vattaṃ mā karotha, mā maṃ gāmappavesanaṃ āpucchathā”ti.🔽Sace evaṃ vuttepi karontiyeva, vāritakālato paṭṭhāya karontesupi anāpatti. Bhikkhunovādakasammuti
analyzed: aham vinaya kammam karomi mayham vattam mā karotha mā mama gāma pavesanam āpucchatha ati  sace evam vutte pi karontiyā iva vārita kālato paṭṭhāya karontesu pi anāpatti bhikkhunovādaka sammuti
translated: “I am doing a legal procedure. Do not do the duties for me. Do not ask me to enter the village.”🔽If they still do, then from the time of being refused, there is no offense in doing it.

original: nāma ādhipaccaṭṭhānabhūtāti paṭikkhittā, tasmā bhikkhusaṅghassa vattabbaṃ – “bhante,
analyzed: nāma ādhi paccaṭṭhāna bhūtā ati paṭikkhittā tasmā bhikkhu saṅghassa vattabbam bhante
translated: The consent to be the instructor of the nuns: because it is a position of authority, it is prohibited. He should therefore tell the Sangha of monks,🔽“Venerables,

original: ahaṃ vinayakammaṃ karomi, bhikkhunovādakaṃ jānāthā”ti, paṭibalassa vā bhikkhussa
analyzed: aham vinaya kammam karomi bhikkhuno vādakam jānātha ati paṭibalassa vā bhikkhussa
translated: I am doing a legal procedure. Please note that I am the instructor of the nuns.” Or he should make it the responsibility of a monk who is capable.

original: bhāro kātabbo. Āgatā bhikkhuniyo “saṅghasantikaṃ gacchatha, saṅgho vo ovādadāyakaṃ
analyzed: bhāraḥ kātabbaḥ āgatāḥ bhikkhuniyaḥ saṅgha santikam gacchatha saṅghaḥ vaḥ ovāda dāyakam
translated: When the nuns come, he should tell them, “Go to the Sangha of monks. The Sangha of monks will give you an instructor.

original: jānissatī”ti vā “ahaṃ vinayakammaṃ karomi, asukabhikkhussa nāma santikaṃ gacchatha,
analyzed: jānissati iti vā aham vinaya kammam karomi asuka bhikkhussa nāma santikam gacchatha
translated: “She will know.” Or: “I’m doing a legal procedure. Go to so-and-so.

original: so vo ovādaṃ dassatī”ti vā vattabbā.
analyzed: saḥ vaḥ ovādam dassati iti vā vattabbā
translated: He will give you advice.”

original: Sā āpattīti sukkavissaṭṭhiyā parivāse dinne sukkavissaṭṭhi nāpajjitabbā. Aññā vā🔽tādisikāti kāyasaṃsaggādigarukāpatti. Tato vā pāpiṭṭhatarāti pārājikāpatti; sattasu🔽hi āpattīsu dubbhāsitāpatti pāpiṭṭhā; dukkaṭāpatti pāpiṭṭhatarā; dukkaṭāpatti pāpiṭṭhā,
analyzed: sā āpatti iti sukka vissaṭṭhiyā parivāse dinne sukka vissaṭṭhi na āpajjitabbā aññā vā  tādisikā ati kāya saṃsagga ādi garuka āpatti tatas vā pāpiṭṭhatarā ati pārājika āpatti sattasu  hi āpattīsu dubbhāsita āpatti pāpiṭṭhā dukkaṭa āpatti pāpiṭṭhatarā dukkaṭa āpatti pāpiṭṭhā
translated: The offense: when probation for a case of emission of semen has been given, one should not commit an offense entailing suspension.🔽Or a similar offense: a serious offense such as physical contact.🔽Or a more serious offense: a offense entailing expulsion. For among the seven classes of offenses, the offense of wrong speech is the least serious; the offense of wrong doing is more serious; the offense of wrong doing is less serious;

original: pāṭidesanīyāpatti pāpiṭṭhatarāti evaṃ pācittiyathullaccayasaṅghādisesapārājikāpattīsu
analyzed: evam pācittiya thullaccaya saṅgha ādisesa pārājika āpattīsu
translated: the offense entailing acknowledgment is more serious. In this way, the offense entailing confession, the serious offense, the offense entailing suspension, and the offense entailing expulsion should be understood.

original: nayo netabbo. Tāsaṃ vatthūsupi dubbhāsitavatthu pāpiṭṭhaṃ, dukkaṭavatthu pāpiṭṭhataranti
analyzed: nayaḥ netabbo tāsam vatthūsu pi dubbhāsita vatthu pāpiṭṭham dukkaṭa vatthu pāpiṭṭhataranti
translated: And also in the cases of the bases for these offenses, the base for the offense of wrong speech is the least serious; the base for the offense of wrong doing is more serious.

original: purimanayeneva bhedo veditabbo. Paṇṇattivajjasikkhāpade pana vatthupi āpattipi pāpiṭṭhā.
analyzed: purima nayena iva bhedaḥ veditabbaḥ paṇṇatti vajja sikkhāpade pana āpatti pi
translated: The distinction should be understood in the same way as above. But in the case of the training rule on the offense entailing acknowledgment that is a breach of a rule, both the base and the offense are serious.

original: Lokavajje ubhayampi pāpiṭṭhataraṃ.
analyzed: lokavajje ubhayam pi pāpiṭṭhataram
translated: In the case of the offense entailing acknowledgment that is a natural offense, both are more serious.

original: Kammanti parivāsakammavācā vuccati. Taṃ kammaṃ “akataṃ dukkaṭa”ntiādīhi vā “kiṃ idaṃ🔽kammaṃ nāma kasikammaṃ gorakkhakamma”ntiādīhi vā vacanehi na garahitabbaṃ. Kammikāti
analyzed: kamman ti parivāsa kamma vācā vuccati tam kammam akatam dukkaṭa nti ādīhi vā kim idam  kammam nāma kasi kammam gorakkha kamman ti ādīhi vā vacanehi na garahitabbam kammikā ati
translated: “The transaction”: the announcement of the transaction of probation is what is meant. That transaction should not be criticized with such words as “It’s invalid, badly done, it should be done again.”

original: yehi bhikkhūhi kammaṃ kataṃ, te vuccanti, te “bālā abyattā”tiādīhi vacanehi na garahitabbā.
analyzed: yehi bhikkhūhi kammam katam te vuccanti te bālāḥ abyattā ati ādīhi vacanehi na garahitabbā
translated: “The monks who did the transaction”: the monks by whom the transaction was done should not be criticized with such words as “They’re ignorant, incompetent, they’re a pack of fools, they’re not fit for the Buddha’s Dispensation.”

original: Na savacanīyaṃ kātabbanti palibodhatthāya vā pakkosanatthāya vā savacanīyaṃ na kātabbaṃ,
analyzed: na savacanīyam kātabbanti palibodha tthāya vā pakkosana tthāya vā savacanīyam na kātabbam
translated: “No motion should be made”: no motion should be made for the purpose of obstructing or for the purpose of summoning.

original: palibodhatthāya hi karonto “ahaṃ āyasmantaṃ imasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ savacanīyaṃ karomi,
analyzed: palibodha atthāya hi karontaḥ aham āyasmantam imasmim vatthusmim savacanīyam karomi
translated: For if one makes a motion for the purpose of obstructing, one does so saying, “I make a motion for the purpose of obstructing Venerable so-and-so in this case.

original: imamhā āvāsā ekapadampi mā pakkāmi, yāva na taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasantaṃ hotī”ti evaṃ
analyzed: imamhāḥ āvāsāḥ ekapadam pi mā yāva na tam adhikaraṇam vūpasantam hoti iti evam
translated: He should not go outside the monastery grounds even for the sake of a single step until that legal issue is resolved.”

original: karoti. Pakkosanatthāya karonto “ahaṃ te savacanīyaṃ karomi, ehi mayā saddhiṃ vinayadharānaṃ
analyzed: karoti pakkosana tthāya karontaḥ aham te savacanīyam karomi ehi mayā saddhim
translated: If one makes a motion for the purpose of summoning, one does so saying, “I make a motion for the purpose of summoning you. Come along with me to the presence of the legal experts in the Monastic Law.

original: sammukhībhāvaṃ gacchāmā”ti evaṃ karoti; tadubhayampi na kātabbaṃ.
analyzed: sammukhībhāvam gacchāma iti evam karoti tat ubhayam pi na kātabbam
translated: Both of these should not be done.

original: Na anuvādoti vihāre jeṭṭhakaṭṭhānaṃ na kātabbaṃ. Pātimokkhuddesakena vā dhammajjhesakena
analyzed: na anuvādaḥ ti vihāre jeṭṭhaka ṭṭhānam na kātabbam pātimokkha uddesakena vā dhamma jjhesakena
translated: He should not be given the position of senior in the monastery.🔽He should not be the reciter of the Monastic Code or the expert on the Monastic Law.

original: vā na bhavitabbaṃ. Nāpi terasasu sammutīsu ekasammutivasenāpi issariyakammaṃ kātabbaṃ.
analyzed: vā na bhavitabbam na api terasasu sammutīsu eka sammuti vasena api issariya kammam kātabbam
translated: He should not exercise authority over any of the thirteen kinds of legal issues.

original: Na okāsoti “karotu me āyasmā okāsaṃ, ahaṃ taṃ vattukāmo”ti evaṃ pakatattassa okāso
analyzed: na okāsaḥ iti karotu me āyasmai okāsam aham tam vattu kāmo ti evam pakatattassa okāsaḥ
translated: He should not be given leave in the way beginning, ‘Venerable, please give me leave. I wish to correct you.’

original: na kāretabbo, vatthunā vā āpattiyā vā na codetabbo, “ayaṃ pubbe te doso”ti na sāretabbo.
analyzed: na kāretabbaḥ vatthunā vā āpattiyā vā na codetabbaḥ ayam pubbe te dosaḥ ti na sāretabbaḥ
translated: He should not accuse anyone of an offense or a failure in morality. He should not remind anyone of a past event.

original: Na bhikkhūhi sampayojetabbanti aññamaññaṃ yojetvā kalaho na kāretabbo.
analyzed: na bhikkhūhi sampayojetabbanti aññam aññam yojetvā kalahaḥ na kāretabbaḥ
translated: He should not associate with the monks. He should not create schism by associating with some and not with others.

original: Puratoti saṅghattherena hutvā purato na gantabbaṃ, dvādasahatthaṃ upacāraṃ muñcitvā🔽ekakena gantabbaṃ. Nisīdanepi eseva nayo. Āsanapariyantoti bhattaggādīsu saṅghanavakāsanaṃ
analyzed: puratas ti saṅghattherena hutvā puratas na gantabbam dvādasa hattham upacāram muñcitvā  ekakena gantabbam nisīdane pi esā iva nayaḥ āsana pariyantaḥ iti bhattagga ādīsu saṅgha navaka āsanam
translated: In front: he should not go in front of the senior monk of the Sangha. He should go after leaving a space of twelve meters.🔽The same applies to sitting. The end of the seats: the best seat in the refectory, etc.,

original: vuccati; svāssa dātabbo, tattha nisīditabbaṃ. Seyyāpariyantoti seyyānaṃ pariyanto,
analyzed: vuccati tattha nisīditabbam seyyā pariyanto ti seyyānam pariyanto
translated: is said to be the end of the seats. He should be given that seat and he should sit there. The end of the beds: the end of the beds🔽is

original: sabbalāmakaṃ mañcapīṭhaṃ. Ayañhi vassaggena attano pattaṭṭhāne seyyaṃ gahetuṃ na🔽labhati. Sabbabhikkhūhi vicinitvā gahitāvasesā maṅkulagūthabharitā vettalatādivinaddhā🔽lāmakaseyyā assa dātabbā. Vihārapariyantoti yathā ca seyyā, evaṃ vasanaāvāsopi vassaggena🔽attano pattaṭṭhāne tassa na vaṭṭati. Sabbabhikkhūhi vicinitvā gahitāvasesā pana rajohatabhūmi
analyzed: mañca pīṭham ayan hi vassaggena attano pattaṭṭhāne seyyam gahetum na  labhati sabba bhikkhūhi vicinitvā gahita avasesā maṅkula gūtha bharitā vetta latā ādi vinaddhā  lāmaka seyyā assa dātabbā vihāra pariyanto ti yathā ca seyyā evam vasana āvāsaḥ api vassaggena  attano pattaṭṭhāne tassa na vaṭṭati sabba bhikkhūhi vicinitvā gahita avasesā pana rajaḥ hata bhūmi
translated: The bed and chair are to be damp. For the one who has entered for the Rains is not allowed to take a bed in his own place. He should be given a damp bed, covered with a leaf-spray or something similar, that is left over after all the other bhikkhus have chosen. “The end of the dwelling” : and as with the bed, so with the dwelling. The one who has entered for the Rains is not allowed to take a dwelling in his own place. But he may be given a dwelling that is left over after all the other bhikkhus have chosen, the floor of which is dusty with the dirt of feet.

original: jatukamūsikabharitā paṇṇasālā assa dātabbā. Sace pakatattā sabbe rukkhamūlikā abbhokāsikā🔽ca honti, channaṃ na upenti, sabbepi etehi vissaṭṭhāvāsā nāma honti. Tesu yaṃ icchati,🔽taṃ labhati. Vassūpanāyikadivase paccayaṃ ekapasse ṭhatvā vassaggena gaṇhituṃ labhati.
analyzed: jatuka mūsika bharitā paṇṇa sālā assa dātabbā sace pakatattā sabbe rukkhamūlikā abbhokāsikā 🔽ca honti channam na upenti sabbe pi etehi vissaṭṭha āvāsāḥ nāma honti tesu yam icchati 🔽tam labhati vassūpanāyika divase paccayam eka passe ṭhatvā vassaggena gaṇhitum labhati
translated: The bed and bench are damp. For the resident monk is not allowed to take a bed and bench in his own place. He should be given a damp bed and bench that are left over after the resident monks have chosen. They may be covered with a thatch of leaves and be filled with damp bedding. The surrounding area: just as with the bed and bench, so too with the dwelling. The resident monk is not allowed to take a dwelling in his own place. He should be given a dwelling that is left over after the resident monks have chosen. It may be a leaf hut with a dusty floor, filled with mouse-droppings. If all the resident monks are by nature forest-dwellers, open-air dwellers, and tree-dwellers, and if there is no dwelling that they could use, then they should give him one of their own dwellings. On the invitation day, he should take it after the invitation ceremony, standing to one side.

original: Senāsanaṃ na labhati, nibaddhavassāvāsikaṃ senāsanaṃ gaṇhitukāmena vattaṃ nikkhipitvā gahetabbaṃ.
analyzed: senāsanam na labhati nibaddha vassāvāsikam senāsanam gaṇhitu kāmena vattam nikkhipitvā gahetabbam
translated: If he does not get a dwelling, he should take one that is assigned for the Rains-residence, after first relinquishing his turn.

original: Tena ca so sāditabboti yaṃ assa āsanādipariyantaṃ bhikkhū denti, so eva sāditabbo.🔽Puresamaṇena vā pacchāsamaṇena vāti ñātipavāritaṭṭhāne “ettake bhikkhū gahetvā āgacchathā”ti🔽nimantitena “bhante, asukaṃ nāma kulaṃ bhikkhū nimantesi, etha tattha gacchāmā”ti
analyzed: tena ca so sāditabbo ti yam assa āsana ādi pariyantam bhikkhū denti saḥ eva sāditabbo  puresamaṇena vā pacchāsamaṇena vā ati ñāti pavārita ṭṭhāne ettake bhikkhū gahetvā āgacchatha ati  nimantitena bhante asukam nāma kulam bhikkhū nimantesi etha tattha gacchāma ati
translated: And he should accept it: he should accept whatever the monks give him, beginning with a seat.🔽Nor should he go with a monk either as the senior or as the junior: if he is invited to a place where relatives are waiting, saying, “Take so-and-so many monks,”

original: evaṃ saṃvidhāya bhikkhū puresamaṇe vā pacchāsamaṇe vā katvā na gantabbaṃ. “Bhante,🔽asukasmiṃ nāma gāme manussā bhikkhūnaṃ āgamanaṃ icchanti, sādhu vatassa sace tesaṃ
analyzed: evam saṃvidhāya bhikkhū puresamaṇe vā pacchāsamaṇe vā katvā na gantabbam bhante  asukasmin nāma gāme manussāḥ bhikkhūnaṃ āgamanam icchanti sādhu vatassa sace tesam
translated: he should not go there after arranging with the monks, saying, “Venerable sirs, such-and-such a family has invited monks, let us go there.”

original: saṅgahaṃ kareyyāthā”ti evaṃ pana pariyāyena kathetuṃ vaṭṭati.
analyzed: saṅgaham kareyyātha iti evam pana pariyāyena kathetum vaṭṭati
translated: But it is allowable to talk in this way by turns: “Venerable sirs, in such-and-such a village or town the people want monks to come, it would be good if you would help them by going.”

original: Na āraññikaṅganti āgatāgatānaṃ ārocetuṃ harāyamānena āraññikadhutaṅgaṃ na samādātabbaṃ.
analyzed: na āraññika aṅgam iti āgata āgatānam ārocetum harāyamānena āraññika dhutaṅgam na samādātabbam
translated: Nor should he undertake the ascetic practice of the forest-dweller: if he is ashamed to inform those who come from time to time, he should not undertake the ascetic practice of the forest-dweller.

original: Yenāpi pakatiyā samādinnaṃ, tena dutiyaṃ bhikkhuṃ gahetvā araññe aruṇaṃ uṭṭhāpetabbaṃ,
analyzed: yena api pakatiyā samādinnam tena dutiyam bhikkhum gahetvā araññe aruṇam uṭṭhāpetabbam
translated: If he has already undertaken it as a normal practice, then he should take a second monk and make the dawn break in the forest with him.

original: na ca ekakena vatthabbaṃ. Tathā bhattaggādīsu āsanapariyante nisajjāya harāyamānena
analyzed: na ca ekakena vatthabbam tathā bhattagga ādīsu āsana pariyante nisajjāya harāyamānena
translated: And he should not live alone. So too, if he is ashamed to sit down on a seat at the end of the meal, etc.,

original: piṇḍapātikadhutaṅgampi na samādātabbaṃ. Yo pana pakatiyāva piṇḍapātiko tassa paṭisedho natthi.
analyzed: piṇḍapātika dhutaṅgam pi na samādātabbam yaḥ pana pakatiyā vā piṇḍapātiko tassa paṭisedhaḥ natthi
translated: he should not undertake the alms-food-eater’s practice. But if he is normally an alms-food eater, there is no offence.

original: Na ca tappaccayāti “nīhaṭabhatto hutvā vihāreyeva nisīditvā bhuñjanto rattiyo gaṇayissāmi,
analyzed: na ca tad paccayā ati nīhaṭa bhattaḥ hutvā vihāreya iva nisīditvā bhuñjantaḥ rattiyaḥ gaṇayissāmi
translated: “Not because of that” means that he should not bring back alms food because of thinking, “I will sit in the monastery and count the nights until my stomach is empty.”

original: gacchato me bhikkhuṃ disvā anārocentassa ratticchedo siyā”ti iminā kāraṇena piṇḍapāto🔽na nīharāpetabbo. Mā maṃ jāniṃsūti “mā maṃ ekabhikkhupi jānātū”ti ca iminā ajjhāsayena
analyzed: gacchataḥ me bhikkhum disvā an ārocentassa ratti chedo siyāti iminā kāraṇena piṇḍapātaḥ  na nīharāpetabbaḥ mā mama jāniṃsu iti mā mama jānātu uti ca iminā ajjhāsayena
translated: If he does so, his observance day is broken.

original: vihāre sāmaṇerehi pacāpetvā bhuñjitumpi na labhati. Gāmaṃ piṇḍāya pavisitabbameva.
analyzed: vihāre sāmaṇerehi pacāpetvā bhuñjitum pi na labhati gāmam piṇḍāya pavisitabbam eva
translated: “So that they may not know me” means that he should not think, “Let no one know me,” and then eat in the monastery after having it cooked by novices. He must enter the village for alms.

original: Gilānassa pana navakammaācariyupajjhāyakiccādipasutassa vā vihāreyeva acchituṃ vaṭṭati.
analyzed: gilānassa pana vā vihāreya iva vaṭṭati
translated: But if he is sick, or if he is busy with building work, or if he is a novice or pupil, or if he is a preceptor or teacher, then he can lie down in the dwelling.

original: Sacepi gāme anekasatā bhikkhū vicaranti, na sakkā hoti ārocetuṃ, gāmakāvāsaṃ gantvā
analyzed: sace pi gāme aneka satāḥ bhikkhū vicaranti na sakkā hoti ārocetum gāmaka āvāsam gantvā
translated: And even if there are many hundreds of bhikkhus wandering in the village, if it is impossible to inform them, then he should go to the village monastery.

original: sabhāgaṭṭhāne vasituṃ vaṭṭati.
analyzed: sabhā gaṭṭhāne vasitum vaṭṭati
translated: And it is allowable for him to live in a suitable place there.

original: Āgantukenāti kañci vihāraṃ gatena tattha bhikkhūnaṃ ārocetabbaṃ. Sace sabbe ekaṭṭhāne🔽ṭhite passati, ekaṭṭhāne ṭhiteneva ārocetabbaṃ. Atha rukkhamūlādīsu visuṃ visuṃ ṭhitā🔽honti, tattha tattha gantvā ārocetabbaṃ. Sañcicca anārocentassa ratticchedo ca hoti,
analyzed: āgantukena ati kañci vihāram gatena tattha bhikkhūnam ārocetabbam sace sabbe ekaṭṭhāne  ṭhite passati eka ṭṭhāne ṭhitena iva ārocetabbam atha rukkha mūla ādīsu visum visum ṭhitā  honti tattha tattha gantvā ārocetabbam sañcicca an ārocentassa ratti chedo ca hoti
translated: ‘A newly arrived bhikkhu’: one who has gone to some monastery. He should inform the bhikkhus there. If all the bhikkhus are in one place,🔽he should inform them while he is still in the open. But if they are in different places, in the foot of a tree, etc.,🔽he should go to each place and inform them. If he does not inform them on purpose, he breaks his observance-day ceremony and commits an offense for groundlessly breaking a rule.

original: vattabhede ca dukkaṭaṃ. Atha vicinanto ekacce na passati, ratticchedova hoti, na vattabhedadukkaṭaṃ.
analyzed: vatta bhede ca dukkaṭam atha vicinantaḥ ekacce na passati ratti chedaḥ uva hoti na vatta bheda dukkaṭam
translated: But if he does not see some of them while he is looking for them, he breaks only the observance-day ceremony, not the rule.

original: Āgantukassāti attano vasanavihāraṃ āgatassāpi ekassa vā bahūnaṃ vā vuttanayeneva
analyzed: āgantukassa ati attanaḥ vasana vihāram āgatassa api ekassa vā bahūnam vā vutta nayena iva
translated: ‘A bhikkhu who has arrived’: if he has come to his own monastery, whether he is alone or in a group, he should inform the bhikkhus there in the way already described.

original: ārocetabbaṃ. Ratticchedavattabhedāpi cettha vuttanayeneva veditabbā. Sace āgantukā
analyzed: ārocetabbam ratti cheda vatta bhedā api ca ittha vutta nayena iva veditabbā sace āgantukā
translated: And the distinction between the end of the night and the end of the announcement should be understood in the way already described.🔽If the visitors

original: muhuttaṃ vissamitvā vā avissamitvā eva vā vihāramajjhena gacchanti, tesampi ārocetabbaṃ.
analyzed: muhuttam vissamitvā vā a vissamitvā eva vā vihāra majjhena gacchanti tesam pi ārocetabbam
translated: go through the middle of the monastery either after taking a brief rest or without doing so, they should be announced.

original: Sace tassa ajānantasseva gacchanti, ayañca pana gatakāle jānāti, gantvā ārocetabbaṃ.
analyzed: sace tassa a jānantassa iva gacchanti ayaṃ ca pana gata kāle jānāti gantvā ārocetabbam
translated: If they go without his knowing, but he finds out while they are on their way, he should go and announce them.

original: Sampāpuṇituṃ asakkontassa ratticchedova hoti, na vattabhedadukkaṭaṃ. Yepi antovihāraṃ🔽appavisitvā upacārasīmaṃ okkamitvā gacchanti, ayañca nesaṃ chattasaddaṃ vā ukkāsitasaddaṃ
analyzed: sampāpuṇitum a sakkontassa ratti chedaḥ u va hoti na vatta bheda dukkaṭam ye pi antovihāram  appavisitvā upacāra sīmam okkamitvā gacchanti ayam ca nesam chatta saddam vā ukkāsita saddam
translated: If he is unable to reach them, there is an end of the night, but no offense of wrong-doing for the end of the announcement.

original: vā khipitasaddaṃ vā sutvāva āgantukabhāvaṃ jānāti, gantvā ārocetabbaṃ. Gatakāle jānantenapi
analyzed: vā khipita saddam vā sutvā āva āgantuka bhāvam jānāti gantvā ārocetabbam gata kāle jānantena api
translated: If they go out of the monastery and enter the zone of influence without visiting inside the monastery, and if he finds out that they are visitors by hearing the sound of their parasol or the sound of their clearing their throat or the sound of their snapping their fingers, he should go and announce them. If he finds out after they have gone,

original: anubandhitvā ārocetabbameva. Sampāpuṇituṃ asakkontassa ratticchedova hoti, na vattabhedadukkaṭaṃ.
analyzed: anubandhitvā ārocetabbam eva sampāpuṇitum a sakkontassa ratti chedaḥ u va hoti na vatta bheda dukkaṭam
translated: he should follow them and announce them. If he is unable to reach them, there is an end of the night, but no offense of wrong-doing for the end of the announcement.

original: Yopi rattiṃyeva āgantvā rattiṃyeva gacchati, sopissa ratticchedaṃ karoti, aññātattā🔽pana vattabhedadukkaṭaṃ natthi. Sace ajānitvāva abbhānaṃ karoti, akatameva hotīti
analyzed: yaḥ api rattiṃya iva āgantvā rattiṃya iva gacchati saḥ upissa ratti chedam karoti aññāta ttā  pana vatta bheda dukkaṭam natthi sace a jānitvā ava abbhānam karoti a katam eva hoti iti
translated: If he comes at night and goes at night, he breaks the continuity of the night. But because he does not know, there is no offence for the breach of the rule.🔽If he gives the invitation ceremony without knowing, it is as if it were not done. So it is said in the Kurundī story.

original: kurundiyaṃ vuttaṃ. Tasmā adhikā rattiyo gahetvā kātabbaṃ, ayaṃ apaṇṇakapaṭipadā.🔽Nadīādīsu nāvāya gacchantampi paratīre ṭhitampi ākāsena gacchantampi pabbatatalaaraññādīsu
analyzed: kurundiyam vuttam tasmai adhikāḥ rattiyaḥ gahetvā kātabbam ayam apaṇṇaka paṭipadā  nadī ādīsu nāvāya gacchantam pi para tīre ṭhitam pi ākāsena gacchantam pi pabbata tala arañña ādīsu
translated: Therefore, taking the extra nights, it should be done. This is the course of action that is free from perplexity.🔽If he sees a bhikkhu going in a boat on a river, etc., or standing on the other bank, or going through the air, or standing far away on a mountain top, in the forest, etc.,

original: dūre ṭhitampi bhikkhuṃ disvā sace “bhikkhū”ti vavatthānaṃ atthi, nāvādīhi vā gantvā🔽mahāsaddaṃ katvā vā vegena anubandhitvā vā ārocetabbaṃ, anārocentassa ratticchedo
analyzed: dūre ṭhitam pi bhikkhum disvā sace bhikkhu iti vavatthānam atthi vā gantvā  mahā saddam katvā vā vegena anubandhitvā vā ārocetabbam an ārocentassa ratti chedo
translated: if there is a boundary that is defined as “bhikkhus,” or if he goes by boat, etc.,🔽or if he makes a great noise or quickly follows and announces it, there is a breach of the continuity of the night and an offence for the breach of the rule.

original: ceva vattabhedadukkaṭañca. Sace vāyamantopi sampāpuṇituṃ vā sāvetuṃ vā na sakkoti,
analyzed: ca iva vatta bheda dukkaṭam ca sace vā āyamantaḥ api sampāpuṇitum vā sāvetum vā na sakkoti
translated: If he is unable to reach him or to announce it to him,

original: ratticchedova hoti, na vattabhedadukkaṭaṃ. Saṅghasenābhayatthero pana visayāvisayena
analyzed: na vatta bheda dukkaṭam pana visaya avisayena
translated: there is only a breach of the continuity of the night, not an offence for the breach of the rule. But the Elder Saṅghasaṃvara said that it should be done according to the place,

original: katheti – “visaye kira anārocentassa ratticchedo ceva vattabhedadukkaṭañca hoti,🔽avisaye pana ubhayampi natthī”ti. Karavīkatissatthero “samaṇo ayanti vavatthānameva
analyzed: kathā iti visaye kira an ārocentassa ratti chedo ca iva vatta bheda dukkaṭam ca hoti  avisaye pana ubhayam pi natthi iti karavīkatissa theraḥ samaṇaḥ ayanti vavatthānam eva
translated: He says: “If one does not inform in a region, there is a breach of the rule and a wrong-doing in breaking the continuity of the observance day.

original: pamāṇaṃ, sacepi avisayo hoti, vattabhedadukkaṭameva natthi, ratticchedo pana hotiyevā”ti āha.🔽Uposatheti “uposathaṃ sampāpuṇissāmā”ti āgantukā bhikkhū āgacchanti, iddhiyā gacchantāpi
analyzed: pamāṇam sace pi avisayaḥ hoti vatta bheda dukkaṭam eva natthi ratti chedo pana āha  uposatheti uposatham sampāpuṇissāma ati āgantukāḥ bhikkhū āgacchanti iddhiyā gacchantā api
translated: But if it is not a region, there is neither.” The elder Karavīkatissa said: “The definition of ‘a monk’ is the measure. Even if it is not a region, there is no breach of the rule and no wrong-doing in breaking the continuity of the observance day, but there is a breach of the observance day.”🔽On the observance day: if incoming monks come thinking, “We will keep the observance day,” and if they go by supernormal power,

original: uposathabhāvaṃ ñatvā otaritvā uposathaṃ karonti, tasmā āgantukasodhanatthaṃ uposathadivase🔽ārocetabbaṃ. Pavāraṇāyapi eseva nayo. Gilānoti gantuṃ asamattho. Dūtenāti ettha anupasampannaṃ🔽pesetuṃ na vaṭṭati, bhikkhuṃ pesetvā ārocāpetabbaṃ.
analyzed: uposatha bhāvam ñatvā otaritvā uposatham karonti tasmai āgantuka sodhana attham uposatha divase  ārocetabbam esā iva nayaḥ gilānaḥ iti gantum asamatthaḥ dūtena ati ettha anupasampannam  pesetum na vaṭṭati bhikkhum pesetvā ārocāpetabbam
translated: they know the observance day and they descend and keep the observance day. Therefore on the observance day it should be announced for the purpose of clearing up the incoming monks.🔽The same method applies to the invitation ceremony. Sick: unable to go. By messenger: here it is not allowable to send an unrelated nun.🔽One should send a monk and have him announce it.

original: Abhikkhuko āvāsoti suññavihāro; yattha ekopi bhikkhu natthi, tattha vāsatthāya na
analyzed: abhikkhukaḥ āvāsaḥ ti suñña vihāro yattha ekaḥ api bhikkhu na atthi tattha vāsa tthāya na
translated: A monastery outside the boundary: an empty dwelling where there is not even one monk. For the purpose of staying there, one should announce it.

original: gantabbaṃ. Na hi tattha vuttharattiyo gaṇanūpikā honti, pakatattena pana saddhiṃ🔽vaṭṭati. Dasavidhantarāye pana sacepi rattiyo gaṇanūpikā na honti, antarāyato parimuccanatthāya
analyzed: gantabbam na hi tattha vuttha rattiyaḥ gaṇa nūpikāḥ honti pakata ttena pana saddhim  vaṭṭati dasavidha antarāye pana sace pi rattiyaḥ gaṇa nūpikāḥ na honti antarāyato parimuccana tthāya
translated: For the nights are not counted there. But it is allowable to go there with a regular monk.🔽But if there are the ten kinds of obstacles, then even though the nights are not counted, still he must go there in order to be free from the obstacles.

original: gantabbameva. Tena vuttaṃ – “aññatra antarāyā”ti. Nānāsaṃvāsakehi saddhiṃ vinayakammaṃ
analyzed: gantabbam eva tena vuttam aññatra antarā āyāti nānā saṃvāsakehi saddhim vinaya kammam
translated: That is why it is said, “Except on a (prearranged) day” .

original: kātuṃ na vaṭṭati. Tesaṃ anārocanepi ratticchedo natthi, abhikkhukāvāsasadisameva
analyzed: kātum na vaṭṭati tesam an ārocane pi ratti chedaḥ natthi abhikkhuka āvāsa sadisam eva
translated: It is not allowable to do a legal act with those who belong to a different Buddhist sect. And even though they are not informed, there is no interruption of the night. It is like a monastery outside the boundary.

original: hoti. Tena vuttaṃ – “yatthassu bhikkhū nānāsaṃvāsakā”ti. Sesaṃ uposathakkhandhake vuttanayameva.
analyzed: hoti tena vuttam bhikkhū nānā saṃvāsakā ti sesam uposatha khandhake vutta nayam eva
translated: That is why it is said, “Where there are monks belonging to a different Buddhist sect” . The rest is as stated in the Khandhaka .

original: 81. Ekacchanne āvāsetiādīsu āvāso nāma vasanatthāya katasenāsanaṃ. Anāvāso nāma cetiyagharaṃ
analyzed: ekacchanne āvāsa iti ādīsu āvāsaḥ nāma vasana atthāya kata senāsanam anāvāsaḥ nāma cetiya gharam
translated: In the case of “in a monastery with a closed door” , etc., a monastery is a building made for the purpose of living in. A non- monastery is a shrine,

original: bodhigharaṃ sammuñjaniaṭṭako dāruaṭṭako pānīyamāḷo vaccakuṭi dvārakoṭṭhakoti evamādi.
analyzed: bodhigharam sammuñjaniaṭṭakaḥ dāruaṭṭakaḥ pānīyamāḷaḥ vaccakuṭi dvārakoṭṭhakaḥ iti evamādi
translated: a Bodhi-tree house, a meeting hall, a wooden house, a bamboo house, a drinking-hall, a privy, a gateway.

original: Tatiyapadena tadubhayampi gahitaṃ. Etesu yattha katthaci ekacchanne chadanato udakapatanaṭṭhānaparicchinne🔽okāse ukkhittako vasituṃ na labhati. “Pārivāsiko pana antoāvāseyeva na labhatī”ti
analyzed: tatiya padena tat ubhayam pi gahitam etesu yattha katthaci eka channe chadanataḥ udaka patana ṭṭhāna paricchinne  okāse ukkhittakaḥ vasitum na labhati pārivāsikaḥ pana na labhati iti
translated: If it is a place where the water falls and is confined, and is covered over anywhere at all, then one who is on probation is not allowed to live there.🔽But in the Mahāpaccariya it is said, “One on probation is not allowed to live in the same monastery.”

original: mahāpaccariyaṃ vuttaṃ. Mahāaṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana “avisesena udakapātena vārita”nti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: mahāpaccariyam vuttam mahāaṭṭhakathāyam pana avisesena udaka pātena vāritan ti vuttam
translated: But in the Mahāaṭṭhakathā it is said, “Without distinction, he is prevented by the water-strainer.”

original: Kurundiyaṃ “etesu ettakesu pañcavaṇṇacchadanabaddhaṭṭhānesu pārivāsikassa ca ukkhittakassa🔽ca pakatattena saddhiṃ udakapātena vārita”nti vuttaṃ. Tasmā nānūpacārepi ekacchanne
analyzed: kurundiyam etesu ettakesu pañcavaṇṇa chadana baddha ṭṭhānesu pārivāsikassa ca ukkhittakassa  ca pakatattena saddhim udaka pātena vāritan ti vuttam tasmā na anūpacāre pi eka channe
translated: In the Kurundi it is said, “In these five-coloured-cloth-joined places, one on probation and one who is suspended🔽are prevented by the water-strainer together with the regular monk.”🔽Therefore it is not allowed in a place that is covered over even if it is not the same enclosure.

original: na vaṭṭati. Sace panettha tadahupasampannepi pakatatte paṭhamaṃ pavisitvā nipanne
analyzed: na vaṭṭati sace pana ittha tad aha upasampanne api pakatatte paṭhamam pavisitvā nipanne
translated: But if a regular monk enters first and lies down on the day of the probationer’s admission,

original: saṭṭhivassopi pārivāsiko pacchā pavisitvā jānanto nipajjati, ratticchedo ceva vattabhedadukkaṭañca.
analyzed: saṭṭhivassaḥ api pārivāsiko pacchā pavisitvā jānantaḥ nipajjati ratti chedo ca iva vatta bheda dukkaṭaṃ ca
translated: and if the probationer, even if he is sixty years old, enters afterwards and lies down knowingly, then the night should be reckoned as broken and he is also dukkaṭa for schism.

original: Ajānantassa ratticchedova na vattabhedadukkaṭaṃ. Sace pana tasmiṃ paṭhamaṃ nipanne
analyzed: a jānantassa na vatta bheda dukkaṭam sace pana tasmin paṭhamam nipanne
translated: If he does not know, there is no offense for breaking the rule of the night. But if the regular monk lies down first

original: pacchā pakatatto pavisitvā nipajjati, pārivāsiko ca jānāti, ratticchedo ceva vattabhedadukkaṭañca.
analyzed: pacchā pakatatto pavisitvā nipajjati pārivāsiko ca jānāti ratti chedo ca iva vatta bheda dukkaṭam ca
translated: and the probationer enters and lies down afterwards, and the probationer knows, there is breaking of the rule of the night and an offense of wrong conduct for breaking the rule.

original: No ce jānāti, ratticchedova na vattabhedadukkaṭaṃ.
analyzed: no ce jānāti na vatta bheda dukkaṭam
translated: If he does not know, there is breaking of the rule of the night, but no offense of wrong conduct.

original: Vuṭṭhātabbaṃ nimantetabboti tadahupasampannampi disvā vuṭṭhātabbameva; vuṭṭhāya ca🔽“ahaṃ iminā sukhanisinno vuṭṭhāpito”ti parammukhena na gantabbaṃ, “idaṃ ācariya-āsanaṃ,
analyzed: vuṭṭhātabbam nimantetabbaḥ uti tad ah upasampannam pi disvā vuṭṭhātabbam eva vuṭṭhāya ca  aham iminā sukha nisinnaḥ vuṭṭhāpito ti parammukhena na gantabbam idam ācariya āsanam
translated: He should get up and invite: even if he sees someone who was given full ordination on the same day, he should get up. And🔽he should not go, thinking, “I was made to get up by this one who is sitting comfortably.” He should invite him, saying, “This is the teacher’s seat.

original: ettha nisīdathā”ti evaṃ nimantetabboyeva. Navakena pana “mahātheraṃ obaddhaṃ karomī”ti🔽pārivāsikattherassa santikaṃ na gantabbaṃ. Ekāsaneti samānavassikāsane mañce vā pīṭhe
analyzed: ettha nisīdatha ati evam navakena pana mahā theram obaddham karomi iti  pārivāsika therassa santikam na gantabbam eka āsane ti samāna vassika āsane mañce vā pīṭhe
translated: Please sit here.” But the junior monk should not go to the senior probationer, thinking, “I’ll make him my superior.”🔽On the same seat: on the same seat according to year of ordination, on the same bed or bench.

original: vā. Na chamāyaṃ nisinneti pakatatte bhūmiyaṃ nisinne itarena antamaso tiṇasanthārepi
analyzed: vā na nisinnā iti pakatatte bhūmiyam nisinne itarena tiṇa santhāre pi
translated: Not sitting on the ground: if the regular monk is sitting on the ground, the probationer should not sit on grass or straw,

original: uccatare vālikātalepi vā na nisīditabbaṃ, dvādasahatthaṃ pana upacāraṃ muñcitvā nisīdituṃ
analyzed: uccatare vālikā tale pi vā na nisīditabbam dvādasa hattham pana upacāram muñcitvā nisīditum
translated: He should not sit on a higher sandbank, but he may sit after making a boundary twelve hand spans long.

original: vaṭṭati. Ekacaṅkameti sahāyena viya saddhiṃ caṅkamanto ekasmiṃ caṅkame.
analyzed: vaṭṭati eka caṅkamā iti sahāyena viya saddhim caṅkamantaḥ ekasmin caṅkame
translated: In the same walk means in the same walk as a companion.

original: Chamāyaṃ caṅkamantanti chamāyaṃ caṅkamante, ayameva vā pāṭho. Ayaṃ panettha attho
analyzed: chamāyam caṅkamantanti chamāyam caṅkamante ayam eva vā pāṭhaḥ ayam pana ittha attho
translated: Walking in the open means walking in the open. This is the reading. The meaning is this:

original: – akataparicchedāya bhūmiyā caṅkamante paricchedaṃ katvā vālikaṃ ākiritvā ālambanaṃ
analyzed: a kata paricchedāya bhūmiyā caṅkamante paricchedam katvā vālikam ākiritvā ālambanam
translated: He should not walk in the open without defining a boundary, or after strewing sand, or after fixing a target.

original: yojetvā katacaṅkame nīcepi na caṅkamitabbaṃ, ko pana vādo iṭṭhakācayasampanne vedikāparikkhitteti!
analyzed: yojetvā kata caṅkame nīce pi na caṅkamitabbam kaḥ pana vādaḥ iṭṭhakā caya sampanne vedikā parikkhittā iti
translated: He should not walk even in a low walk that has been made, but what need is there to say more about one that is made of bricks and has a parapet?

original: Sace pana pākāraparikkhitto hoti dvārakoṭṭhakayutto pabbatantaravanantaragumbantaresu
analyzed: sace pana pākāra parikkhittaḥ hoti dvāra koṭṭhaka yutto pabbata antara vana ntara gumba antaresu
translated: But if it is surrounded by a wall with a gatehouse, and is well concealed in the interior of a mountain, a forest, or a thicket,

original: vā suppaṭicchanno, tādise caṅkame caṅkamituṃ vaṭṭati. Appaṭicchannepi upacāraṃ muñcitvā vaṭṭati.
analyzed: vā su paṭicchannaḥ tādise caṅkame caṅkamitum vaṭṭati appaṭicchanne pi upacāram muñcitvā vaṭṭati
translated: it is allowable to walk in such a walk. And if it is not concealed, it is allowable after making a boundary.

original: Vuḍḍhatarenāti ettha sace vuḍḍhatare pārivāsike paṭhamaṃ nipanne itaro jānanto pacchā
analyzed: vuḍḍhatarena ati ettha sace vuḍḍhatare pārivāsike paṭhamam nipanne itaraḥ jānantaḥ pacchā
translated: With one more senior means that if the other, who is more senior, lies down first, the junior should not lie down while knowing.

original: nipajjati, ratticchedo cassa hoti vattabhede ca dukkaṭaṃ. Vuḍḍhatarassa pana ratticchedova
analyzed: nipajjati ratti chedo ca ssa hoti vatta bhede ca dukkaṭam vuḍḍhatarassa pana
translated: If he lies down, his night is interrupted, and there is an offense of wrong conduct for the change of speech. But if the other is more senior, there is only the interruption of the night.

original: na vattabhedadukkaṭaṃ. Ajānitvā nipajjati, dvinnampi vattabhedo natthi, ratticchedo
analyzed: na vatta bheda dukkaṭam a jānitvā nipajjati vatta bhedaḥ natthi ratti chedo
translated: There is no offense of wrong conduct for the change of speech. If he lies down without knowing, there is no interruption of the night for either,

original: pana hoti. Atha navakapārivāsike paṭhamaṃ nipanne vuḍḍhataro pacchā nipajjati, navako
analyzed: pana hoti atha navaka pārivāsike paṭhamam nipanne vuḍḍhataraḥ pacchā nipajjati navakaḥ
translated: but there is an interruption of the night. If the more junior probationer lies down first and the more senior one lies down later,

original: ca jānāti, ratti cassa chijjati, vattabhede ca dukkaṭaṃ hoti. Vuḍḍhatarassa ratticchedova
analyzed: ca jānāti ratti cassa chijjati vatta bhede ca dukkaṭam hoti vuḍḍhatarassa
translated: and the junior one knows, his night is interrupted, and there is an offense of wrong conduct for the change of speech. But if the more senior one lies down, there is only the interruption of the night.

original: na vattabhedo. No ce jānāti, dvinnampi vattabhedo natthi, ratticchedo pana hoti.
analyzed: na vatta bhedaḥ no ce jānāti dvinnam pi vatta bhedaḥ natthi ratti chedo pana hoti
translated: If he does not know, there is no interruption of the night for either, but there is an interruption of the night.

original: Sace dvepi apacchāpurimaṃ nipajjanti, vuḍḍhatarassa ratticchedova itarassa vattabhedopīti
analyzed: sace dve pi a pacchāpurimam nipajjanti vuḍḍhatarassa itarassa vatta bhedaḥ api iti
translated: If they both lie down out of sequence, there is only the interruption of the night for the more senior one, but there is also an offense of wrong conduct for the change of speech for the other.

original: kurundiyaṃ vuttaṃ. Dve pārivāsikā samavassā, eko paṭhamaṃ nipanno, eko jānantova
analyzed: kurundiyam vuttam dve pārivāsikā sama vassāḥ ekaḥ paṭhamam nipannaḥ ekaḥ jānantaḥ eva
translated: This is what is said in the Kurundī story. If two probationers of the same seniority lie down out of sequence, and one knows,

original: pacchā nipajjati, ratti ca chijjati, vattabhede ca dukkaṭaṃ. Paṭhamaṃ nipannassa
analyzed: pacchā nipajjati ca chijjati vatta bhede ca dukkaṭam paṭhamam nipannassa
translated: his night is interrupted, and there is an offense of wrong conduct for the change of speech. But if the other lies down first,

original: ratticchedova na vattabhedo. Sace pacchā nipajjantopi na jānāti, dvinnampi vattabhedo
analyzed: na vatta bhedo sace pacchā nipajjantaḥ api na jānāti vatta bhedo
translated: But the breaking of the night is not a breaking of the instruction. If he does not know when he lies down afterwards, there is no breaking of the instruction for either of them,

original: natthi, ratticchedo pana hoti. Sace dvepi apacchāpurimaṃ nipajjanti, dvinnampi ratticchedoyeva,
analyzed: natthi ratti chedo pana hoti sace dve pi a pacchāpurimam nipajjanti
translated: but there is a breaking of the night. If they both lie down not in the right order, there is a breaking of the night for both,

original: na vattabhedo. Sace hi dve pārivāsikā ekato vaseyyuṃ, te aññamaññassa ajjhācāraṃ
analyzed: na vatta bhedaḥ sace hi dve pārivāsikāḥ ekatas vaseyyum te aññamaññassa ajjhācāram
translated: but no breaking of the instruction. For if two probationers were to live together, then, knowing of each other’s offenses,

original: ñatvā agāravā vā vippaṭisārino vā hutvā pāpiṭṭhataraṃ vā āpattiṃ āpajjeyyuṃ vibbhameyyuṃ
analyzed: ñatvā agāravāḥ vā vippaṭisārinaḥ vā hutvā pāpiṭṭhataram vā āpattim āpajjeyyum vibbhameyyum
translated: they might become disrespectful, remorseful, or commit a heavy offense, or they might disrobe.

original: vā, tasmā nesaṃ sahaseyyā sabbappakārena paṭikkhittā. Sesaṃ vuttanayeneva veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: vā tasmā na īsam sahaseyyā sabba ppakārena paṭikkhittā sesam vutta nayena iva veditabbam
translated: So living together is absolutely prohibited for them. The rest should be understood in the way already described.

original: Mūlāyapaṭikassanārahādayo cettha pārivāsikānaṃ pakatattaṭṭhāne ṭhitāti veditabbā.🔽Pārivāsikacatuttho ce, bhikkhave, parivāsanti ettha pārivāsikaṃ catutthaṃ katvā aññassa
analyzed: ca ittha pārivāsikānam ṭhitā ti veditabbā  pārivāsika catutthaḥ ce bhikkhave parivāsanti ettha pārivāsikam catuttham katvā aññassa
translated: Herein, those deserving to be sent back to the beginning, etc., should be understood as standing in the place of regular monks.

original: parivāsadānādīni kātuṃ na vaṭṭati. Etesvevāyaṃ gaṇapūrako na hoti, sesasaṅghakammesu
analyzed: parivāsa dāna ādīni kātum na vaṭṭati etesu eva ayam gaṇa pūrakaḥ na hoti sesa saṅgha kammesu
translated: “If, bhikkhus, the fourth is on probation” means that it is not allowable to give probation, etc., to anyone else, making a probationer the fourth. He does not complete the quorum in these . In the other acts of the Sangha

original: hoti. Gaṇe pana appahonte vattaṃ nikkhipāpetvā gaṇapūrako kātabboti.
analyzed: hoti gaṇe pana appahonte vattam nikkhipāpetvā gaṇapūrako kātabbo ti
translated: If there are not enough for a chapter, he should be made to do the duties of a chapter member after having the observance-day procedure postponed.

original: 83. Imaṃ pana vattakathaṃ sutvā vinayadharaupālittherassa rahogatassa evaṃ parivitakko
analyzed: imam pana vatta katham sutvā vinaya dhara aupāli ttherassa rahaḥ gatassa evam parivitakkaḥ
translated: But when the Elder Upāli, the master of the Vinaya, heard this discussion on the duties, he had this thought in private:

original: udapādi – “bhagavatā bahu pārivāsikavattaṃ paññattaṃ, katihi nu kho ettha kāraṇehi
analyzed: udapādi bhagavatā bahu pārivāsika vattam paññattam katihi nu kho ettha kāraṇehi
translated: “The Blessed One has laid down many duties for one on probation. For how many reasons🔽is there a break in the observance-day procedure for him?”

original: ratticchedo hotī”ti! So bhagavantaṃ upasaṅkamitvā tamatthaṃ pucchi. Bhagavā cassa🔽byākāsi. Tena vuttaṃ – “atha kho āyasmā upāli…pe… ratticchedā”ti. Tattha sahavāsoti
analyzed: ratti chedaḥ hoti iti saḥ bhagavantam upasaṅkamitvā tam attham pucchi bhagavā ca ssa  tena vuttam atha kho āyasmai upālipe ratti chedā ati tattha sahavāso ti
translated: He went to the Blessed One and asked him the question. The Blessed One

original: yvāyaṃ pakatattena bhikkhunā saddhiṃ ekacchannetiādinā nayena vutto ekato vāso. Vippavāsoti
analyzed: yvā ayam pakatattena bhikkhunā saddhim ekacchanna iti ādinā nayena vuttaḥ ekatas vāsaḥ vippavāso ti
translated: answered him. Hence it was said: “Then the venerable Upāli … a break in the observance-day procedure.” Herein, living together means living together in the same room, etc., as described in the case of the ordinary bhikkhu.

original: ekakasseva vāso. Anārocanāti āgantukādīnaṃ anārocanā. Etesu tīsu ekekena kāraṇena ratticchedo hoti.
analyzed: ekakassa iva vāsaḥ āgantuka ādīnam anārocanā etesu tīsu ekekena kāraṇena ratti chedaḥ hoti
translated: Living separately means living alone. Not informing means not informing the newcomers, etc. A break in the observance-day procedure occurs for one of these three reasons.

original: 84. Na sakkontīti saṅghassa mahantatāya tattha tattha gantvā sabbesaṃ ārocetuṃ asakkontā
analyzed: na sakkonti iti saṅghassa mahanta tāya tattha tattha gantvā sabbesam ārocetum a sakkontā
translated: Not able means not able to go here and there and inform all the bhikkhus because the Sangha is large.

original: sodhetuṃ na sakkonti. Parivāsaṃ nikkhipāmi, vattaṃ nikkhipāmīti imesu dvīsu padesu
analyzed: sodhetum na sakkonti parivāsam nikkhipāmi vattam nikkhipāmi iti imesu dvīsu padesu
translated: If they are unable to purify it, then the probation is relinquished by the two statements, ‘I relinquish the probation’ and ‘I relinquish the duties.’🔽But it is relinquished by either one.

original: ekenāpi nikkhittova hoti parivāso; dvīhi sunikkhittoyeva. Samādānepi eseva nayo.🔽Evaṃ vattaṃ samādiyitvā parivutthaparivāsassa mānattaṃ gaṇhato puna vattasamādānakiccaṃ
analyzed: ekena api nikkhittaḥ uva hoti parivāsaḥ dvīhi su nikkhittaḥ yeva samādāne pi esa iva nayo  evam vattam samādiyitvā parivuttha parivāsassa mānattam gaṇhataḥ puna vatta samādāna kiccam
translated: And so too with the undertaking.🔽When he has undertaken the duties in this way and has then received the trial period after completing the probation, there is no need for him to undertake the duties again.

original: natthi, samādinnavattoyeva hesa tasmāssa chārattaṃ mānattaṃ dātabbaṃ, ciṇṇamānatto
analyzed: natthi ha esa tasma assa chārattam mānattam dātabbam ciṇṇa mānattaḥ
translated: He is one who has undertaken the duties, so the trial period should be given to him for six days. When he has completed the trial period,

original: abbhetabbo. Evaṃ anāpattiko hutvā suddhante patiṭṭhito tisso sikkhā pūretvā dukkhassantaṃ karissatīti.
analyzed: abbhetabbaḥ evam anāpattikaḥ hutvā suddhante patiṭṭhitaḥ tissaḥ sikkhāḥ pūretvā dukkhassantam karissati iti
translated: he should be rehabilitated. Thus he becomes one who has not committed an offense, one who is established in the discipline. He will fulfill the three trainings and make an end of suffering.

original: Pārivāsikavattakathā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: pārivāsika vatta kathā niṭṭhitā
translated: The discussion of the duties of one on probation is finished.

original: Mūlāyapaṭikassanārahavattakathā
analyzed: mūlāya paṭikassanā rahavatta kathā
translated: The discussion of the duties of one deserving to be sent back to the beginning

original: 86. Mūlāyapaṭikassanārahā bhikkhū sādiyanti pakatattānanti ṭhapetvā navakataraṃ mūlāyapaṭikassanārahaṃ
analyzed: mūlāya paṭikassana arahā bhikkhū sādiyanti ṭhapetvā navakataram mūlāya paṭikassana araham
translated: The monks deserving to be sent back to the beginning who consent to the trial period for those deserving to be sent back to the beginning who are junior to them

original: avasesānaṃ antamaso pārivāsikādīnampi. Imesañhi pārivāsikamūlāyapaṭikassanārahamānattārahamānattācārikabbhānārahānaṃ
analyzed: avasesānam antamasaḥ pārivāsika ādīnam pi imesam hi pārivāsika mūlāya paṭikassana araha mānatta āraha mānatta ācārika bbhāna arahānam
translated: and the rest, down to one on probation, etc. For these five, namely, one deserving to be sent back to the beginning, one deserving the probation, one deserving the trial period, one deserving rehabilitation, and one deserving penance,

original: pañcannaṃ ṭhapetvā attano attano navakataraṃ, sesā sabbe pakatattā eva. Kasmā? Mithu
analyzed: pañcannam ṭhapetvā attanaḥ attanaḥ navakataram sesā sabbe pakatattāḥ eva kasmā mithu
translated: are all genuine bhikkhus except for the one who is junior to the one who is junior to the one deserving to be sent back to the beginning.🔽Why? Because it is allowed for them to bow down, etc., according to seniority.

original: yathāvuḍḍhaṃ abhivādanādīnaṃ anuññātattā. Tena vuttaṃ – “avasesānaṃ antamaso pārivāsikādīnampī”ti.
analyzed: yathāvuḍḍham abhivādana ādīnam anuññāta ttā tena vuttam avasesānam antamasaḥ pārivāsika ādīnam pi iti
translated: That is why it was said above: “and the rest, down to one on probation, etc.”

original: Mūlāyapaṭikassanārahādilakkhaṇaṃ pana nesaṃ parato āvibhavissati. Sesamettha ito
analyzed: mūla āya paṭikassanā raha ādi lakkhaṇam pana nesam paratas āvi bhavissati sesam ettha itas
translated: But the characteristics of one deserving to be sent back to the beginning, etc., will be made clear later.

original: paresu ca mānattārahādivattesu pārivāsikavatte vuttanayeneva veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: paresu ca mānatta araha ādi vattesu pārivāsika vatte vutta nayena iva veditabbam
translated: The rest here and in the following sections on one deserving the trial period, etc., should be understood in the way already given under the section on one on probation.🔽In the case of the fourth section on one deserving to be sent back to the beginning, etc., just as one on probation is not a member of a chapter for the transaction of any of the thirteen kinds of formal acts, but he is a member for the remaining kinds of formal acts of the Community,

original: 87. Mūlāyapaṭikassanārahacatuttho cetiādīsupi yatheva pārivāsiko; evaṃ etepi etesu vinayakammesu gaṇapūrakā na honti, sesasaṅghakammesu honti.🔽Mūlāyapaṭikassanārahavattakathā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: ca iti ādīsu pi yathā iva pārivāsikaḥ evam ete api etesu vinaya kammesu gaṇa pūrakāḥ na honti sesa saṅgha kammesu honti  mūlāya paṭikassanā rahavatta kathā niṭṭhitā
translated: so too these are not members of a chapter for the transaction of any of the thirteen kinds of legal acts, but they are members for the remaining kinds of formal acts of the Community.🔽The discussion of the section on one deserving to be sent back to the beginning is ended.

original: Mānattacārikavattakathā
analyzed: mānatta cārika vatta kathā
translated: The discussion of the section on one undertaking the trial period

original: 90. Mānattacārikassa vattesu “devasikaṃ ārocetabba”nti viseso.
analyzed: mānatta cārikassa vattesu devasikam ārocetabban ti visesaḥ
translated: The difference in the duties of one undergoing probation is that he should announce himself every day.

original: 92. Ratticchedesu ūne gaṇeti ettha gaṇoti cattāro vā atirekā vā; tasmā sacepi tīhi🔽bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ vasati, ratticchedo hotiyeva. Mānattanikkhepasamādānesu vuttasadisova
analyzed: ratti chedesu ūne gaṇa iti ettha cattāraḥ vā atirekāḥ vā tasmā sace pi tīhi  bhikkhūhi saddhim vasati ratti chedaḥ mānatta nikkhepa samādānesu vutta sadisaḥ eva
translated: In the case of “If he counts nights, less than the remaining number,” “counts” means four or more. So even if he stays with three other monks,

original: vinicchayo. Sesaṃ sabbattha uttānamevāti.
analyzed: vinicchayo sesam sabbattha uttānam eva ati
translated: his probation is still interrupted. The explanation of the decision is the same as in the case of the admission of the ending of the probation. The rest is clear in all cases.

original: Mānattacārikavattakathā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: mānattacārikavatta kathā niṭṭhitā
translated: The discussion of the duties of one undergoing probation is finished.

original: Pārivāsikakkhandhakavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: pārivāsika khandhaka vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The chapter on those on probation is finished.

original: 3. Samuccayakkhandhakaṃ
translated: The chapter on the group of six

original: Sukkavissaṭṭhikathā
analyzed: sukka vissaṭṭhi kathā
translated: The training rule on emission of semen

original: 97. Samuccayakkhandhake – chārattaṃ mānattanti ettha catubbidhaṃ mānattaṃ – appaṭicchannamānattaṃ,
analyzed: samuccaya khandhake chārattam mānattan ti ettha catubbidham mānattam appaṭicchanna mānattam
translated: In the chapter on the group of six, “six days’ probation” means there are four kinds of probation: probation for unconcealed offenses,

original: paṭicchannamānattaṃ, pakkhamānattaṃ, samodhānamānattanti. Tattha appaṭicchannamānattaṃ
analyzed: paṭicchanna mānattam pakkha mānattam samodhāna mānattam tattha appaṭicchanna mānattam
translated: probation for concealed offenses, probation for a half-month, and probation for combining. Probation for unconcealed offenses🔽is when, without giving the trial period for an unconcealed offense,

original: nāma – yaṃ appaṭicchannāya āpattiyā parivāsaṃ adatvā kevalaṃ āpattiṃ āpannabhāveneva
analyzed: nāma yam appaṭicchannāya āpattiyā parivāsam a datvā kevalam āpattim āpanna bhāvena iva
translated: he is given probation only because he has committed an offense.

original: mānattārahassa mānattaṃ diyyati. Paṭicchannamānattaṃ nāma – yaṃ paṭicchannāya āpattiyā🔽parivutthaparivāsassa diyyati. Pakkhamānattaṃ nāma – yaṃ paṭicchannāya vā appaṭicchannāya🔽vā āpattiyā addhamāsaṃ bhikkhunīnaṃ diyyati. Samodhānamānattaṃ nāma – yaṃ odhāya
analyzed: mānattā rahassa mānattam diyyati paṭicchanna mānattam nāma yam paṭicchannāya āpattiyā  parivuttha parivāsassa diyyati pakkha mānattam nāma yam paṭicchannāya vā appaṭicchannāya  vā āpattiyāḥ addha māsam bhikkhunīnam diyyati samodhānam ānattam nāma yam odhāya
translated: The probationer’s probation is given to one who is deserving of the trial period. The probation for the concealing of an offense is given to one who has completed the probation for an offense that was concealed. The probation for a half-month is given to a nun for a half-month for an offense that was either concealed or unconcealed. The joint probation is given to a nun who has completed the probation for an offense that was concealed and who has been granted rehabilitation.

original: ekato katvā diyyati. Tesu idaṃ “appaṭicchannāya chārattaṃ mānatta”nti vacanato “appaṭicchannamānatta”nti
analyzed: ekatas katvā diyyati tesu idam appaṭicchannāya chārattam mānattanti vacanataḥ appaṭicchanna mānattanti
translated: The probation for one deserving probation. The concealed probation is that given to one who has completed the probation for an offense concealed for a long time. The half-month probation is that given to a nun for half a month for an offense concealed or unconcealed. The combined probation is that given by combining the probation and the trial period. Of these, this is the unconcealed probation, since it is said, “The unconcealed probation for six days.”

original: veditabbaṃ. Taṃ dentena sace ekaṃ āpattiṃ āpanno hoti, idha vuttanayena dātabbaṃ.
analyzed: veditabbam tam dentena sace ekam āpattim āpannaḥ hoti idha vutta nayena dātabbam
translated: The one who gives it should give it in the way stated here if the nun has committed one offense.

original: Sace dve vā tisso vā tatuttariṃ vā āpanno, yatheva “ekaṃ āpatti”nti vuttaṃ; evaṃ
analyzed: sace dve vā tissaḥ vā tatuttarim vā āpannaḥ yathā iva ekam āpattin ti vuttam evam
translated: If she has committed two or three or more offenses, then just as it is said, “One offense,”🔽so it should be said, “Two offenses, three offenses.”

original: “dve āpattiyo, tisso āpattiyo”ti vattabbaṃ. Tatuttari pana sacepi sataṃ vā sahassaṃ
analyzed: dve āpattiyo tissaḥ āpattiyo ti vattabbam tad uttari pana sace pi satam vā sahassam
translated: But if there are more than that, even if there are a hundred or a thousand,

original: vā hoti, “sambahulā”ti vattabbaṃ. Nānāvatthukāyopi ekato katvā dātabbā, tāsaṃ dānavidhiṃ
analyzed: vā hoti sambahulā ati vattabbam nānā vatthukāyaḥ api ekatas katvā dātabbā tāsam dāna vidhim
translated: it should be said, “Many offenses.” And even if the offenses have different bases, they should be combined and given.

original: parivāsadāne kathayissāma.🔽Evaṃ āpattivasena kammavācaṃ katvā dinne mānatte “evametaṃ dhārayāmī”ti kammavācāpariyosāne
analyzed: parivāsa dāne kathayissāma  evam āpatti vasena kamma vācam katvā dinne mā ānatte evam etam dhārayāmi iti kamma vācā pariyosāne
translated: We will explain the giving of probation.🔽When the proclamation “I will conduct myself in this way” has been made at the end of the announcement of the transaction,

original: māḷakasīmāyameva “mānattaṃ samādiyāmi, vattaṃ samādiyāmī”ti vuttanayena vattaṃ samādātabbaṃ.
analyzed: māḷakasīmāyam eva mānattam samādiyāmi vattam samādiyāmi iti vutta nayena vattam samādātabbam
translated: the trial period should be undertaken in the same monastery zone, saying, “I undertake the trial period,” and “I undertake the duties.”🔽After undertaking the trial period, he should inform the Sangha there,

original: Vattaṃ samādiyitvā tattheva saṅghassa ārocetabbaṃ, ārocentena ca evaṃ ārocetabbaṃ –
analyzed: vattam samādiyitvā tattha iva saṅghassa ārocetabbam ārocentena ca evam ārocetabbam
translated: and he should inform it like this:

original: “Ahaṃ, bhante, ekaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjiṃ sañcetanikaṃ sukkavissaṭṭhiṃ appaṭicchannaṃ,🔽sohaṃ saṅghaṃ ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā appaṭicchannāya chārattaṃ
analyzed: aham bhante ekam āpattim āpajjim sañcetanikam sukka vissaṭṭhim appaṭicchannam  saḥ ham saṅgham ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā appaṭicchannāya chārattam
translated: ‘Venerables, I’ve committed one offense of intentional emission of semen, concealed for one day.🔽I asked the Sangha to give me probation for one day for that offense,

original: mānattaṃ yāciṃ, tassa me saṅgho ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukkavissaṭṭhiyā appaṭicchannāya🔽chārattaṃ mānattaṃ adāsi. Sohaṃ mānattaṃ carāmi, vedayāmahaṃ, bhante ‘vedayatī’ti
analyzed: mānattam yācim tassa me saṅghaḥ ekissā āpattiyā sañcetanikāya sukka vissaṭṭhiyā appaṭicchannāya  chārattam mānattam adāsi saḥ uham mānattam carāmi vedayām aham bhante vedayati iti
translated: and the Sangha gave me that probation.

original: maṃ saṅgho dhāretū”ti.
analyzed: mam saṅghaḥ dhāretu uti
translated: I’m undertaking the trial period. Please remember me, Venerables, as undertaking the trial period.’”

original: Imañca pana atthaṃ gahetvā yāya kāyaci bhāsāya ārocetuṃ vaṭṭatiyeva. Ārocetvā sace
analyzed: imam ca pana attham gahetvā yāya kāyaci bhāsāya ārocetum vaṭṭatiyā iva ārocetvā sace
