translated: And it is allowable to inform by means of any language.🔽Having informed, if he wants to deposit it, he should deposit it in the midst of the Community in the way already described.

original: nikkhipitukāmo, vuttanayeneva saṅghamajjhe nikkhipitabbaṃ. Māḷakato bhikkhūsu nikkhantesu
analyzed: nikkhipitu kāmaḥ vutta nayena iva saṅgha majjhe nikkhipitabbam māḷakataḥ bhikkhūsu nikkhantesu
translated: When the bhikkhus have left the dwelling,🔽it is allowable to deposit it in the presence of anyone.

original: ekassapi santike nikkhipituṃ vaṭṭati. Māḷakato nikkhamitvā satiṃ paṭilabhantena sahagacchantassa
analyzed: ekassa api santike nikkhipitum vaṭṭati māḷakataḥ nikkhamitvā satim paṭilabhantena saha gacchantassa
translated: Having left the dwelling and regained mindfulness, it should be deposited in the presence of a companion.

original: santike nikkhipitabbaṃ. Sace sopi pakkanto, aññassa yassa māḷake nārocitaṃ, tassa
analyzed: santike nikkhipitabbam sace so api pakkantaḥ aññassa yassa māḷake na ārocitam tassa
translated: If he has also gone away, it should be deposited in the presence of anyone else who has not been informed in the dwelling.

original: ārocetvā nikkhipitabbaṃ. Ārocentena pana avasāne “vedayatīti maṃ āyasmā dhāretū”ti🔽vattabbaṃ. Dvinnaṃ ārocentena “āyasmantā dhārentū”ti, tiṇṇaṃ ārocentena “āyasmanto

analyzed: tam gahetvā parivasantena yattakam kālam suddhim jānāti tattakam apanetvā

analyzed: orohati idam assa lakkhaṇam aññasmim pana āpatti vuṭṭhāne idam lakkhaṇam yaḥ appaṭicchannam  āpattim paṭicchannāti vinaya kammam karoti tassa āpatti vuṭṭhāti yo paṭicchannaṃ  appaṭicchannā ati vinaya kammam karoti tassa na vuṭṭhāti acira paṭicchannam cira paṭicchannā ati

analyzed: ayam uddham na ārohati heṭṭhā pana orohati tasmai sace parivasantaḥ ratti paricchede

analyzed: sanniṭṭhānam karoti māsaḥ vā saṃvaccharaḥ vā mayham āpannassa ati māsam vā saṃvaccharam

analyzed: veditabbam kamma vācā pariyosāne vatta samādāna mānatta abbhānāni vutta nayānā iva ayam

original: suddhantaparivāso nāma.

translated: This is called the “pure trial period.”

original: “Samodhānaparivāso” nāma tividho hoti – odhānasamodhāno, agghasamodhāno, missakasamodhānoti.🔽Tattha “odhānasamodhāno” nāma – antarāpattiṃ āpajjitvā paṭicchādentassa parivutthadivase
analyzed: samodhāna parivāsaḥ nāma tividhaḥ hoti  odhāna samodhānaḥ aggha samodhānaḥ missaka samodhānaḥ ti  tattha odhāna samodhānaḥ nāma antarāpattim āpajjitvā paṭicchādentassa parivuttha divase
translated: The “combined trial period” is of three kinds: the combined trial period for the remainder, the combined trial period for the offense, and the combined trial period for the group.

analyzed: puna pakkham eva parivāsaḥ parivasitabbaḥ atha api antarāpatti pakkha paṭicchannā ava pakkham eva 🔽parivasitabbam etena upāyena yāva saṭṭhi vassa paṭicchannā mūla āpatti tāva vinicchayaḥ

analyzed: pakkham ānattam khamati saṅghassa tasmai tuṇhī evam etam dhārayāmi iti  kamma vācā pariyosāne vattam samādiyitvā bhikkhum ānatta kathāya vutta nayena iva saṅghassa

analyzed: tasmin gāme bhikkhācāro sampajjati tattha iva gantabbam no ce sampajjati aññatra

translated: The discussion of probation for one concealed

original: 165. Tattha “antarā sambahulā āpattiyo āpajjati parimāṇā appaṭicchannāyo”tiādīsu āpattiparicchedavasena parimāṇāyo ceva appaṭicchannāyo cāti attho.

original: 166. Pacchimasmiṃ āpattikkhandheti ekova so āpattikkhandho, pacchā chāditattā pana “pacchimasmiṃ āpattikkhandhe”ti vuttaṃ. Purimasminti etthāpi eseva nayo.

analyzed: lahuka āpatti kkhandham eva  tato param avisuddha visuddha bhāva dassana attham idha pana bhikkhave bhikkhu

analyzed: saḥ tam attham nijjhāyati oloketi evam karoti pekkhati anupekkhati iti yathā so tam  attham pekkhati ca iva punappunañca pekkhati evam karoti dasseti anudasseti iti tesam eva
translated: He considers that matter, he looks at it; he does it thus. He looks at it, he looks at it again and again; he does it thus. He shows it, he shows it again and again;

original: pariyāyavacanāni. Adhammena vūpasammatīti yasmā so adhammameva “ayaṃ dhammo”tiādinā🔽nayena mohetvā dasseti, tasmā adhammena vūpasammati nāma.

original: 188. Dhammena vūpasammatīti yasmā dhammavādī dhammameva “ayaṃ dhammo”tiādinā nayena amohetvā dasseti, tasmā dhammena vūpasammati nāma.

original: Sammukhāvinayakathā niṭṭhitā.

analyzed: anuvadanti iti codenti sesam uttānam eva ayam pana sati vinayaḥ khīṇāsavassa iva dātabbo

analyzed: kaḥ tuyham katham gahessati iti apasādetabbatam āpajjati
translated: who is a noble one with taints destroyed.”

original: Sativinayakathā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sati vinaya kathā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Discussion of a Verdict of Past Insanity is ended.

original: Amūḷhavinayakathā
analyzed: amūḍha vinaya kathā
translated: The Discussion of a Covering Over as if with Grass

original: 196. Bhāsitaparikkantanti vācāya bhāsitaṃ kāyena parikkantaṃ; parikkamitvā katanti

translated: Spoken and then gone beyond: spoken by speech and then gone beyond by body, that is, having gone beyond by body, having gone beyond by doing.

original: Amūḷhavinayakathā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: amūḷha vinaya kathā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of resolution through recollection is finished.

original: Yebhuyyasikākathā
analyzed: yebhuyyasikā kathā
translated: The explanation of majority decision

original: 202. Yebhuyyasikāya vūpasametunti ettha yassā kiriyāya dhammavādino bahutarā, esā yebhuyyasikā nāma.
analyzed: yebhuyyasikāya vūpasametun ti ettha yassā kiriyāya dhamma vādinaḥ bahutarāḥ esā yebhuyyasikā nāma
translated: ‘Is settled through majority decision’ means that when the doers of the action are more than the proponents of what is right, this is called ‘majority decision’.

original: 204. Adhammikasalākaggāhesu oramattakanti parittaṃ appamattakaṃ bhaṇḍanamattameva.🔽Na ca gatigatanti dve tayo āvāse na gataṃ, tattha tattheva vā dvattikkhattuṃ avinicchitaṃ.
analyzed: adhammika salākaggāhesu ora mattakam ti parittam appamattakam bhaṇḍana mattam eva  na ca gati gatanti dve tayo āvāse na gatam tattha tattha iva vā a vinicchitam
translated: ‘In an illegitimate ballot’ means in a ballot that is small, insignificant, and just a quarrel.🔽‘Not gone to a decision’ means that it has not gone to a decision in two or three monasteries.

original: Na ca saritasāritanti dvattikkhattuṃ tehi bhikkhūhi sayaṃ saritaṃ vā aññehi sāritaṃ
analyzed: na ca sarita sāritam ti dvatti khattum tehi bhikkhūhi sayam saritam vā aññehi sāritam

original: vā na hoti. Jānātīti salākaṃ gāhento jānāti “adhammavādī bahutarā”ti. Appeva nāmāti
analyzed: vā na hoti jānāti iti salākam gāhentaḥ jānāti adhamma vādī bahutarā ati appā iva nāma ati

analyzed: iminā nīhārena salākāya gāhiyamānāya api nāma adhamma vādinaḥ bahutarāḥ assu uti ayam assa

original: ajjhāsayo hoti. Aparesupi dvīsu eseva nayo.
analyzed: ajjhāsayaḥ hoti aparesu pi dvīsu esā iva nayo

original: Adhammena gaṇhantīti adhammavādino “evaṃ mayaṃ bahū bhavissāmā”ti dve dve salākāyo

analyzed: dhamma vādinaḥ na bahū bhavissanti iti maññamānāḥ na ca yathādiṭṭhiyā gaṇhanti iti dhamma vādino

analyzed: hutvā balava pakkham bhajissāma ati adhamma vādi salākam gaṇhanti dhammika salāka ggāhesu

original: ayamevattho parivattetvā veditabbo. Evaṃ salākaṃ gāhetvā sace bahutarā dhammavādino
analyzed: ayam eva atthaḥ parivattetvā veditabbaḥ evam salākam gāhetvā sace bahutarāḥ dhamma vādino
translated: When the votes have been taken in this way, if the Dhamma speakers are in the majority,

original: honti; yathā te vadanti, evaṃ taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasametabbaṃ, evaṃ yebhuyyasikāya
analyzed: honti yathā te vadanti evam tam adhikaraṇam vūpasametabbam evam yebhuyyasikāya

original: Yebhuyyasikākathā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: yebhuyyasikā kathā niṭṭhitā
translated: The discussion of majority decision is finished.

original: Tassapāpiyasikākathā🔽207. Asucīti asucīhi kāyavacīkammehi samannāgato. Alajjīti sañcicca āpajjanādinā🔽alajjilakkhaṇena samannāgato. Sānuvādoti saupavādo. Iti imesañca tiṇṇaṃ aṅgānaṃ vasena🔽tīṇi karaṇāni, saṅghena karaṇaṃ, dhammena samaggena karaṇanti imāni ca dveti pañca
analyzed: tassa pāpiyasikā kathā  asuci iti asucīhi kāya vacī kammehi samannāgataḥ alajjī iti sañcicca āpajjana ādinā  alajji lakkhaṇena samannāgato sa anuvādaḥ iti sa aupavādaḥ iti imesam ca tiṇṇam aṅgānam vasena  tīṇi karaṇāni saṅghena karaṇam dhammena samaggena karaṇan ti imāni ca dve iti pañca
translated: The discussion of the further penalty

original: tassapāpiyasikākammassa karaṇāni nāma honti. Sesamettha tajjanīyādīsu vuttanayameva.🔽Ayaṃ panettha vacanattho – idañhi yo pāpussannatāya pāpiyo puggalo, tassa kattabbato
analyzed: karaṇāni nāma honti sesam ettha tajjanīya ādīsu vutta nayam eva  ayam pana ittha vacana atthaḥ idam hi yaḥ pāpussanna tāya pāpiyaḥ puggalo tassa kattabbataḥ
translated: “Filthy”: he is endowed with filthy bodily and verbal actions. “Shameless”: he is endowed with the characteristic of shamelessness, such as intentionally committing an offense. “Blameworthy”: he is blameworthy. “Reproved”: he is reproved. “Further penalty”: the further penalty. Thus, there are three kinds of procedures done by a majority, and there are two kinds of procedures done according to the rule: by a unanimous assembly and by a group of experienced and competent monks. These are the five kinds of procedures for the further penalty. The rest is as in the case of the condemnation.

original: “tassapāpiyasikākamma”nti vuccati.🔽Tassapāpiyasikākathā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: vuccati 🔽tassapāpiyasikā kathā niṭṭhitā
translated: Here is the word explanation: this is called “a procedure of the further penalty” because it is done for a person who is worse, that is, more blameworthy, because of his being filled with bad qualities.

original: Tiṇavatthārakādikathā
analyzed: tiṇavatthāraka ādi kathā
translated: The Discussion of the covering over as if with grass, etc.🔽As to its being harsh and unprincipled: as to its being harsh and as to its being unprincipled.

original: 212. Kakkhaḷattāya vāḷattāyāti kakkhaḷabhāvāya ceva vāḷabhāvāya ca. Bhedāyāti saṅghabhedāya.
analyzed: kakkhaḷattāya vāḷattāya ati kakkhaḷa bhāvāya ca iva vāḷa bhāvāya ca bhedāya ati saṅgha bhedāya
translated: As to its causing a schism: as to its causing a schism in the Sangha.

original: Sabbeheva ekajjhanti kassaci chandaṃ anāharitvā gilānepi tattheva ānetvā ekato sannipatitabbaṃ.
analyzed: sabbehi iva ekajjhanti kassaci chandam an āharitvā gilāne pi tattha iva ānetvā ekatas sannipatitabbam
translated: All together in one place: without leaving out anyone who should be present, even if the sick person has to be brought there.

original: Tiṇavatthārakena vūpasameyyāti ettha idaṃ kammaṃ tiṇavatthārakasadisattā “tiṇavatthārako”ti🔽vuttaṃ. Yathā hi gūthaṃ vā muttaṃ vā ghaṭṭiyamānaṃ duggandhatāya bādhati, tiṇehi
analyzed: tiṇavatthārakena vūpasameyya ati ettha idam kammam tiṇavatthāraka sadisa ttā tiṇavatthārakā uti  vuttam yathā hi gūtham vā muttam vā ghaṭṭiyamānam duggandha tāya bādhati tiṇehi
translated: It should be settled by the covering over as if with grass: here this legal issue is called “the covering over as if with grass” because it is similar to the covering over as if with grass.

original: avattharitvā suppaṭicchāditassa panassa so gandho na bādhati; evameva yaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ
analyzed: avattharitvā su paṭicchāditassa panassa saḥ gandhaḥ na bādhati evam eva yam adhikaraṇam
translated: For just as excrement or urine that is stirred up smells worse when it is churned up and not covered over, but does not smell worse when it is covered over with grass,🔽so too this legal issue that,

original: mūlānumūlaṃ gantvā vūpasamiyamānaṃ kakkhaḷattāya vāḷattāya bhedāya saṃvattati, taṃ🔽iminā kammena vūpasantaṃ gūthaṃ viya tiṇavatthārakena paṭicchannaṃ suvūpasantaṃ hotīti
analyzed: mūla anumūlam gantvā vūpasamiyamānam kakkhaḷattāya vāḷattāya bhedāya saṃvattati tam  iminā kammena vūpasantam gūtham viya tiṇavatthārakena paṭicchannam su vūpasantam hoti iti
translated: when settled by going to the source and the root, leads to harshness, unprincipledness, and schism,🔽when settled by this legal procedure, is well settled, like excrement covered over with grass.

original: idaṃ kammaṃ tiṇavatthārakasadisattā “tiṇavatthārako”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: idam kammam tiṇava thāraka sadisa ttā tiṇava thārakaḥ ti vuttam
translated: This legal procedure is called “the covering over as if with grass” because it is similar to the covering over with grass.

original: 213. Thullavajjanti pārājikañceva saṅghādisesañca. Gihipaṭisaṃyuttanti gihīnaṃ hīnena khuṃsanavambhanadhammikapaṭissavesu āpannaṃ āpattiṃ.
analyzed: thullavajjanti pārājikam ca iva saṅgha ādisesam ca gihi paṭisaṃyuttanti gihīnam hīnena khuṃsana vambhana dhammika paṭissavesu āpannam āpattim
translated: “Grave offenses”: both the offense entailing expulsion and the offense entailing suspension. “Connected with householders”: an offense that one has fallen into in the course of legitimately resolving a dispute by scolding and disparaging householders.

original: 214. Evañca pana bhikkhave te bhikkhū tāhi āpattīhi vuṭṭhitā hontīti evaṃ tiṇavatthārakakammavācāya🔽katāya kammavācāpariyosāne yattakā tattha sannipatitā antamaso suttāpi samāpannāpi
analyzed: evam ca pana bhikkhave te bhikkhū tāhi āpattīhi vuṭṭhitāḥ honti iti evam tiṇavatthāraka kamma vācāya  katāya kamma vācā pariyosāne yattakā tattha sannipatitā antamaso suttā api samāpannā api
translated: “And, monks, those monks are purified from those offenses”: when the legal procedure of resolution through recollection has been done with one motion and three announcements,

original: aññavihitāpi sabbe te bhikkhū yāva upasampadamaṇḍalato paṭṭhāya thullavajjañca gihipaṭisaṃyuttañca
analyzed: añña vihitā api sabbe te bhikkhū yāva upasampada maṇḍalataḥ paṭṭhāya thullavajjañca gihi paṭisaṃyuttañca
translated: at the end of the third announcement, all the monks who have gathered there, even those who are asleep or in the vicinity of the attainment of absorption,

original: ṭhapetvā avasesā āpattiyo āpannā, sabbāhi tāhi āpattīhi vuṭṭhitā honti. Ye pana “na
analyzed: ṭhapetvā avasesāḥ āpattiyaḥ āpannā sabbāhi tāhi āpattīhi vuṭṭhitāḥ honti ye pana na
translated: even those who are absent, are purified from all offenses except the grave offenses and those connected with householders.

original: metaṃ khamatī”ti aññamaññaṃ diṭṭhāvikammaṃ karonti, tehi vā saddhiṃ āpattiṃ āpajjitvāpi
analyzed: mā etam khamati iti aññamaññam diṭṭhāvikammam karonti tehi vā saddhim āpattim āpajjitvā api
translated: But those who say, “We don’t approve of this,” and do a procedure of further penalty against each other,🔽and those who have fallen into an offense together with them,

original: tattha anāgatā, āgantvā vā chandaṃ datvā pariveṇādīsu nisinnā, te āpattīhi na vuṭṭhahanti.
analyzed: tattha anāgatā āgantvā vā chandam da tvā pariveṇa ādīsu nisinnā te āpattīhi na vuṭṭhahanti
translated: are not purified from those offenses.

original: Tena vuttaṃ – “ṭhapetvā diṭṭhāvikammaṃ ṭhapetvā ye na tattha hontī”ti.
analyzed: tena vuttam ṭhapetvā diṭṭhā vikammam ṭhapetvā ye na tattha honti iti
translated: Hence it was said above: “except for the legal procedure consisting of charging someone with an offense and except for those who are not present there” .

original: Tiṇavatthārakādikathā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: tiṇavatthāraka ādi kathā niṭṭhitā
translated: The discussion of the “covering over as if with grass” is finished.

original: Adhikaraṇakathā
analyzed: adhikaraṇa kathā
translated: Discussion of legal issues

original: 215. Bhikkhunīnaṃ anupakhajjāti bhikkhunīnaṃ anto pavisitvā. Vivādādhikaraṇādīnaṃ
analyzed: bhikkhunīnam anupakhajjāti bhikkhunīnam antar pavisitvā vivāda adhikaraṇa ādīnam
translated: “Without having accused a nun” means without having accused a nun after entering among the nuns.🔽The meaning of the terms “legal issue arising from a dispute” and so on has already been explained.🔽“A legal issue arising from an accusation” is a legal issue that arises because of an accusation.

original: vacanattho duṭṭhadosavaṇṇanāyaṃ vuttoyeva. Vipaccatāya vohāroti cittadukkhatthaṃ
analyzed: vacana tthaḥ duṭṭha dosa vaṇṇanāyam vuttaḥ yeva vipacca tāya vohāro ti citta dukkha attham
translated: “An accusation” is a statement that is unpleasant and hurtful.🔽“One who accuses” is one who accuses by means of that.🔽“One who reviles” is one who reviles by means of that.

original: vohāro; pharusavacananti attho. Yo tattha anuvādoti yo tesu anuvadantesu upavādo.
analyzed: vohāro pharusa vacananti atthaḥ yaḥ tattha anuvādo ti yaḥ tesu anuvadantesu upavādo
translated: “One who criticizes” is one who criticizes by means of that.🔽“One who disparages” is one who disparages by means of that.🔽“One who insults” is one who insults by means of that.🔽“One who slanders” is one who slanders by means of that.🔽“One who is hostile” is one who is hostile by means of that.

original: Anuvadanāti ākāranidassanametaṃ; upavadanāti attho. Anullapanā anubhaṇanāti ubhayaṃ🔽anuvadanavevacanamattameva. Anusampavaṅkatāti punappunaṃ kāyacittavācāhi tattheva
analyzed: anuvadanā ti ākāra nidassanam etam upavadanā ati atthaḥ anullapanā anubhaṇanā ti ubhayam  anuvadana vevacana mattam eva punappunam kāya citta vācāhi tattha iva
translated: “One who is partial” is one who is partial by means of that.🔽“One who is biased” is one who is biased by means of that.🔽“One who is obstinate” is one who is obstinate by means of that.

original: sampavaṅkatā; anuvadanabhāvoti attho. Abbhussahanatāti “kasmā evaṃ na upavadissāmi,
analyzed: sampavaṅka tā anuvadana bhāvaḥ ti atthaḥ abbhussahana tā ati kasmai evam na upavadissāmi
translated: “One who is difficult to speak to” is one who is difficult to speak to by means of that.🔽“One who is angry” is one who is angry by means of that.🔽“One who is resentful” is one who is resentful by means of that.🔽“One who is contemptuous” is one who is contemptuous by means of that.🔽“One who is domineering” is one who is domineering by means of that.🔽“One who is deceitful” is one who is deceitful by means of that.🔽“One who is crafty” is one who is crafty by means of that.🔽“One who is a cheat” is one who is a cheat by means of that.🔽“One who is a fraud” is one who is a fraud by means of that.🔽“One who is a flatterer” is one who is a flatterer by means of that.

original: upavadissāmiyevā”ti ussāhaṃ katvā anuvadanā. Anubalappadānanti purimavacanassa kāraṇaṃ
analyzed: upavadissāmiya iva ati ussāham katvā anuvadanā anubala padānam ti purima vacanassa kāraṇam
translated: “One who is a braggart” is one who is a braggart by means of that.🔽“One who is

original: dassetvā pacchimavacanena balappadānaṃ.
analyzed: dassetvā pacchima vacanena bala ppadānam
translated: and the last statement shows the strength of the motion.

original: Kiccayatā karaṇīyatāti ettha kiccameva kiccayaṃ, kiccayassa bhāvo kiccayatā, karaṇīyassa🔽bhāvo karaṇīyatā; ubhayampetaṃ saṅghakammasseva adhivacanaṃ. Apalokanakammantiādi
analyzed: kiccaya tā karaṇīya tā ati ettha kiccam eva kiccayam kiccayassa bhāvaḥ kiccaya tā karaṇīyassa  bhāvaḥ karaṇīya tā saṅgha kammassa iva adhivacanam apalokana kamma ntiādi
translated: The words “the state of being a matter to be done” and “the state of being a matter requiring deliberation” are as follows: that which is to be done is a matter to be done; the state of being a matter to be done is the state of being a matter requiring deliberation.🔽Both are terms for a legal issue in the Sangha. The legal procedure consisting of getting permission, etc.,

original: pana tasseva pabhedavacanaṃ. Tattha apalokanakammaṃ nāma sīmaṭṭhakasaṅghaṃ sodhetvā
analyzed: pana tassa iva pabheda vacanam tattha apalokana kammam nāma sīmaṭṭhaka saṅgham sodhetvā
translated: is a statement of the different kinds of legal procedures. Herein, the legal procedure consisting of getting permission is a legal procedure that should be done after the Sangha that is present in the monastery zone has been purified,

original: chandārahānaṃ chandaṃ āharitvā samaggassa saṅghassa anumatiyā tikkhattuṃ sāvetvā🔽kattabbakammaṃ. Ñattikammaṃ nāma vuttanayeneva samaggassa saṅghassa anumatiyā ekāya🔽ñattiyā kattabbakammaṃ. Ñattidutiyakammaṃ nāma vuttanayeneva samaggassa saṅghassa
analyzed: chandārahānam chandam āharitvā samaggassa saṅghassa anumatiyā tikkhattum sāvetvā  kattabba kammam ñatti kammam nāma vutta nayena iva samaggassa saṅghassa anumatiyā ekāya  ñattiyā kattabba kammam ñatti dutiya kammam nāma vutta nayena iva samaggassa saṅghassa
translated: the consent of those who are present but do not want to give their consent has been obtained, and the Sangha has given its consent three times by spoken statements.🔽The legal procedure consisting of one motion is a legal procedure that should be done after the Sangha has given its consent by spoken statements.

original: anumatiyā ekāya ñattiyā ekāya ca anussāvanāyāti evaṃ ñattidutiyāya anussāvanāya kattabbakammaṃ.
analyzed: anumatiyā ekāya ñattiyā ekāya ca anussāvanāya ati evam ñatti dutiyāya anussāvanāya kattabba kammam
translated: The legal procedure consisting of one motion and one announcement is a legal procedure that should be done after the Sangha has given its consent by one motion and one announcement.

original: Ñatticatutthakammaṃ nāma vuttanayeneva samaggassa saṅghassa anumatiyā ekāya ñattiyā
analyzed: ñatticatutthakammam nāma vutta nayena iva samaggassa saṅghassa anumatiyā ekāya ñattiyā
translated: A transaction by a majority is a transaction done by a majority of the Saṅgha in accordance with the approval of the Saṅgha, by one motion

original: tīhi ca anussāvanāhīti evaṃ ñatticatutthāhi tīhi anussāvanāhi kattabbakammaṃ.
analyzed: tīhi ca anussāvanāhi iti evam ñatti catutthāhi tīhi anussāvanāhi kattabba kammam
translated: and three announcements.

original: Tattha apalokanakammaṃ apaloketvāva kātabbaṃ, ñattikammādivasena na kātabbaṃ. Ñattikammampi
analyzed: tattha apalokana kammam apaloketvā ava kātabbam ñatti kamma ādi vasena na kātabbam ñatti kammam pi
translated: Herein, a transaction by motion is one that should be done by motion only, not by a transaction by a majority, etc.,🔽A transaction by one motion is one that should be done by one motion only, not by a transaction by a majority, etc.

original: ekaṃ ñattiṃ ṭhapetvāva kātabbaṃ, apalokanakammādivasena na kātabbaṃ. Ñattidutiyakammaṃ🔽pana apaloketvā kattabbampi atthi, akattabbampi atthi. Tattha sīmāsammuti sīmāsamūhananaṃ
analyzed: ekam ñattim ṭhapetvā ava kātabbam apalokana kamma ādi vasena na kātabbam ñatti dutiya kammam  pana apaloketvā kattabbam pi atthi a kattabbam pi atthi tattha sīmā sammuti sīmā samūhananaṃ
translated: A transaction by a resolution is one that should be done by a resolution, not by a transaction by a majority, etc.

original: kathinadānaṃ kathinubbhāro kuṭivatthudesanā vihāravatthudesanāti imāni cha kammāni
analyzed: kathina dānam kathinubbhāro kuṭi vatthu desanā vihāra vatthu desanā ati imāni cha kammāni
translated: Herein, the six transactions that are heavy are the resolution on a formal support for the observance-day ceremony, the resolution on a formal support for the invitation ceremony, the resolution on a formal support for the observance-day ceremony in a combined sangha, the resolution on a formal support for the invitation ceremony in a combined sangha, the resolution on a formal support for the observance-day ceremony in a mixed sangha, and the resolution on a formal support for the invitation ceremony in a mixed sangha.

original: garukāni, apaloketvā kātuṃ na vaṭṭanti. Ñattidutiyakammavācaṃ sāvetvāva kātabbāni.
analyzed: garukāni apaloketvā kātum na vaṭṭanti ñatti dutiya kamma vācam sāvetvā ava kātabbāni
translated: These should not be done without a resolution. They should be done by making a resolution.

original: Avasesā terasa sammutiyo senāsanaggāhakamatakacīvaradānādisammutiyo cāti evarūpāni
analyzed: avasesā terasa sammutiyo ca ati evarūpāni
translated: The remaining thirteen resolutions are the resolution on a site for a dwelling, the resolution on a site for a sauna, the resolution on a site for a wash-house, the resolution on a site for a refectory, the resolution on a site for a storehouse, the resolution on a site for a restroom, the resolution on a site for a water-boiling shed, the resolution on a site for a water-storage shed, the resolution on a site for a water-filtering shed, the resolution on a site for a water-drawing shed, the resolution on a site for a fruit-storage shed, the resolution on a site for a pleasure park, and the resolution on a site for a cemetery.

original: lahukakammāni apaloketvāpi kātuṃ vaṭṭanti. Ñattikammañatticatutthakammavasena pana
analyzed: lahuka kammāni apaloketvā api kātum vaṭṭanti ñatti kamma ñatti catuttha kamma vasena pana
translated: and it is proper to do them after announcing them.

original: na kātabbameva. Ñatticatutthakammaṃ ñattiñca tisso ca kammavācāyo sāvetvāva kātabbaṃ,
analyzed: na kātabbam eva ñatti catuttha kammam ñattim ca tisso ca kamma vācāyo sāvetvā ava kātabbam
translated: But they must not be done by means of a resolution consisting of one motion and one announcement, or by means of a resolution consisting of one motion and three announcements.🔽A resolution consisting of one motion and three announcements must be done after the motion has been made and the three announcements made.

original: apalokanakammādivasena na kātabbanti ayamettha saṅkhepo.🔽Vitthārato pana imāni cattāri kammāni “katihākārehi vipajjantī”tiādinā nayena parivārāvasāne
analyzed: apalokana kamma ādi vasena na kātabbanti ayam ettha saṅkhepo  vitthārato pana imāni cattāri kammāni katihākārehi vipajjanti itiādinā nayena parivāra avasāne
translated: It must not be done by means of a resolution consisting of one motion and one announcement, or by means of a resolution consisting of one motion and three announcements.🔽This is the brief account of them.

original: kammavagge etesaṃ vinicchayo āgatoyeva. Yaṃ pana tattha anuttānaṃ, taṃ kammavaggeyeva🔽vaṇṇayissāma. Evañhi sati na aṭṭhāne vaṇṇanā bhavissati, ādito paṭṭhāya ca tassa
analyzed: kamma vagge etesam vinicchayaḥ āgataḥ yeva yam pana tattha anuttānam tam kamma vagge yeva  vaṇṇayissāma evam hi sati na aṭṭhāne vaṇṇanā bhavissati āditaḥ paṭṭhāya ca tassa
translated: But the detailed account of these four kinds of legal issues is given in the Kammakkhandhaka in the Parivāra, beginning thus: “How many kinds of legal issues are there? They are of four kinds. In how many ways do they fail? They fail in four ways” .🔽But what is not included there we shall comment on here in the Kammakkhandhaka.

original: tassa kammassa viññātattā suviññeyyo bhavissati.
analyzed: tassa kammassa viññāta ttā su viññeyyaḥ bhavissati
translated: For if it is done like this, the comment will not be misplaced, and it will be easy to understand each legal issue from the beginning.

original: 216. Vivādādhikaraṇassa kiṃ mūlantiādīni pāḷivaseneva veditabbāni.
analyzed: vivāda adhikaraṇassa kim mūlam ti ādīni pāḷi vasena iva veditabbāni
translated: The questions “What is the root of a legal issue arising out of a dispute?” and the rest can be understood from the text of the Khandhaka itself.

original: 220. “Vivādādhikaraṇaṃ siyā kusala”ntiādīsu yena vivadanti, so cittuppādo vivādo, samathehi ca adhikaraṇīyatāya adhikaraṇanti evamādinā nayena attho daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: vivāda adhikaraṇam siyā yena vivadanti so cittuppādaḥ vivādo samathehi ca adhikaraṇīya tāya adhikaraṇam ti evamādinā nayena atthaḥ daṭṭhabbo
translated: “A legal issue arising from a dispute may be wholesome” and so on: the thought that disputes is the dispute; and because it is a matter for a legal issue by resolution, it is a legal issue. The meaning should be understood in this way.

original: 222. Āpattādhikaraṇaṃ siyā akusalaṃ siyā abyākataṃ, natthi āpattādhikaraṇaṃ kusalanti
analyzed: āpatti adhikaraṇam siyā akusalam siyā abyākatam natthi āpatti adhikaraṇam kusalanti
translated: “A legal issue arising from an offense may be unwholesome or indeterminate. There is no legal issue arising from an offense that is wholesome”

original: ettha sandhāya bhāsitavasena attho veditabbo. Yasmiñhi pathavikhaṇanādike āpattādhikaraṇe
analyzed: ettha sandhāya bhāsita vasena atthaḥ veditabbaḥ yasmin hi pathavi khaṇana ādike āpatta adhikaraṇe
translated: The meaning should be understood by way of what is said in the text. For in the case of a legal issue arising from an offense in regard to which a wholesome thought is a factor, such as the digging of the earth,

original: kusalacittaṃ aṅgaṃ hoti, tasmiṃ sati na sakkā vattuṃ “natthi āpattādhikaraṇaṃ kusala”nti,
analyzed: kusala cittam aṅgam hoti tasmin sati na sakkā vattum na atthi āpatta adhikaraṇam kusalanti
translated: if it is present, it cannot be said that there is no legal issue arising from an offense that is wholesome.

analyzed: tasmā na idam aṅga ppahonaka cittam sandhāya vuttam idam pana sandhāya vuttam yam
translated: Therefore this is not said with reference to the thought that is a factor. But it is said with reference to

original: tāva āpattādhikaraṇaṃ lokavajjaṃ, taṃ ekantato akusalameva, tattha “siyā akusala”nti
analyzed: tāva āpatta adhikaraṇam loka vajjam tam ekantataḥ akusalam eva tattha siyā akusalanti
translated: the legal issue arising from an offense that is a grave offense in the world. That is entirely unwholesome. There is no distinction in the sense of “may be unwholesome.”

original: vikappo natthi. Yaṃ pana paṇṇattivajjaṃ, taṃ yasmā sañcicca “imaṃ āpattiṃ vītikkamāmī”ti
analyzed: vikappaḥ na atthi yam pana paṇṇatti vajjam tam yasmai sañcicca imam āpattim vītikkamāmi iti
translated: But in the case of that which is a grave offense by convention, since one may do it intentionally, thinking, “I will transgress this offense,”

analyzed: vītikkamantassa iva akusalam hoti asañcit ca pana kiñci a jānantassa sahaseyya ādi vasena  āpajjataḥ a byākatam hoti tasmā tattha sañcicca a sañcicca vasena imam vikappa bhāvam sandhāya
translated: If he commits it intentionally, it is unprofitable. But if he commits it unintentionally, not knowing, through sleeping in the same sleeping place as a bhikkhu, etc.,

original: idaṃ vuttaṃ – “āpattādhikaraṇaṃ siyā akusalaṃ, siyā abyākataṃ, natthi āpattādhikaraṇaṃ kusala”nti.

original: Sace pana “yaṃ kusalacitto āpajjati, idaṃ vuccati āpattādhikaraṇaṃ kusala”nti vadeyya,

analyzed: acittakānam pana eḷaka lomapada sodhamma ādi samuṭṭhānānam pi kusala cittam āpajjeyya na  ca tattha vijjamānam api kusala cittam āpattiyāḥ aṅgam kāya vacī viññatti vasena pana calita ppavattānam
translated: then it would follow that one who is without cognizance would commit an offence with a profitable cognizance, since the origin of the offence would be a profitable cognizance in the case of the offence consisting in the picking up of an unused piece of hide, a piece of leather, a piece of wood, etc.,

original: kāyavācānaṃ aññatarameva aṅgaṃ, tañca rūpakkhandhapariyāpannattā abyākatanti.🔽Yaṃ jānantotiādimhi pana ayamattho – yaṃ cittaṃ āpattiyā aṅgaṃ hoti, tena vatthuṃ
analyzed: kāya vācānam aññataram eva aṅgam tat ca rūpa kkhandha pariyāpanna ttā a byākatanti 🔽yam jānantaḥ ti ādimhi pana ayam atthaḥ yam cittam āpattiyāḥ aṅgam hoti tena vatthum
translated: and that profitable cognizance would not be a condition for the offence. But it is only the body or speech that is a condition for the offence, since it is the body or speech that is set in motion by the profitable cognizance and is included in the form aggregate that is indeterminate.

original: jānanto “idaṃ vītikkamāmī”ti ca vītikkamākārena saddhiṃ jānanto sañjānanto vītikkamacetanāvasena
analyzed: jānantaḥ idam vītikkamāmi iti ca vītikkama ākārena saddhim jānantaḥ sañjānantaḥ vītikkama cetanā vasena

analyzed: cetetvā pakappetvā upakkama vasena maddantaḥ abhivitaritvā nirāsaṅka cittam pesetvā
translated: having intended, having resolved, having trodden down, having spread out, having sent out the mind free from hesitation,

analyzed: yam āpatta adhikaraṇam vītikkamam āpajjati tassa evam vītikkamataḥ yaḥ vītikkamaḥ idam

analyzed: vuccati āpatta adhikaraṇam akusalanti  abyākata vāre pi yam cittam āpattiyāḥ aṅgam hoti tassa abhāvena a jānantaḥ vītikkama ākārena
translated: this is called “a legal issue arising from an offence that is unwholesome.”🔽In the case of the indeterminate, too, whatever mind is not a factor of an offence, through the absence of that, not knowing, and not knowing together with the mode of transgression,

original: ca saddhiṃ ajānanto asañjānanto āpattiaṅgabhūtāya vītikkamacetanāya abhāvena acetetvā
analyzed: ca saddhim a jānantaḥ a sañjānantaḥ āpatti aṅga bhūtāya vītikkama cetanāya abhāvena a cetetvā

original: vītikkamaṃ āpajjati, tassa evaṃ vītikkamato yo vītikkamo, idaṃ vuccati “āpattādhikaraṇaṃ abyākata”nti.

analyzed: nāgarika manussāḥ thambhe ti nhāna titthe nikhaṇitvā ṭhapita tthambhe  kuṭṭa iti iṭṭhaka silā dāru kuṭṭānam aññatarasmim aṭṭāne nhāyanti iti ettha aṭṭānam nāma
translated: People of the town. The reading ‘village-chief’ is also allowable; it has the same meaning. A post: a post set up in a bathing place.🔽A wall: in one of bricks, wood, etc. Bathing in a place with a wall:

original: rukkhaṃ phalakaṃ viya tacchetvā aṭṭhapadākārena rājiyo chinditvā nhānatitthe nikhaṇanti,🔽tattha cuṇṇāni ākiritvā manussā kāyaṃ ghaṃsanti. Gandhabbahatthakenāti nhānatitthe
analyzed: rukkham phalakam viya tat chetvā aṭṭhapada ākārena rājiyaḥ chinditvā nhāna titthe nikhaṇanti  tattha cuṇṇāni ākiritvā manussā kāyam ghaṃsanti gandhabba hatthakena ati nhāna titthe
translated: a tree is cut down as if it were a plank, and the sapwood is cut in the form of a ladder and set up in a bathing place.🔽People throw powder on it and rub their bodies on it. With a bathing mitt:

original: ṭhapitena dārumayahatthena, tena kira cuṇṇāni gahetvā manussā sarīraṃ ghaṃsanti.
analyzed: ṭhapitena dāru maya hatthena tena kira cuṇṇāni gahetvā manussā sarīram ghaṃsanti
translated: a wooden mitt set up in a bathing place. It seems that people take the powder with it and rub their bodies with it.

original: Kuruvindakasuttiyāti kuruvindakapāsāṇacuṇṇāni lākhāya bandhitvā kataguḷikakalāpako
analyzed: kuruvindaka suttiyā ati kuruvindaka pāsāṇa cuṇṇāni lākhāya bandhitvā kata guḷika kalāpakaḥ
translated: With a ball of bath powder: a ball made with the powder of Kuruvindaka stones mixed with lac,

original: vuccati, taṃ ubhosu antesu gahetvā sarīraṃ ghaṃsanti. Viggayha parikammaṃ kārāpentīti
analyzed: vuccati tam ubhosu antesu gahetvā sarīram ghaṃsanti viggayha parikammam kārāpenti iti
translated: is meant. They take it in both hands and rub their bodies with it. Having made a rubbing:

original: aññamaññaṃ sarīrena sarīraṃ ghaṃsanti. Mallakaṃ nāma makaradantake chinditvā mallakamūlasaṇṭhānena
analyzed: aññam aññam sarīrena sarīram ghaṃsanti mallakam nāma makara dantake chinditvā mallaka mūla saṇṭhānena
translated: They rub each other’s bodies with their bodies. A “pillow” is made by cutting off the tip of a makara’s tail and shaping it like a pillow.

analyzed: katam mallakanti vuccati idam gilānassa api na vaṭṭati  akatamallakam nāma dante a chinditvā katam idam a gilānassa iva na vaṭṭati iṭṭhakākhaṇḍam  pana kapāla khaṇḍam vā vaṭṭati vattha vaṭṭim tasmā nhāyantassa yassa
translated: This is called a pillow. It is not allowable even for one who is sick.🔽A “non-pillow” is made by cutting off a tooth. This is not allowable except for one who is sick. But a piece of brick or a piece of pottery

original: kassaci nhānasāṭakavaṭṭiyā piṭṭhiṃ ghaṃsituṃ vaṭṭati. Puthupāṇikanti hatthaparikammaṃ
analyzed: kassaci nhāna sāṭaka vaṭṭiyā piṭṭhim ghaṃsitum vaṭṭati puthu pāṇikam ti hattha parikammam
translated: is allowable. A “handkerchief” is a cloth roll. Therefore it is allowable for anyone who is bathing to rub his back with a bathing-cloth roll. “Hand massage”

original: vuccati, tasmā sabbesaṃ hatthena piṭṭhiparikammaṃ kātuṃ vaṭṭati.🔽245. Vallikāti kaṇṇato nikkhantamuttolambakādīnaṃ etaṃ adhivacanaṃ; na kevalañca
analyzed: vuccati tasmā sabbesam hatthena piṭṭhi parikammam kātum vaṭṭati  vallikā ati kaṇṇatas nikkhanta mutta ulambaka ādīnam etam adhivacanam na kevalam ca
translated: is what is meant. Therefore it is allowable for anyone to have his back massaged with the hand.🔽“A string” is a term for earrings, etc., that hang from the ear. And not only

original: vallikā eva, yaṃkiñci kaṇṇapiḷandhanaṃ antamaso tālapaṇṇampi na vaṭṭati. Pāmaṅganti
analyzed: vallikāḥ eva yaṃkiñci kaṇṇa piḷandhanam antamasaḥ tāla paṇṇam pi na vaṭṭati pāmaṅganti
translated: a string, any ear ornament is not allowable, even a palm leaf. “A turban” is

original: yaṃkiñci palambakasuttaṃ. Kaṇṭhasuttakanti yaṃkiñci gīvūpagaābharaṇaṃ. Kaṭisuttakanti
analyzed: yaṃ kiñci palambaka suttam kaṇṭha suttakanti yaṃ kiñci gīvūpaga ābharaṇam kaṭi suttakanti
translated: Any kind of ornament. A necklace is any kind of ornament worn round the neck. A waistband is

analyzed: yaṃkiñci valayam kāyūra ādīni
translated: any kind of ornament worn round the hips, even a piece of string. A bracelet is a ring. Armlets, etc., are

original: pākaṭāneva, akkhakānaṃ heṭṭhā bāhābharaṇaṃ yaṃkiñci ābharaṇaṃ na vaṭṭati.
analyzed: pākaṭāna iva akkhakānam heṭṭhā bāha ābharaṇam yaṃkiñci ābharaṇam na vaṭṭati
translated: obvious. Any kind of ornament worn on the lower arm below the elbow is not allowable.

original: 246. Dumāsikaṃ vā duvaṅgulaṃ vāti ettha sace kesā antodvemāse dvaṅgulaṃ pāpuṇanti,🔽antodvemāseva chinditabbā. Dvaṅgulehi atikkāmetuṃ na vaṭṭati. Sacepi na dīghā, dvemāsato
analyzed: du māsikam vā du aṅgulam vā ati ettha sace kesāḥ dvaṅgulam pāpuṇanti  chinditabbā dvi aṅgulehi atikkāmetum na vaṭṭati sace pi na dīghā dvi māsataḥ
translated: Two fingers’ breadth or a dumāsika: if the hair reaches two fingers’ breadth inside two months,🔽it should be cut then. It should not be allowed to grow beyond two fingers’ breadth. Even if it does not grow long,

original: ekadivasampi atikkāmetuṃ na vaṭṭatiyeva; evamayaṃ ubhayenapi ukkaṭṭhaparicchedova
analyzed: eka divasam pi atikkāmetum na vaṭṭatiyā iva evam ayam ubhayena api ukkaṭṭha paricchedaḥ uva
translated: it should not be allowed to grow beyond two months. Thus the maximum limit is stated by both of these.

original: vutto, tato oraṃ pana navaṭṭanabhāvo nāma natthi.
analyzed: vutto tatas oram pana nava ṭṭana bhāvo nāma natthi
translated: But there is no such thing as a nine-month growth.

original: Kocchena osaṇṭhentīti kocchena olikhitvā sannisīdāpenti. Phaṇakenāti dantamayādīsu
analyzed: kocchena osaṇṭhenti iti kocchena olikhitvā phaṇakena ati danta maya ādīsu
translated: They make them sit on a bench and shave them: they make them sit on a bench and shave them by rubbing the razor back and forth.

original: yena kenaci. Hatthaphaṇakenāti hattheneva phaṇakiccaṃ karontā aṅgulīhi osaṇṭhenti.🔽Sitthatelakenāti madhusitthakaniyyāsādīsu yena kenaci cikkalena. Udakatelakenāti🔽udakamissakena telena. Maṇḍanatthāya sabbattha dukkaṭaṃ, uddhalomena pana anulomanipātanatthaṃ
analyzed: yena kenacid hattha phaṇakena ati hatthena iva phaṇa kiccam karontāḥ aṅgulīhi osaṇṭhenti  sittha telakena ati madhu sitthaka niyyāsa ādīsu yena kenaci cikkalena udaka telakena ati  udaka missakena telena maṇḍana atthāya sabbattha dukkaṭam uddhalomena pana anuloma nipātana attham
translated: With anything at all. With the hand as a fan: fanning with the fingers.🔽With a fan made of palm leaves: with any kind of fan. With water as an unguent:

original: hatthaṃ temetvā sīsaṃ puñchitabbaṃ. Uṇhābhitattarajasirānampi allahatthena puñchituṃ vaṭṭati.🔽247. Na bhikkhave ādāse vā udakapatte vāti ettha kaṃsapattādīnipi yesu mukhanimittaṃ
analyzed: hattham temetvā sīsam puñchitabbam allahatthena puñchitum vaṭṭati  na bhikkhave ādāse vā udaka patte vā ti ettha kaṃsa patta ādīni pi yesu mukha nimittam
translated: with water mixed with oil. In all cases, the offense is for the purpose of beautifying. But if one anoints the head with water that has been heated by the sun, it is allowable to moisten the hand and then anoint.

original: paññāyati, sabbāni ādāsasaṅkhameva gacchanti. Kañjiyādīnipi ca udakapattasaṅkhameva.
analyzed: paññāyati sabbāni ādāsa saṅkham eva gacchanti kañjiya ādīni pi ca udaka patta saṅkham eva
translated: “Monks, on a mirror or on water” means that all such things as a bronze dish, on which the reflection of the face appears, are called “a mirror.” And all such things as a dish of rice gruel are called “water.”

original: Tasmā yattha katthaci olokentassa dukkaṭaṃ. Ābādhapaccayāti “sañchavi nu kho me vaṇo,
analyzed: tasmā yattha katthaci olokentassa dukkaṭam ābādha paccayā ati sañchavi nu kho me vaṇaḥ
translated: Therefore, the offense is for looking anywhere. “Because of a disease”: “Is my wound suppurating?

original: udāhu na tāvā”ti jānanatthaṃ; “jiṇṇo nu khomhi no”ti evaṃ āyusaṅkhāraṃ olokanatthampi vaṭṭatīti vuttaṃ.🔽Mukhaṃ ālimpantīti vippasannachavirāgakarehi mukhālepanehi ālimpanti. Ummaddentīti
analyzed: udāhu na tāva ati jānana attham jiṇṇaḥ nu kho mhi no ti evam āyu saṅkhāram olokana ttham pi vaṭṭati iti vuttam  mukham ālimpanti iti vippasanna chavi rāga karehi mukha ālepanehi ālimpanti ummaddenti iti
translated: “Or not yet?”—in order to know. “Am I old or not?”—in order to see the life-formation.🔽They smear the mouth: they smear the face with face-pastes that make the skin clear and free from blemishes. They tickle:

original: nānāummaddanehi ummaddenti. Cuṇṇentīti mukhacuṇṇakena makkhenti. Manosilikāya mukhaṃ
analyzed: nānā ummaddanehi ummaddenti cuṇṇenti iti mukha cuṇṇakena makkhenti manosilikāya mukham
translated: they tickle with various ticklers. They powder: they anoint with face-powder. They paint the face with cosmetics:

original: lañchentīti manosilāya tilakādīni lañchanāni karonti, tāni haritālādīhipi na vaṭṭantiyeva.
analyzed: lañchenti iti tilaka ādīni lañchanāni karonti tāni na
translated: they paint the face with cosmetics such as vermilion. These are not allowable even with yellow orpiment, etc.

original: Aṅgarāgādayo pākaṭāyeva. Sabbattha dukkaṭaṃ.🔽248. Na bhikkhave naccaṃ vātiādīsu yaṃkiñci naccaṃ antamaso moranaccampi dassanāya🔽gacchantassa dukkaṭaṃ. Sayampi naccantassa vā naccāpentassa vā dukkaṭameva. Gītampi
analyzed: aṅgarāga ādayo pākaṭāya iva sabbattha dukkaṭam  na bhikkhave naccam vāti ādīsu yaṃkiñci naccam antamasaḥ mora naccam pi dassanāya  gacchantassa dukkaṭam sayam pi naccantassa vā vā dukkaṭam eva gītam pi
translated: The painting of the body, etc., are obvious. In all cases there is an act of wrong conduct.🔽As regards the training rule that begins, “Monks, I allow you to look at, to go to see,” etc., if one goes to see any kind of dancing, even that of peacocks, there is an act of wrong conduct. If one dances oneself or makes another dance, there is an act of wrong conduct. As regards singing,

original: yaṃkiñci naṭagītaṃ vā sādhugītaṃ vā antamaso dantagītampi “yaṃ gāyissāmā”ti pubbabhāge
analyzed: yaṃkiñci naṭa gītam vā sādhu gītam vā antamasaḥ danta gītam pi yam gāyissāma ati pubbabhāge
translated: any kind of singing by actors, bards, or the like, even the singing of elephants, horses, and birds, if one thinks, “I shall listen to singing,” and one listens to it, there is an act of wrong conduct.

original: okūjantā karonti, etampi na vaṭṭati. Sayaṃ gāyantassāpi gāyāpentassāpi dukkaṭameva.🔽Vāditampi yaṃkiñci na vaṭṭati. Yaṃ pana niṭṭhubhanto vā sāsaṅke vā ṭhito accharikaṃ
analyzed: okūjantā karonti etam pi na vaṭṭati sayam gāyantassa api gāyāpentassa api dukkaṭam eva  vāditam pi yaṃkiñci na vaṭṭati yam pana niṭṭhubhantaḥ vā sa āsaṅke vā ṭhitaḥ accharikam
translated: If they sing while bending down, this is also not allowable. There is an offense of wrong conduct for one who sings himself or who has another sing.🔽As regards musical instruments, any kind of instrument is not allowable. But if one blows a whistle or stands on tiptoe or claps one’s hands while standing in a screened place,

original: vā phoṭeti, pāṇiṃ vā paharati, tattha anāpatti. Sabbaṃ antarārāme ṭhitassa passato🔽anāpatti. “Passissāmī”ti vihārato vihāraṃ gacchantassa āpattiyeva. Āsanasālāya nisinno🔽passati, anāpatti. “Passissāmī”ti uṭṭhahitvā gacchato āpatti. Vīthiyaṃ ṭhatvā gīvaṃ
analyzed: vā phoṭeti pāṇim vā paharati tattha anāpatti sabbam antarārāme ṭhitassa passato  anāpatti passissāmi iti vihārataḥ vihāram gacchantassa āpattiyā iva āsana sālāya nisinno  passati anāpatti passissāmi iti uṭṭhahitvā gacchato āpatti vīthiyam ṭhatvā gīvam
translated: there is no offense. There is no offense for one who stands in the monastery and watches.🔽There is an offense for one who goes from monastery to monastery thinking, “I’ll watch.” There is no offense for one who sits in the assembly hall and watches.

original: parivattetvā passatopi āpattiyeva.🔽249. Sarakuttinti sarakiriyaṃ. Bhaṅgo hotīti aladdhaṃ uppādetuṃ na sakkoti; laddhaṃ
analyzed: parivattetvā passataḥ pi āpattiyā eva  sara kiriyam bhaṅgaḥ hoti iti a laddham uppādetum na sakkoti laddham
translated: There is an offense for one who gets up thinking, “I’ll watch.” There is an offense for one who stands in the street and watches, turning his neck.

original: samāpajjituṃ. Pacchimā janatāti amhākaṃ ācariyāpi upajjhāyāpi evaṃ gāyiṃsūti pacchimo
analyzed: samāpajjitum pacchimā janatā ati amhākam ācariyā api upajjhāyā api evam gāyiṃsu iti pacchimaḥ
translated: . Sarakutti: a kind of dance. It is broken: it is not possible to produce what has not been produced or to attain what has been produced. Later generations: later generations will say, “Our teachers and preceptors sang like this.”

original: jano diṭṭhānugatiṃ āpajjati; tatheva gāyati. Na bhikkhave āyatakenāti ettha āyatako🔽nāma taṃ taṃ vattaṃ bhinditvā akkharāni vināsetvā pavatto. Dhamme pana suttantavattaṃ🔽nāma atthi, jātakavattaṃ nāma atthi, gāthāvattaṃ nāma atthi, taṃ vināsetvā atidīghaṃ
analyzed: janaḥ diṭṭhānugatim āpajjati tathā iva gāyati na bhikkhave āyatakena ati ettha āyatakaḥ  nāma tam tam vattam bhinditvā akkharāni vināsetvā pavattaḥ dhamme pana suttanta vattam  nāma atthi jātakavattam nāma atthi gāthāvattam nāma atthi tam vināsetvā ati dīgham
translated: People follow what they have seen. He sang in the same way.

original: kātuṃ na vaṭṭati. Caturassena vattena parimaṇḍalāni padabyañjanāni dassetabbāni.🔽Sarabhaññanti sarena bhaṇanaṃ. Sarabhaññe kira taraṅgavattadhotakavattagalitavattādīni🔽dvattiṃsa vattāni atthi. Tesu yaṃ icchati, taṃ kātuṃ labhati. Sabbesaṃ padabyañjanaṃ
analyzed: kātum na vaṭṭati catur assena vattena parimaṇḍalāni pada byañjanāni dassetabbāni  sarabhaññanti sarena bhaṇanam sarabhaññe kira taraṅgavatta dhotakavatta galitavatta ādīni  dvattiṃsa vattāni atthi tesu yam icchati tam kātum labhati sabbesam pada byañjanam
translated: In the words “not in a drawn-out manner,” drawn-out means that one should not sing after breaking up the phrasing and destroying the syllables. But there is a phrasing for the discourses, a phrasing for the Jātakas, and a phrasing for the verses. One should not sing in a way that is too long, destroying these. One should show the words and syllables in a circular way, in a four-square way.

original: avināsetvā vikāraṃ akatvā samaṇasāruppena caturassena nayena pavattanaṃyeva lakkhaṇaṃ.
analyzed: a vināsetvā vikāram a katvā samaṇa sāruppena caturassena nayena lakkhaṇam
translated: In the words “in a tune,” a tune is a singing in a melody. In a tune, it seems, there are thirty-two phrases, such as the wave phrase, the washed-up phrase, the dripping phrase, and so on. One is allowed to sing in any of these. The defining characteristic of all of them is that one should not destroy the words and syllables or make changes, but should sing in a four-square way that is suitable for an ascetic.

original: Bāhiralomiṃ uṇṇinti uṇṇalomāni bahi katvā uṇṇapāvāraṃ pārupanti; tathā dhārentassa
analyzed: bāhira lomim uṇṇinti uṇṇa lomāni bahi katvā uṇṇa pāvāram pārupanti tathā dhārentassa
translated: In the words “with the hair-tuft outside,” the hair-tuft is made to hang outside. They wear the outer cloak in such a way that the hair-tuft is outside.

original: dukkaṭaṃ. Lomāni anto katvā pārupituṃ vaṭṭati. Samaṇakappakathā bhūtagāmasikkhāpadavaṇṇanāyaṃ vuttā.
analyzed: dukkaṭam lomāni antar katvā pārupitum vaṭṭati samaṇa kappa kathā bhūtagāma sikkhāpada vaṇṇanāyam vuttā
translated: It is allowable to wear it after cutting off the hair inside. The account of the shaveling is given in the commentary to the training rule about living things.

original: 251. Na bhikkhave attano aṅgajātanti aṅgajātaṃ chindantasseva thullaccayaṃ. Aññaṃ
analyzed: na bhikkhave attanaḥ aṅga jātam ti aṅga jātam chindantassa iva thullaccayam aññam
translated: “Monks, one’s own body part”: if he cuts off his own body part, it is a thullaccaya offense.

original: pana kaṇṇanāsāaṅguliādiṃ yaṃkiñci chindantassa tādisaṃ vā dukkhaṃ uppādentassa dukkaṭaṃ.
analyzed: pana kaṇṇa nāsā aṅguli ādim yaṃkiñci chindantassa tādisam vā dukkham uppādentassa dukkaṭaṃ
translated: But if he cuts off something else, such as an ear, a nose, a finger, etc., or causes pain in such a way, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: Ahikīṭadaṭṭhādīsu pana aññaābādhapaccayā vā lohitaṃ vā mocentassa chindantassa vā anāpatti.🔽252. Candanagaṇṭhi uppannā hotīti candanaghaṭikā uppannā hoti. So kira uddhañca adho🔽ca jālāni parikkhipāpetvā gaṅgāya nadiyā kīḷati, tassa nadīsotena vuyhamānā candanagaṇṭhi
analyzed: ahi kīṭa daṭṭha ādīsu pana añña ābādha paccayā vā lohitam vā mocentassa chindantassa vā anāpatti  candana gaṇṭhi uppannā hoti iti candana ghaṭikā uppannā hoti saḥ kira uddhan ca adhas  ca jālāni parikkhipāpetvā gaṅgāya nadiyā kīḷati tassa nadī sotena vuyhamānā candana gaṇṭhi
translated: But if he draws blood from a snake, a scorpion, a centipede, etc., or from something else, or if he cuts them, there is no offense if it is for the purpose of treating an illness.🔽“A sandalwood doll has appeared”: a sandalwood doll has been made. It seems that he had a net spread out above and below, and he played in the Ganges River. A sandalwood doll

original: āgantvā jāle laggā, tamassa purisā āharitvā adaṃsu; evaṃ sā uppannā hoti. Iddhipāṭihāriyanti
analyzed: āgantvā jāle laggā tamassa purisāḥ āharitvā evam sā uppannā hoti iddhi pāṭihāriyanti
translated: came along, got caught in the net, and was carried to the bank by the current of the river. The men brought it to him. That is how it appeared. “A miracle of supernormal power”:

original: ettha vikubbaniddhipāṭihāriyaṃ paṭikkhittaṃ, adhiṭṭhāniddhi pana appaṭikkhittāti veditabbā.🔽Na bhikkhave sovaṇṇamayo pattotiādīsu sacepi gihī bhattagge suvaṇṇataṭṭikādīsu byañjanaṃ
analyzed: ettha vikubba niddhi pāṭihāriyam paṭikkhittam adhiṭṭhāniddhi pana appaṭikkhittā ti veditabbā  na bhikkhave sovaṇṇa mayaḥ patto ti ādīsu sace pi gihī bhatta gge suvaṇṇa taṭṭikā ādīsu byañjanam
translated: The miracle of transformation by supernormal power is prohibited here, but the miracle of resolve by supernormal power should be understood as unprohibited.

original: katvā upanāmenti, āmasitumpi na vaṭṭati. Phalikamayakācamayakaṃsamayāni pana taṭṭikādīni🔽bhājanāni puggalikaparibhogeneva na vaṭṭanti, saṅghikaparibhogena vā gihivikaṭāni🔽vā vaṭṭanti. “Tambalohamayopi pattova na vaṭṭati, thālakaṃ pana vaṭṭatī”ti idaṃ sabbaṃ
analyzed: katvā upanāmenti āmasitum pi na vaṭṭati phalika maya kāca maya kaṃsa mayāni pana taṭṭikā ādīni  bhājanāni puggalika paribhogena iva na vaṭṭanti saṅghika paribhogena vā gihi vikaṭāni  vā vaṭṭanti tamba loha mayaḥ api pattaḥ uva na vaṭṭati thālakam pana vaṭṭati iti idam sabbam
translated: As regards the words “A golden bowl, bhikkhus, is not allowed” and so on, even if householders bring a golden bowl, etc., and set it out, having made it an ornament with a golden plate, etc., it is not allowed to touch it. But bowls made of crystal, glass, and copper🔽are not allowed for personal use, but they are allowed for use by the Community or for use by the householders. “A bowl made of bronze is not allowed, but a plate is allowed” — all this is said in the Kurundīya.

original: kurundiyaṃ vuttaṃ. Maṇimayoti ettha pana indanīlādimaṇimayo vutto. Kaṃsamayoti ettha
analyzed: kurundiyam vuttam maṇi mayaḥ ti ettha pana inda nīla ādi maṇi mayaḥ vutto kaṃsa mayaḥ ti ettha
translated: As regards “a gem,” here a gem such as a sapphire is meant. As regards “a shell,”

original: vaṭṭalohamayopi saṅgahito.
analyzed: vaṭṭa loha mayaḥ api saṅgahitaḥ
translated: here a shell such as a conch is meant.

original: 253. Likhitunti tanukaraṇatthāyetaṃ vuttaṃ. Pakatimaṇḍalanti makaradantacchinnakamaṇḍalameva.

analyzed: āvaṭṭitvā iti aññam aññam paharitvā patta ādhārakam ti ettha danta valli vetta ādīhi  kate bhūmi ādhārake tayo dāru ādhārake dve patte upari upari ṭhapetum vaṭṭati iti kurundiyam  vuttam mahā aṭṭhakathāyam pana vuttam bhūmi ādhārake tiṇṇam pattānam anokāsaḥ dve
translated: Having been turned round: having struck each other. analyzed: pana dāru ādhārakaḥ tīhi daṇḍakehi baddhaḥ daṇḍaka ādhāro ca ekassa api pattassa anokāsaḥ
translated: But a stand for bowls made of wood like the top of a sugar-cane, or a stand for bowls made of three sticks tied together, is no stand for bowls at all.

translated: If a bowl is placed on it, one must sit holding it with one’s hand. But a bowl may be placed on the ground and turned upside down.”

original: Miḍḍhanteti ālindakamiḍḍhikādīnaṃ ante. Sace pana parivattetvā tattheva patiṭṭhāti,

translated: The explanation should be understood here in the same way as in the case of the shelf.🔽A cloth means a cloth spread out on which the bowl is placed. If there is no such cloth, it is allowable to place it on a piece of bamboo, a wooden board, or a clay saucer, or on the ground in a place where it will not get spoilt, or on a piece of sand.

original: ṭhapetuṃ vaṭṭati. Paṃsurajādīsu pana kharabhūmiyaṃ vā ṭhapentassa dukkaṭaṃ. Pattamāḷakaṃ
analyzed: ṭhapetum vaṭṭati paṃsu raja ādīsu pana khara bhūmiyam vā ṭhapentassa dukkaṭam pattamāḷakam
translated: But if he places it on a rough surface such as gravel, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽A bowl rest is allowable made of bricks or wood.

original: iṭṭhakāhi vā dārūhi vā kātuṃ vaṭṭati. Pattakuṇḍolikāti mahāmukhakuṇḍasaṇṭhānā bhaṇḍakukkhalikā
analyzed: iṭṭhakāhi vā dārūhi vā kātum vaṭṭati patta kuṇḍolikā ati mahāmukha kuṇḍa saṇṭhānā bhaṇḍakukkhalikā
translated: A bowl sling is a kind of bag made in the shape of a large-mouthed bag.

original: vuccati. Yo laggeyyāti yattha katthaci laggentassa dukkaṭameva. Cīvaravaṃsepi bandhitvā
analyzed: vuccati yaḥ laggeyya iti yattha katthaci laggentassa dukkaṭam eva cīvara vaṃse pi bandhitvā

original: ṭhapetuṃ na vaṭṭati. Bhaṇḍakaṭṭhapanatthameva vā kataṃ hotu nisīdanasayanatthaṃ vā
analyzed: ṭhapetum na vaṭṭati bhaṇḍaka ṭṭhapana attham eva vā katam hotu nisīdana sayana attham vā

analyzed: bandhitvā ṭhapetum vaṭṭati aṭaniyam bandhitvā olambetum vā vaṭṭati bandhitvā api  upari ṭhapetum na vaṭṭatiyā iva sace pana mañcaḥ vā pīṭham vā ukkhipitvā cīvara vaṃsa ādīsu  aṭṭaka channena ṭhapitam hoti tattha ṭhapetum vaṭṭati aṃsavat dhanakena aṃsakūṭe  laggetvā aṅke ṭhapetum vaṭṭati chatte bhatta pūraḥ api aṃsakūṭe laggita pattaḥ api ṭhapetum

original: na vaṭṭati, bhaṇḍakena pana saddhiṃ bandhitvā vā aṭṭakaṃ katvā vā ṭhapite yo koci ṭhapetuṃ vaṭṭati.
analyzed: na vaṭṭati bhaṇḍakena pana saddhim bandhitvā vā aṭṭakam katvā vā ṭhapite yaḥ koci ṭhapetum vaṭṭati
translated: It is allowable to tie it up and hang it up. It is allowable to tie it up and hang it up on a peg. But it is not allowable to hang it up tied up on a rope. It is allowable to keep it on one’s lap after tying it to one’s shoulder-strap with a shoulder-strap fastener. It is not allowable to keep a bag of rice or a bag of flour on one’s lap after tying it to one’s shoulder-strap with a shoulder-strap fastener. But it is allowable to keep anything that is tied up with a strap or made into a bundle.

original: aññatarampi. Kathinarajjunti yāya dupaṭṭacīvaraṃ sibbantā kathine cīvarampi bandhanti.🔽Kathinaṃ nappahotīti dīghassa bhikkhuno pamāṇena kataṃ kathinaṃ; tattha rassassa🔽bhikkhuno cīvaraṃ patthariyamānaṃ nappahoti, antoyeva hoti; daṇḍake na pāpuṇātīti
analyzed: aññataram pi kathina rajjunti yāya dupaṭṭa cīvaram sibbantā kathine cīvaram pi bandhanti  kathinam nappahoti iti dīghassa bhikkhuno pamāṇena katam kathinam tattha rassassa  bhikkhuno cīvaram patthariyamānam na ppahoti antoyā iva hoti daṇḍake na pāpuṇāti iti
translated: Any other. A frame for the robe-making ceremony: with which they frame a robe on the frame when weaving a double-layered robe.

original: attho. Daṇḍakathinanti tassa majjhe itarassa bhikkhuno pamāṇena aññaṃ nisseṇiṃ bandhituṃ anujānāmīti attho.

translated: The frame is not big enough: the frame is made to the measure of a tall monk. There, when a short monk is measuring out the robe, it is not big enough; it does not reach the end. The meaning is: it does not reach the end-piece. A frame for the end-piece: the meaning is: I allow you to make another frame in the middle of that one to the measure of the other monk.

original: Bidalakanti daṇḍakathinappamāṇena kaṭasārakassa pariyante paṭisaṃharitvā duguṇakaraṇaṃ.🔽Salākanti dupaṭṭacīvarassa antare pavesanasalākaṃ. Vinandhanarajjunti mahānisseṇiyā🔽saddhiṃ khuddakaṃ nisseṇiṃ vinandhituṃ rajjuṃ. Vinandhanasuttanti khuddakanisseṇiyā
analyzed: bidalakanti daṇḍa kathina ppamāṇena kaṭasārakassa pariyante paṭisaṃharitvā duguṇa karaṇam  salākam ti du paṭṭa cīvarassa antare pavesana salākam vinandhana rajjunti mahā nisseṇiyā  saddhim khuddakam nisseṇim vinandhitum rajjum vinandhana suttanti khuddaka nisseṇiyā
translated: A border: having removed the border of the cloth from the frame for the end-piece, it is made double.🔽A shuttle: a shuttle for inserting into the middle of a double-layered robe. A frame for the border:🔽together with the large frame, I allow a small frame. A border-weaving thread:

original: cīvaraṃ vinandhituṃ suttakaṃ. Vinandhitvā cīvaraṃ sibbetunti tena suttakena tattha
analyzed: cīvaram vinandhitum suttakam vinandhitvā cīvaram sibbetunti tena suttakena tattha
translated: a thread for weaving a border with the small frame. Having woven the border, he should weave the robe: with that thread, he should weave the robe there.

original: cīvaraṃ vinandhitvā sibbituṃ. Visamā hontīti kāci khuddakā honti, kāci mahantā. Kaḷimbhakanti🔽pamāṇasaññākaraṇaṃ yaṃkiñci tālapaṇṇādiṃ. Moghasuttakanti vaḍḍhakīnaṃ dārūsu kāḷasuttena
analyzed: cīvaram vinandhitvā sibbitum visamāḥ honti iti kāci khuddakāḥ honti kāci  pamāṇa saññā karaṇam yaṃkiñci tāla paṇṇa ādim moghasuttakam ti vaḍḍhakīnam dārūsu kāḷa suttena
translated: after having approved the robe-cloth, to sew it. They were uneven: some were small, some were large. A measuring guide:🔽anything for making a sign of the measure, such as a palm leaf. A useless thread:

original: viya haliddisuttena saññākaraṇaṃ. Aṅguliyā paṭiggaṇhantīti sūcimukhaṃ aṅguliyā paṭicchanti.
analyzed: viya haliddi suttena saññākaraṇam aṅguliyā paṭiggaṇhanti iti sūci mukham aṅguliyā paṭicchanti
translated: making a sign with a yellow thread, as if with a black thread of carpenters. They received with a finger: they received at the mouth of the needle with a finger.

original: Paṭiggahanti aṅgulikosakaṃ.🔽257. Āvesanavitthakaṃ nāma yaṃkiñci pāticaṅkoṭakādi. Uccavatthukanti paṃsuṃ ākiritvā🔽uccavatthukaṃ kātuṃ anujānāmīti attho. Ogumphetvā ullittāvalittaṃ kātunti chadanaṃ
analyzed: paṭiggahanti aṅguli kosakam  āvesana vitthakam nāma yaṃkiñci pāti caṅkoṭaka ādi ucca vatthukanti paṃsum ākiritvā  ucca vatthukam kātum anujānāmi iti attho ogumphetvā ullitta avalittam kātum ti chadanam
translated: They received with a finger-protector.

original: odhunitvā ghanadaṇḍakaṃ katvā anto ceva bahi ca mattikāya limpitunti attho. Goghaṃsikāyāti
analyzed: odhunitvā ghana daṇḍakam katvā anto ca iva bahi ca mattikāya limpitunti atthaḥ go ghaṃsikāya ati
translated: A frame for marking the border: anything such as a marking-stick. I allow you to make a high base: the meaning is that I allow you to make a high base by heaping up soil. After smoothing it down, to make it even and smooth: the meaning is that after removing the covering, you make it with a thick stick, and you smear it inside and outside with mud. A frame for marking the border:

original: veḷuṃ vā rukkhadaṇḍaṃ vā antokatvā tena saddhiṃ saṅgharitunti attho. Bandhanarajjunti
analyzed: veḷum vā rukkha daṇḍam vā antokatvā tena saddhim saṅgharitunti attho bandhana rajjun ti

original: tathā saṅgharitassa bandhanarajjuṃ.
analyzed: tathā bandhana rajjum
translated: a binding rope for that which is marked in that way.

original: 258. Kaṭacchuparissāvanaṃ nāma tīsu daṇḍakesu vinandhitvā kataṃ.🔽259. Yo na dadeyyāti aparissāvanakasseva yo na dadāti, tassa āpatti. Yo pana attano🔽hatthe parissāvane vijjamānepi yācati, tassa na akāmā dātabbaṃ. Daṇḍaparissāvananti
analyzed: kaṭacchuparissāvanam nāma tīsu daṇḍakesu vinandhitvā katam  yaḥ na dadeyyāti a parissāvanakassa iva yaḥ na dadāti tassa āpatti yaḥ pana attanaḥ  hatthe parissāvane vijjamāne api yācati tassa na akāmā dātabbam daṇḍa parissāvanam ti
translated: A clothes-rinsing rack is one made by fixing three sticks together.

original: rajakānaṃ khāraparissāvanaṃ viya catūsu pādesu baddhanisseṇikāya sāṭakaṃ bandhitvā🔽majjhedaṇḍake udakaṃ āsiñcitabbaṃ, taṃ ubhopi koṭṭhāse pūretvā parissavati. translated: It is only suitable for the work in hand; it is not suitable for the other duties such as paying respect. The cloth-filter is suitable for all the duties.

original: vaṭṭati. Udakaṃ na hotīti nhānodakaṃ na hoti.🔽262. Tulanti paṇṇikānaṃ viya udakaubbāhanakatulaṃ. Karakaṭako vuccati goṇe vā yojetvā
analyzed: vaṭṭati udakam na hoti iti nhānodakam na hoti  tulanti paṇṇikānam viya udaka obbāhanaka tulam karakaṭakaḥ vuccati goṇe vā yojetvā
