original: uddesabhattāni niccaṃ diyyanti, tāni ekacārikabhattāni katvā bhikkhū visuṃ ṭhitikāya
analyzed: uddesa bhattāni niccam diyyanti tāni ekacārika bhattāni katvā bhikkhū visum ṭhitikāya
translated: In the house of a king or a king’s minister, eight very fine meals are regularly given. These are made into one meal for a day of walking for alms. The monks eat it, each on his own, fixed on the day.

original: paribhuñjanti. Ekacce bhikkhū “sve dāni amhākaṃ pāpuṇissantī”ti attano ṭhitikaṃ sallakkhetvā
analyzed: paribhuñjanti ekacce bhikkhū sve dāni amhākam pāpuṇissanti iti attanaḥ ṭhitikam sallakkhetvā
translated: Some monks, thinking, “Tomorrow it will be our turn,” plan their own meal and go away.

original: gatā, tesu anāgatesuyeva aññe āgantukā bhikkhū āgantvā āsanasālāya nisīdanti; taṅkhaṇaññeva
analyzed: gatā tesu anāgatesu yeva aññe āgantukā bhikkhū āgantvā āsanasālāya nisīdanti
translated: Before they return, other newly arrived monks sit down in the dining hall. At that very moment,

original: rājapurisā āgantvā “paṇītabhattapatte dethā”ti vadanti. Āgantukā ṭhitikaṃ ajānantā
analyzed: rāja purisāḥ āgantvā paṇīta bhatta patte detha iti vadanti āgantukāḥ ṭhitikam a jānantā
translated: the king’s men arrive and say, “Give us the bowls with the fine meals.” Not knowing about the meal fixed on a day,🔽the newly arrived monks give them.

original: gāhenti. Taṅkhaṇaññeva ca ṭhitikaṃ jānanakabhikkhū āgantvā “kiṃ gāhethā”ti vadanti.
analyzed: gāhenti ca ṭhitikam jānanaka bhikkhū āgantvā kim gāhetha ati vadanti
translated: At that very moment, the monks who know about the meal fixed on a day arrive and ask, “Why are you giving them?”

original: “Rājagehe paṇītabhatta”nti. “Kativassato paṭṭhāyā”ti? “Ettakavassato nāmā”ti. “Mā
analyzed: rāja gehe paṇīta bhattanti kati vassataḥ paṭṭhāya ati ettaka vassataḥ nāma ati mā
translated: “The fine meals from the king’s house.” “From how many years of seniority?” “From so many years of seniority.” “Don’t give them.”

original: gāhethā”ti nivāretvā ṭhitikāya gāhetabbaṃ. Gāhite āgatehipi pattadānakāle āgatehipi
analyzed: gāhetha ati nivāretvā ṭhitikāya gāhetabbam gāhite āgatehi pi patta dāna kāle āgatehi pi
translated: They stop them from giving and take the meals according to the meal fixed on a day. When the meals are given, they are given to those who have arrived and to those who are about to arrive.

original: dinnakāle āgatehipi rājagehato patte pūretvā āhaṭakāle āgatehipi rājā “ajja bhikkhūyeva🔽āgacchantū”ti pesetvā bhikkhūnaṃyeva hatthe piṇḍapātaṃ deti; evaṃ dinnapiṇḍapātaṃ
analyzed: dinna kāle āgatehi pi rāja gehato patte pūretvā āhaṭa kāle āgatehi pi rājā ajja bhikkhūya iva  āgacchantu uti pesetvā bhikkhūnam yeva hatthe piṇḍapātam deti evam dinna piṇḍapātam
translated: and to those who came when the time for giving was past. He had almsfood brought from the royal palace in a bowl and gave it to those who came when the time for giving was past.🔽The king sent a message, “Let the monks come today,” and gave almsfood to the monks only.🔽

original: gahetvā āgatakāle āgatehipi ṭhitikaṃ jānanakabhikkhūhi “mā bhuñjitthā”ti vāretvā🔽ṭhitikāyameva gāhetabbaṃ.
analyzed: gahetvā āgata kāle āgatehi pi ṭhitikam jānanaka bhikkhūhi mā bhuñjittha ati vāretvā  ṭhiti kāyam eva gāhetabbam
translated: If they come when the alms are being given out, if they come when the alms are brought back in the alms-bowl after being filled from the royal kitchen, if the king sends a message, “Let the bhikkhus come today,” and gives them alms in the hands of the bhikkhus, if they come when the alms given in this way are being taken away, the bhikkhus who know about the turn should prevent them from eating, saying, “Do not eat,” and they should take the turn.

original: Atha ne rājā bhojetvā pattepi nesaṃ pūretvā deti, yaṃ āhaṭaṃ taṃ ṭhitikāya gāhetabbaṃ.
analyzed: atha ne rājā bhojetvā patte pi nesam pūretvā deti yam āhaṭam tam ṭhitikāya gāhetabbam
translated: If the king feeds them and gives them alms filled in their bowls, the alms brought back should be taken into the turn.

original: Sace pana “mā tucchahatthā gacchantū”ti thokameva pattesu pakkhittaṃ hoti, taṃ na
analyzed: sace pana mā tuccha hatthāḥ gacchantu uti thokam eva pattesu pakkhittam hoti tam na
translated: But if he puts a little in their bowls, thinking, “Let them not go away empty-bowled,” it should not be taken into the turn.

original: gāhetabbaṃ. Atha bhuñjitvā tucchapattāva āgacchanti, yaṃ tehi bhuttaṃ, taṃ nesaṃ
analyzed: gāhetabbam atha bhuñjitvā tuccha pattāvaḥ āgacchanti yam tehi bhuttam tam na īsam
translated: But if they come back with empty bowls after eating, then what they have eaten is on their account, says the Elder Maha-Sumana.

original: gīvā hotīti mahāsumatthero āha. Mahāpadumatthero panāha – “gīvākiccaṃ ettha natthi,
analyzed: gīvā hoti iti mahāsuma theraḥ āha mahāpaduma theraḥ pana āha gīvā kiccam ettha natthi
translated: But the Elder Maha-Paduma says that there is no offence here,

original: ṭhitikaṃ pana ajānantehi yāva jānanakā āgacchanti, tāva nisīditabbaṃ siyā; evaṃ santepi
analyzed: ṭhitikam pana a jānantehi yāva jānanakāḥ āgacchanti tāva nisīditabbam siyā evam sante pi
translated: but that they should sit down until they know about the turn if they do not know about it, and that in this way they will not be transgressing the rule.

original: bhuttaṃ subhuttaṃ, idāni pattaṭṭhānena gāhetabba”nti.
analyzed: bhuttam su bhuttam idāni patta ṭṭhānena gāhetabbanti
translated: “It’s been well eaten. Now you should take it with the bowl.”

original: Eko ticīvaraparivāro satagghanako piṇḍapāto avassikassa bhikkhuno patto, vihāre ca
analyzed: ekaḥ ti cīvara parivāraḥ sata ghanakaḥ piṇḍapātaḥ avassikassa bhikkhuno pattaḥ vihāre ca
translated: A monk who had completed the rainy season and who had three robes and a hundred kahāpaṇa coins received a bowl as a gift. The monks wrote down,

original: “evarūpo piṇḍapāto avassikassa patto”ti likhitvā ṭhapesuṃ. Atha saṭṭhivassaccayena
analyzed: evarūpaḥ piṇḍapātaḥ avassikassa patto ti likhitvā ṭhapesuṃ atha
translated: “This kind of bowl is for a monk who has completed the rainy season,” and they kept it. Then, after sixty years,

original: añño tathārūpo piṇḍapāto uppanno, ayaṃ kiṃ avassikaṭṭhitikāya gāhetabbo, udāhu saṭṭhivassikaṭṭhitikāyāti.
analyzed: aññaḥ tathārūpaḥ piṇḍapātaḥ uppannaḥ ayam kim a vassika ṭṭhitikāya gāhetabbo udāhu saṭṭhi vassika ṭṭhitikāya ati
translated: another bowl of the same kind was received as a gift. “Should this be taken as a gift for a monk who has completed the rainy season, or as a gift for a monk who has completed sixty years?”

original: Saṭṭhivassikaṭṭhitikāyāti vuttaṃ, ayañhi bhikkhu ṭhitikaṃ gahetvāyeva vaḍḍhitoti.🔽Eko uddesabhattaṃ bhuñjitvā sāmaṇero jāto, puna taṃ bhattaṃ sāmaṇeraṭṭhitikāya pattaṃ
analyzed: saṭṭhivassika ṭṭhitikāya iti vuttam ayam hi bhikkhu ṭhitikam gahetvāya iva vaḍḍhito ti  ekaḥ uddesa bhattam bhuñjitvā sāmaṇeraḥ jātaḥ puna tam bhattam sāmaṇera ṭṭhitikāya pattam
translated: “It should be taken as a gift for a monk who has completed sixty years,” it was said. For this monk has grown up since he received the gift.

original: gaṇhituṃ labhati. Ayaṃ kira antarābhaṭṭhako nāma. Yo pana paripuṇṇavasso sāmaṇero
analyzed: gaṇhitum labhati ayam kira antarābhaṭṭhakaḥ nāma yaḥ pana paripuṇṇa vassaḥ sāmaṇero
translated: A monk who had eaten a meal for recitation became a novice monk. He then received that meal again as a gift for a novice monk. This is called an “interrupted meal”. But a novice monk who has completed the rainy season

original: “sve uddesabhattaṃ labhissatī”ti ajjeva upasampajjati, atikkantā tassa ṭhitikā. Ekassa
analyzed: sve uddesa bhattam labhissati iti ajja iva upasampajjati atikkantā tassa ṭhitikā ekassa
translated: “Tomorrow I’ll receive a meal for recitation,” and he goes forth that very day, then the gift is not for him.

original: bhikkhuno uddesabhattaṃ pattaṃ, patto cassa na tuccho hoti, so aññassa samīpe nisinnassa🔽pattaṃ dāpeti, tañce theyyāya haranti, gīvā hoti. Sace pana so bhikkhu “mayhaṃ pattaṃ🔽dammī”ti sayameva deti, assa gīvā na hoti. Athāpi tena bhattena anatthiko hutvā “alaṃ
analyzed: bhikkhuno uddesa bhattam pattam patto cassa na tucchaḥ hoti so aññassa samīpe nisinnassa  pattam dāpeti tam ce theyyāya haranti gīvā hoti sace pana so bhikkhu mayham pattam  dammi iti sayam eva deti assa gīvā na hoti atha api tena bhattena anatthikaḥ hutvā alam
translated: If a monk has a meal by invitation and his bowl is not empty, and he gives his bowl to someone sitting near him, and they steal it, he is at fault. But if that monk himself gives it, saying, “I give you my bowl,” he is not at fault. But if he is not in need of that meal and says, “I give,”

original: mayhaṃ, tavetaṃ bhattaṃ dammi, pattaṃ pesetvā āharāpehī”ti aññaṃ vadati, yaṃ tato🔽āharīyati sabbaṃ pattasāmikassa hoti. Pattañce theyyāya haranti, suhaṭo; bhattassa🔽dinnattā gīvā na hoti.🔽Vihāre dasa bhikkhū honti, tesu nava piṇḍapātikā, eko sādiyanako. “Dasa uddesapatte
analyzed: mayham tava etam bhattam dammi pattam pesetvā āhara apehi iti aññam vadati yam tatas  āharīyati sabbam patta sāmikassa hoti pattam ce theyyāya haranti su haṭaḥ bhattassa  dinnattā gīvā na hoti  vihāre dasa bhikkhū honti tesu nava piṇḍapātikāḥ ekaḥ sādiyanakaḥ dasa uddesa patte
translated: If a monk has a meal by invitation and his bowl is not empty, and he gives his bowl to someone sitting near him, and they steal it, he is at fault. But if that monk himself gives it, saying, “I give you my bowl,” he is not at fault. If, not wanting that meal, he says, “I don’t need it. I give it to you. Send someone to fetch my bowl,” then whatever is brought is for the owner of the bowl. If they steal the bowl, it is well stolen; he is not at fault, because the meal was given.

original: dethā”ti vutte piṇḍapātikā gahetuṃ na icchanti. Itaro bhikkhu “sabbāni mayhaṃ pāpuṇantī”ti
analyzed: detha iti vutte piṇḍapātikāḥ gahetum na icchanti itaraḥ bhikkhu sabbāni mayham pāpuṇanti iti
translated: If there are ten monks in a monastery, nine of whom are almsfood eaters, and one is a receiver of invitations, and it is said, “Give ten invitation bowls,” the almsfood eaters do not want to take one. The other monk thinks, “All of them are for me,” and he takes them all.

original: gaṇhāti, ṭhitikā na hoti. Ekekaṃ ce pāpetvā gaṇhāti, ṭhitikā tiṭṭhati. Evaṃ gāhetvā
analyzed: gaṇhāti ṭhitikā na hoti ekekam ce pāpetvā gaṇhāti ṭhitikā tiṭṭhati evam gāhetvā
translated: If he takes them one by one, the collection is not valid. If he takes them all together, the collection is valid.

original: dasahipi pattehi āharāpetvā “bhante, mayhaṃ saṅgahaṃ karothā”ti nava patte piṇḍapātikānaṃ
analyzed: dasahi api pattehi āharāpetvā bhante mayham saṅgaham karotha ati nava patte piṇḍapātikānam
translated: Having collected them in this way, he has them brought back in ten bowlfuls and says, “Venerables, make a collection for me.” He gives the nine bowlfuls to the alms-collectors,

original: deti, bhikkhudattiyaṃ nāmetaṃ, gaṇhituṃ vaṭṭati.🔽Sace so upāsako “bhante, gharaṃ āgantabba”nti vadati, so ca bhikkhu te bhikkhū “etha,
analyzed: deti bhikkhudattiyam nāma etam gaṇhitum vaṭṭati  sace saḥ upāsakaḥ bhante gharam āgantabbanti vadati saḥ ca bhikkhu te bhikkhū etha
translated: but not the one that belongs to the donor. It is allowable to take that.

original: bhante, mayhaṃ sahāyā hothā”ti tassa gharaṃ gacchati. Yaṃ tattha labhati, sabbaṃ🔽tasseva hoti. Itare tena dinnaṃ labhanti. Atha nesaṃ ghareyeva nisīdāpetvā dakkhiṇodakaṃ🔽datvā yāgukhajjakādīni denti, “bhante, yaṃ manussā denti, taṃ gaṇhathā”ti tassa bhikkhuno
analyzed: bhante mayham sahāyāḥ hotha ati tassa gharam gacchati yam tattha labhati sabbam  tassa iva hoti itare tena dinnam labhanti atha na isam nisīdāpetvā dakkhiṇa udakam  da tvā yāgu khajjaka ādīni denti bhante yam manussāḥ denti tam gaṇhatha ati tassa bhikkhuno
translated: If that lay follower says, “Come to my house, Venerables,” and if that monk goes to his house, taking the other monks with him, saying, “Come, Venerables, be my companions,” then whatever he gets there belongs to him.

original: vacaneneva itaresaṃ vaṭṭati. Bhuttāvīnaṃ patte pūretvā gaṇhitvā gamanatthāya denti,
analyzed: vacanena iva itaresam vaṭṭati bhuttāvīnam patte pūretvā gaṇhitvā gamana atthāya denti
translated: The others get what he gives them. If he has them sit down right there and gives them rice gruel, fresh food, or cooked food, saying, “Venerables, take what people give you,” then it is allowable for the others to accept it on the instruction of that monk. If he fills their bowls with food after they have eaten and gives it to them to take away,

original: sabbaṃ tasseva bhikkhuno hoti, tena dinnaṃ itaresaṃ vaṭṭati.🔽Yadi pana te vihāreyeva tena bhikkhunā “bhante, mayhaṃ bhikkhaṃ gaṇhatha, manussānañca
analyzed: sabbam tassa iva bhikkhunaḥ hoti tena dinnam itaresam vaṭṭati  yadi pana te vihāreya iva tena bhikkhunā bhante mayham bhikkham gaṇhatha manussānam ca
translated: All belongs to that monk. What is given by him is allowable for the others.🔽But if they go after being told by that monk in those dwellings, “Venerable sirs, take my alms; it is proper for me to do what the people say,”

original: vacanaṃ kātuṃ vaṭṭatī”ti vuttā gacchanti, yaṃ tattha bhuñjanti ceva nīharanti ca,
analyzed: vacanam kātum vaṭṭati iti vuttāḥ gacchanti yam tattha bhuñjanti ca iva nīharanti ca
translated: then what they eat there and what they bring out

original: sabbaṃ taṃ tasseva santakaṃ. Athāpi “mayhaṃ bhikkhaṃ gaṇhathā”ti avuttā “manussānaṃ🔽vacanaṃ kātuṃ vaṭṭatī”ti gacchanti, tatra ce ekassa madhurena sarena anumodanaṃ karontassa
analyzed: sabbam tam tassa iva santakam atha api mayham bhikkham gaṇhatha ati a vuttāḥ manussānam  vacanam kātum vaṭṭati iti gacchanti tatra ce ekassa madhurena sarena anumodanam karontassa
translated: all belongs to him. But if they go without being told, “Take my alms,” but after being told, “It is proper for me to do what the people say,”🔽and if there, after hearing the elder monks’ words of rejoicing spoken with a sweet voice,

original: sutvā therānañca upasame pasīditvā bahuṃ samaṇaparikkhāraṃ denti, ayaṃ theresu pasādena
analyzed: sutvā therā anañca upasame pasīditvā bahum samaṇa parikkhāram denti ayam theresu pasādena
translated: they are confirmed in confidence and give much requisites for the Community, this “share in what is not done”

original: uppanno “akatabhāgo” nāma, tasmā sabbesaṃ pāpuṇāti.
analyzed: uppannaḥ a kata bhāgaḥ nāma tasmā sabbesam pāpuṇāti
translated: arises through confidence in the elders. Therefore it belongs to all.

original: Eko saṅghato uddisāpetvā ṭhitikāya gāhitaṃ pattaṃ haritvā paṇītassa khādanīyabhojanīyassa
analyzed: ekaḥ saṅghataḥ uddisāpetvā ṭhitikāya gāhitam pattam haritvā paṇītassa khādanīya bhojanīyassa
translated: One who has had a bowl assigned to the Community and then takes it away and uses it for good food and drink,

original: pūretvā āharitvā “imaṃ, bhante, sabbo saṅgho paribhuñjatū”ti deti, sabbehi bhājetvā
analyzed: pūretvā āharitvā imam bhante sabbaḥ saṅghaḥ paribhuñjatu iti deti sabbehi bhājetvā
translated: and then, having filled it, he gives it to the Sangha, saying, “Venerables, may the whole Sangha enjoy this,” it should be shared out to everyone.

original: paribhuñjitabbaṃ. Pattasāmikassa pana atikkantampi ṭhitikaṃ ṭhapetvā aññaṃ uddesabhattaṃ
analyzed: paribhuñjitabbam patta sāmikassa pana atikkantam pi ṭhitikam ṭhapetvā aññam uddesa bhattam
translated: If he fills it and brings it back, saying, “Venerables, may the whole Sangha eat this,” it should be shared out among all. But the owner of the bowl should be given a bowl that is left over or a bowl that has been designated.

original: dātabbaṃ. Atha “paṭhamaṃyeva sabbaṃ saṅghikaṃ pattaṃ dethā”ti vadati, ekassa lajjibhikkhuno🔽santako patto dātabbo. Āharitvā ca “sabbo saṅgho paribhuñjatū”ti vutte bhājetvā paribhuñjitabbaṃ.
analyzed: dātabbam atha paṭhamam yeva sabbam saṅghikam pattam detha iti vadati ekassa lajji bhikkhuno  santakaḥ pattaḥ dātabbaḥ āharitvā ca sabbaḥ saṅghaḥ paribhuñjatu iti vutte bhājetvā paribhuñjitabbam
translated: If he says, “First give me a bowl that belongs to the Sangha,” then a bowl that belongs to a monk who is modest should be given to him.🔽If he brings it back, saying, “May the whole Sangha eat this,” it should be shared out and eaten.

original: Eko pātiyā bhattaṃ āharitvā “saṅghuddesaṃ dammī”ti vadati, ekekaṃ ālopaṃ adatvā ṭhitikāya🔽ekassa yāpanamattaṃ katvā dātabbaṃ. Atha so bhattaṃ āharitvā kiñci vattuṃ ajānanto
analyzed: ekaḥ pātiyā bhattam āharitvā saṅgha uddesam dammi iti vadati ekekam ālopam a datvā ṭhitikāya  ekassa yāpana mattam katvā dātabbam atha saḥ bhattam āharitvā kiñci vattum a jānanto
translated: If he brings back almsfood in a bowl, saying, “I give this to the Sangha,” it should be given to each monk for his sustenance, without giving a portion for the collective.

original: tuṇhībhūto acchati, “kassa te ānītaṃ, kassa dātukāmosī”ti na vattabbaṃ. Pucchāsabhāgena
analyzed: tuṇhībhūtaḥ acchati kassa te ānītam kassa dātu kāmo asi iti na vattabbam pucchā sabhāgena
translated: If he brings back almsfood in a bowl, but is unable to say anything, he should be asked, “Who did you bring this for? Whom do you want to give it to?” He should not be told, “You should have asked first.”

original: hi “tumhākaṃ ānītaṃ, tumhākaṃ dātukāmomhī”ti vadeyya, tato taṃ bhikkhuṃ aññe bhikkhū
analyzed: hi tumhākam ānītam tumhākam dātu kāmo asi iti vadeyya tatas tam bhikkhum aññe bhikkhū
translated: “I have brought it for you. I want to give it to you,”🔽then other bhikkhus

original: jigucchantā gīvaṃ parivattetvā oloketabbampi na maññeyyuṃ. Sace pana “kuhiṃ yāsi,
analyzed: jigucchantāḥ gīvam parivattetvā oloketabbam pi na maññeyyum sace pana kuhim yāsi
translated: If he were to say, “I’ve brought it for you. I want to give it to you,” then other monks would be disgusted with that monk. They would not even want to look at him, let alone turn their necks to look.🔽But if he were to say, “Where are you going?

original: kiṃ karonto āhiṇḍasī”ti vutte “uddesabhattaṃ gahetvā āgatomhī”ti vadati, ekena lajjibhikkhunā
analyzed: kim karontaḥ āhiṇḍasi iti vutte uddesa bhattam gahetvā āgataḥ ahi iti vadati ekena lajji bhikkhunā
translated: What are you doing?” and then say, “I’m going to get a meal for the recitation,” then a modest monk should take it on trust.

original: ṭhitikāya gāhetabbaṃ. Sace ābhataṃ bahu hoti, sabbesaṃ pahoti, ṭhitikākiccaṃ natthi,
analyzed: ṭhitikāya gāhetabbam sace ābhatam bahu hoti sabbesam pahoti ṭhitikā kiccam natthi
translated: If what he has brought is a lot and it’s enough for everyone, there’s no need to take it on trust.

original: therāsanato paṭṭhāya pattaṃ pūretvā dātabbaṃ.
analyzed: thera āsanataḥ paṭṭhāya pattam pūretvā dātabbam
translated: Starting with the most senior monk, he should fill their almsbowls and give it to them.

original: “Saṅghuddesapattaṃ dethā”ti vutte “kiṃ āharissasī”ti avatvā pakatiṭṭhitikāya eva
analyzed: saṅgha uddesa pattam detha iti vutte kim āharissasi iti a vatvā pakati ṭṭhitikāya eva
translated: If he says, “Give me the almsfood for the Sangha,” he should not be asked, “What will you bring?” He should be taken on trust as usual.

original: gāhetabbaṃ. Yo pana pāyāso vā rasapiṇḍapāto vā niccaṃ labbhati; evarūpānaṃ paṇītabhojanānaṃ
analyzed: gāhetabbam yaḥ pana pāyāsaḥ vā rasa piṇḍapātaḥ vā niccam labbhati evarūpānam paṇīta bhojanānam
translated: But if the rice porridge or the lump sweets are always available, or if it’s a special kind of fine food,

original: āveṇikā ṭhitikā kātabbā, tathā saparivārāya yāguyā mahagghānaṃ phalānaṃ paṇītānañca
analyzed: āveṇikā ṭhitikā kātabbā tathā sa parivārāya yāguyā mahagghānam phalānam paṇītānam ca
translated: then a special trust should be established. The same applies to the meat broth, the expensive fruits, and the fine foods.

original: khajjakānaṃ. Pakatibhattayāguphalakhajjakānaṃ pana ekāva ṭhitikā kātabbā. “Sappiṃ🔽āharissāmī”ti vutte sabbasappīnaṃ ekāva ṭhitikā vaṭṭati, tathā sabbatelānaṃ. “Madhuṃ🔽āharissāmī”ti vutte pana madhuno ekāva ṭhitikā vaṭṭati, tathā phāṇitassa laṭṭhimadhukādīnañca
analyzed: khajjakānam pakati bhatta yāgu phala khajjakānam pana ekā ava ṭhitikā kātabbā sappim  āharissāmi iti vutte sabba sappīnam ekā ava ṭhitikā vaṭṭati tathā sabba telānam madhum  āharissāmi iti vutte pana madhunaḥ ekā ava ṭhitikā vaṭṭati tathā phāṇitassa laṭṭhi madhuka ādīnam ca
translated: and for the fresh foods. But only one storage place is allowed for the regular rice, rice gruel, cakes, and fresh foods. If he says, “I’ll bring ghee,” only one storage place is allowed for all the ghee. Likewise, all the oil. If he says, “I’ll bring honey,” only one storage place is allowed for the honey. Likewise, for molasses, for the medicinal plants such as the bamboo manna, etc.,

original: bhesajjānaṃ. Sace pana gandhamālaṃ saṅghuddesaṃ denti, piṇḍapātikassa vaṭṭati, na
analyzed: bhesajjānam sace pana gandha mālam saṅgha uddesam denti piṇḍapātikassa vaṭṭati na
translated: and for the medicinal roots. But if they give fragrant garlands for the Sangha, it is allowable for one who goes on alms round.

original: vaṭṭatīti. Āmisasseva paṭikkhittattā vaṭṭati, saṅghaṃ uddissa dinnattā pana na gahetabbanti vadanti.
analyzed: vaṭṭati iti āmisassa iva paṭikkhitta ttā vaṭṭati saṅgham uddissa dinna ttā pana na gahetabbanti vadanti
translated: It is allowable, they say, because it is prohibited only in the case of material goods, but it should not be received because it was given for the Sangha.

original: Uddesabhattakathā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: uddesa bhatta kathā niṭṭhitā
translated: The discussion of the invitation ceremony is finished.

original: Nimantanabhattakathā
analyzed: nimantana bhatta kathā
translated: The discussion of the meal by invitation

original: Nimantanaṃ puggalikañce, sayameva issaro. Saṅghikaṃ pana uddesabhatte vuttanayeneva
analyzed: nimantanam sayam eva issaraḥ saṅghikam pana uddesa bhatte vutta nayena iva
translated: If the invitation is for an individual, he is the master. But if it is for the Sangha, it should be received in the way already described for the invitation ceremony.

original: gāhetabbaṃ. Sace panettha dūto byatto hoti, “bhante, rājagehe bhikkhusaṅghassa bhattaṃ
analyzed: gāhetabbam sace pana ittha dūtaḥ byattaḥ hoti bhante rājagehe bhikkhu saṅghassa bhattam
translated: But if the messenger is competent, he should say, “Venerables, there is a meal offered at the king’s house for the Sangha with the Buddha at its head.

original: gaṇhathā”ti avatvā “bhikkhaṃ gaṇhathā”ti vadati, piṇḍapātikānampi vaṭṭati. Atha dūto
analyzed: gaṇhatha ati avatvā bhikkham gaṇhatha ati vadati piṇḍapātikānam pi vaṭṭati atha dūto
translated: but he says, “Receive alms,” then it is allowable for those who go for alms. If the messenger

original: abyatto “bhattaṃ gaṇhathā”ti vadati, bhattuddesako byatto “bhatta”nti avatvā “bhante,
analyzed: abyattaḥ bhattam gaṇhatha iti vadati bhattuddesakaḥ byattaḥ a vatvā bhante
translated: is not skilled and says, “Receive a meal,” but the meal-inviter is skilled and says, “Venerable sirs,

original: tumhe yāthā”ti vadati; evampi piṇḍapātikānampi vaṭṭati. Tumhākaṃ paṭipāṭiyā “bhattaṃ
analyzed: tumhe yātha iti vadati evam pi piṇḍapātikānam pi vaṭṭati tumhākam paṭipāṭiyā bhattam
translated: you are to go on such-and-such a day,” then it is allowable for those who go for alms. But if he says, “You will receive a meal

original: pāpuṇātī”ti vutte pana na vaṭṭati. Sace nimantetuṃ āgatamanusso āsanasālaṃ pavisitvā
analyzed: pāpuṇāti iti vutte pana na vaṭṭati sace nimantetum āgata manussaḥ āsana sālam pavisitvā
translated: in turn,” then it is not allowable. If the man who has come to invite enters the refectory and

original: “aṭṭha bhikkhū dethā”ti vā “aṭṭha patte dethā”ti vā vadati; evampi piṇḍapātikānaṃ
analyzed: aṭṭha bhikkhū detha iti vā aṭṭha patte detha iti vā vadati evam pi piṇḍapātikānam
translated: says, “Give eight bhikkhus,” or “Give eight alms-bowls,” then it is allowable for those who go for alms,

original: vaṭṭati, “tumhe ca tumhe ca gacchathā”ti vattabbaṃ. Sace pana “aṭṭha bhikkhū detha;
analyzed: vaṭṭati tumhe ca tumhe ca gacchatha ati vattabbam sace pana aṭṭha bhikkhū detha
translated: and he should be told, “You go and they go.” But if he says, “Give eight bhikkhus;

original: bhattaṃ gaṇhatha, aṭṭha patte detha; bhattaṃ gaṇhathā”ti vadati, paṭipāṭiyā gāhetabbaṃ.
analyzed: bhattam gaṇhatha aṭṭha patte detha bhattam gaṇhatha ati vadati paṭipāṭiyā gāhetabbam
translated: receive a meal. Give eight alms-bowls; receive a meal,” then it should be received in turn.

original: Gāhentena pana vicchinditvā “bhatta”nti avadantena “tumhe ca tumhe ca gacchathā”ti
analyzed: gāhentena pana vicchinditvā a vadantena tumhe ca tumhe ca gacchatha ati
translated: But in receiving it, he should not break the continuity by saying, “A meal.” He should say, “You go and they go.”

original: vutte piṇḍapātikānaṃ vaṭṭati. “Bhante, tumhākaṃ pattaṃ detha, tumhe ethā”ti vutte
analyzed: vutte piṇḍapātikānam vaṭṭati bhante tumhākam pattam detha tumhe etha ati vutte
translated: then, if they say, “Give us your bowl, venerable sirs, and come,”🔽it is proper to go, saying, “Very well, lay follower.”

original: pana “sādhu, upāsakā”ti gantabbaṃ. Saṅghato uddisitvā “tumhe ethā”ti vuttepi yathāṭhitikāya gāhetabbaṃ.
analyzed: pana sādhu upāsakā ati gantabbam saṅghataḥ uddisitvā tumhe etha ati vutte pi yathāṭhitikāya gāhetabbam
translated: But if they say, “Come,” after announcing it to the Community, the bowl should be taken on trust.

original: Nimantanabhattagharato pana pattatthāya āgatassa uddesabhatte vuttanayeneva ṭhitikāya
analyzed: nimantana bhatta gharataḥ pana patta atthāya āgatassa uddesa bhatte vutta nayena iva ṭhitikāya
translated: But if a bowl is brought from a house where an invitation meal is given, the bowl should be taken on trust in the way already stated for the bowl brought for the purpose of receiving the meal announced to the Community.

original: patto dātabbo. Eko “saṅghato paṭipāṭiyā patta”nti avatvā kevalaṃ “ekaṃ pattaṃ dethā”ti
analyzed: pattaḥ dātabbaḥ ekaḥ saṅghataḥ paṭipāṭiyā pattanti avatvā kevalam ekam pattam detha ati
translated: If one person, without saying, “The bowl is to be taken in turn from the Community,” simply says, “Give me a bowl,”

original: vatvā agāhiteyeva patte yassa kassaci pattaṃ gahetvā pūretvā āharati, taṃ pattasāmikasseva
analyzed: vatvā patte yassa kassaci pattam gahetvā pūretvā āharati tam patta sāmikassa iva
translated: and he takes the bowl of anyone at all and fills it, it belongs to the owner of the bowl;🔽it should not be taken on trust as in the case of the meal announced to the Community.

original: hoti, uddesabhatte viya ṭhitikāya na gāhetabbaṃ. Idhāpi yo āgantvā tuṇhībhūto tiṭṭhati,
analyzed: hoti uddesa bhatte viya ṭhitikāya na gāhetabbam idha api yaḥ āgantvā tuṇhībhūto tiṭṭhati
translated: Here too, if someone comes and stands there silently,

original: so “kassa santikaṃ āgatosī”ti vā “kassa pattaṃ harissasī”ti vā na vattabbo.
analyzed: saḥ kassa santikam āgataḥ asi iti vā kassa pattam harissasi iti vā na vattabbo
translated: he should not be asked, “To whom do you belong? Whose bowl will you take?”

original: Pucchāsabhāgena hi “tumhākaṃ santikaṃ āgato, tumhākaṃ pattaṃ harissāmī”ti vadeyya,
analyzed: pucchāsabhāgena hi tumhākam santikam āgataḥ tumhākam pattam harissāmi iti vadeyya
translated: For if he were asked in this way, he would say, “I belong to you, I will take your bowl.”

original: tato so bhikkhu bhikkhūhi jigucchanīyo assa. “Kuhiṃ gacchasi, kiṃ karonto āhiṇḍasī”ti🔽pana vutte “tassa pattatthāya āgatomhī”ti vadantassa paṭipāṭiyā bhattaṭṭhitikāya
analyzed: tatas saḥ bhikkhu bhikkhūhi jigucchanīyaḥ assa kuhim gacchasi kim karontaḥ āhiṇḍasi iti  pana vutte tassa patta atthāya āgataḥ ahi iti vadantassa paṭipāṭiyā bhatta ṭṭhitikāya
translated: Then the monks would be disgusted with that monk.🔽But if he says, “I’ve come for his bowl,” he should be given a meal in the proper sequence.

original: gāhetvā patto dātabbo. “Bhattāharaṇakapattaṃ dethā”ti vuttepi paṭipāṭiyā bhattaṭṭhitikāya
analyzed: gāhetvā pattaḥ dātabbaḥ bhatta āharaṇaka pattam detha ati vutte pi paṭipāṭiyā bhatta ṭṭhitikāya
translated: If he says, “Give me a bowl for carrying almsfood,” he should be given a bowl in the proper sequence.

original: eva dātabbo. Sace āharitvā “sabbo saṅgho bhuñjatū”ti vadati, bhājetvā bhuñjitabbaṃ.
analyzed: eva dātabbaḥ sace āharitvā sabbaḥ saṅghaḥ bhuñjatu iti vadati bhājetvā bhuñjitabbam
translated: If he says, “Let the whole Sangha eat,” it should be shared out and then eaten.

original: Pattasāmikassa atikkantampi ṭhitikaṃ ṭhapetvā aññaṃ paṭipāṭibhattaṃ gāhetabbaṃ.
analyzed: patta sāmikassa atikkantam pi ṭhitikam ṭhapetvā aññam paṭipāṭibhattam gāhetabbam
translated: He should be given a meal in the proper sequence, but not one that is already overdue.

original: Eko pātiyā bhattaṃ āharitvā “saṅghassa dammī”ti vadati, ālopabhattaṭṭhitikato paṭṭhāya🔽ālopasaṅkhepena bhājetabbaṃ. Sace pana tuṇhībhūto acchati, “kassa te ābhataṃ, kassa
analyzed: ekaḥ pātiyā bhattam āharitvā saṅghassa dammi iti vadati ālopa bhatta ṭṭhitikato paṭṭhāya  ālopa saṅkhepena bhājetabbam sace pana tuṇhībhūtaḥ acchati kassa te ābhatam kassa
translated: If someone brings a meal in a bowl and says, “I give it to the Sangha,” it should be shared out and then eaten, starting with the smallest portion.🔽If he remains silent, he shouldn’t be asked, “Who did you get it from?🔽Who do you want to give it to?”

original: dātukāmosī”ti na vattabbo. Sace pana “kuhiṃ gacchasi, kiṃ karonto āhiṇḍasī”ti vutte
analyzed: dātu kāmo asi iti na vattabbaḥ sace pana kuhim gacchasi kim karontaḥ āhiṇḍasi iti vutte
translated: But if he says, “Where are you going? What are you doing?” he should be given a meal in the proper sequence.

original: “saṅghassa me bhattaṃ ābhataṃ, therānaṃ me bhattaṃ ābhata”nti vadati, gahetvā ālopabhattaṭṭhitikāya
analyzed: saṅghassa me bhattam ābhatam therānam me bhattam ābhatanti vadati gahetvā ālopa bhatta ṭṭhitikāya
translated: “I have had a meal prepared for the Community,” or “I have had a meal prepared for the senior monks,” he should be told, “Take it and give it to those who are eating a shared meal.”

original: bhājetabbaṃ. Sace pana evaṃ ābhataṃ bahuṃ hoti, sakalassa saṅghassa bahu hoti, abhihaṭabhikkhā
analyzed: bhājetabbam sace pana evam ābhatam bahum hoti sakalassa saṅghassa bahu hoti abhihaṭa bhikkhā
translated: But if what has been prepared is much and is enough for the whole Community, it is called “alms food brought back” (abhihaṭabhikkhā).

original: nāma piṇḍapātikānampi vaṭṭati, ṭhitikāpucchanakiccaṃ natthi, therāsanato paṭṭhāya
analyzed: nāma piṇḍapātikānam pi vaṭṭati ṭhitikā pucchana kiccam natthi thera āsanataḥ paṭṭhāya
translated: This is allowable even for those who live on alms food collected on their alms round. There is no need to ask for permission to eat it. Starting from the senior monk’s seat,

original: pattaṃ pūretvā dātabbaṃ.🔽Upāsako saṅghattherassa vā ganthadhutaṅgavasena abhiññātassa vā bhattuddesakassa
analyzed: pattam pūretvā dātabbam  upāsako saṅgha ttherassa vā gantha dhutaṅga vasena abhiññātassa vā bhattuddesakassa
translated: it should be given by filling the bowls.

original: vā pahiṇāti “amhākaṃ bhattagahaṇatthāya aṭṭha bhikkhū gahetvā āgacchathā”ti, sacepi
analyzed: vā pahiṇāti amhākam bhatta gahaṇa tthāya aṭṭha bhikkhū gahetvā āgacchatha ati sace pi
translated: If a lay follower sends a message to the senior monk of the Community or to a well-known monk or to the monk who is the assigner of meals, saying, “Please come and take a meal from me, taking eight monks,”

original: ñātiupaṭṭhākehi pesitaṃ hoti, ime tayo janā pucchituṃ na labhanti, āruḷhāyeva mātikaṃ,
analyzed: ñāti upaṭṭhākehi pesitam hoti ime tayo janā pucchitum na labhanti āruḷhāya iva mātikam
translated: even if he has been sent by relatives or supporters, these three people are not allowed to ask. The method of selection is as follows.

original: saṅghato aṭṭha bhikkhū uddisāpetvā attanavamehi gantabbaṃ. Kasmā? Bhikkhusaṅghassa
analyzed: saṅghataḥ aṭṭha bhikkhū uddisāpetvā atta navamehi gantabbam kasmā bhikkhu saṅghassa
translated: The senior monk should inform the Community, “We have been invited by so and so. Those who want to go may go.”

original: hi ete bhikkhū nissāya lābho uppajjatīti. Ganthadhutaṅgādīhi pana anabhiññāto āvāsikabhikkhu
analyzed: hi ete bhikkhū nissāya lābhaḥ uppajjati iti gantha dhutaṅga ādīhi pana anabhiññātaḥ āvāsika bhikkhu
translated: for it is on account of these bhikkhus that the gain arises. But if the resident bhikkhus are not well known for their virtue and concentration and wisdom,

original: pucchituṃ labhati, tasmā tena “kiṃ saṅghato gaṇhāmi, udāhu ye jānāmi, tehi saddhiṃ
analyzed: pucchitum labhati tasmai tena kim saṅghataḥ gaṇhāmi udāhu ye jānāmi tehi saddhim
translated: he may ask them, “Shall I take it from the Sangha or shall I come with those I know?”

original: āgacchāmī”ti mātikaṃ āropetvā yathā dāyakā vadanti, tathā paṭipajjitabbaṃ. “Tumhākaṃ
analyzed: āgacchāmi iti mātikam āropetvā yathā dāyakāḥ vadanti tathā paṭipajjitabbam tumhākam
translated: So he should make a note of it and act according to what the donors say.

original: nissitake vā ye vā jānātha, te gahetvā ethā”ti vutte pana ye icchanti, tehi saddhiṃ
analyzed: nissitake vā ye vā jānātha te gahetvā etha ati vutte pana ye icchanti tehi saddhim
translated: But if they say, “Take it from those you know or from those you think fit,” then he may go with those he wishes.

original: gantuṃ labhati. Sace “aṭṭha bhikkhū pahiṇathā”ti pesenti, saṅghatova pesetabbā. Attanā🔽sace aññasmiṃ gāme sakkā hoti bhikkhā labhituṃ, añño gāmo gantabbo. Na sakkā ce hoti
analyzed: gantum labhati sace aṭṭha bhikkhū pahiṇatha ati pesenti saṅghataḥ vā pesetabbāḥ attanā  sace aññasmin gāme sakkā hoti bhikkhāḥ labhitum aññaḥ gāmaḥ gantabbaḥ na sakkā ce hoti
translated: If they send a message, “Send eight bhikkhus,” then only the Sangha should be sent.🔽If he can get alms in another village, he can go there.

original: labhituṃ, soyeva gāmo piṇḍāya pavisitabbo.
analyzed: labhitum saḥ yā iva gāmaḥ piṇḍāya pavisitabbo
translated: But if he cannot get alms there, he should enter that village for alms.

original: Nimantitabhikkhū āsanasālāya nisinnā honti, tatra ce manussā “patte dethā”ti āgacchanti,
analyzed: nimantita bhikkhū āsanasālāya nisinnāḥ honti tatra ce manussā patte detha ati āgacchanti
translated: If the invited bhikkhus are sitting in the dining hall and people come saying, “Give bowls,”

original: animantitehi na dātabbā. “Ete nimantitabhikkhū”ti vattabbaṃ. “Tumhepi dethā”ti vutte🔽pana dātuṃ vaṭṭati. Ussavādīsu manussā sayameva pariveṇāni ca padhānagharāni ca gantvā
analyzed: a nimantitehi na dātabbāḥ ete nimantita bhikkhū ti vattabbam tumhe pi detha ati vutte  pana dātum vaṭṭati ussava ādīsu manussā sayam eva pariveṇāni ca padhāna gharāni ca gantvā
translated: But if they say, “Give it to you too,” then it is allowable to give it.

original: tipiṭake ca dhammakathike ca bhikkhusatenapi saddhiṃ nimantenti. Tadā yepi jānanti,🔽te gahetvā gantuṃ vaṭṭati. Kasmā? Na hi mahābhikkhusaṅghena atthikā manussā pariveṇāni
analyzed: tipiṭake ca dhamma kathike ca bhikkhu satena api saddhim nimantenti tadā ye pi jānanti  te gahetvā gantum vaṭṭati kasmā na hi mahā bhikkhu saṅghena atthikāḥ manussā
translated: As regards those who invite on the day of the Invitation, people go themselves to the refectory and the rest house and invite the reciters of the three Piṭakas and the expounders of the Dhamma, taking bhikkhus numbering a hundred or more.🔽Then, if they know, it is allowable to take those who are invited and go.

original: ca padhānagharāni gacchanti, sannipātaṭṭhānatova yathāsatti yathābalaṃ bhikkhū gaṇhitvā gacchantīti.
analyzed: ca padhāna gharāni gacchanti sannipāta ṭṭhānataḥ va yathāsatti yathābalam bhikkhū gaṇhitvā gacchanti iti
translated: Why? Because people who need a large number of bhikkhus do not go to the refectory and the rest house; they go from the meeting place, taking bhikkhus according to their means and their strength.

original: Sace pana saṅghatthero vā ganthadhutaṅgavasena abhiññātako vā bhattuddesako vā aññatra
analyzed: sace pana saṅgha ttheraḥ vā gantha dhutaṅga vasena abhiññātakaḥ vā bhattuddesakaḥ vā aññatra
translated: But if the senior elder of the community or a bhikkhu who is well known for his learning or for his austerities or if the assigner of meals or someone else🔽who has spent the rains elsewhere and has gone somewhere else and has now returned to his own place,

original: vā vassaṃ vasitvā katthaci vā gantvā puna sakaṭṭhānaṃ āgacchanti, manussā ca āgantukassa
analyzed: vā vassam vasitvā katthaci vā gantvā puna saka ṭṭhānam āgacchanti manussā ca āgantukassa
translated: and if people invite him,

original: sakkāraṃ karonti, ekavāraṃ ye jānanti, te gahetvā gantabbaṃ. Paṭibaddhakālato pana🔽paṭṭhāya dutiyavāre āraddhe saṅghatoyeva gahetvā gantabbaṃ. Abhinavaāgantukāva hutvā
analyzed: sakkāram karonti eka vāram ye jānanti te gahetvā gantabbam paṭibaddha kālataḥ pana  paṭṭhāya dutiya vāre āraddhe saṅgha toyā iva gahetvā gantabbam abhinava āgantukā ava hutvā
translated: If they do it once, then those who know about it should take them and go. But from the time of the invitation ceremony,

original: ñātī vā upaṭṭhāke vā passissāmāti gacchanti, tatra tesaṃ ñātī ca upaṭṭhākā ca sakkāraṃ
analyzed: ñātī vā upaṭṭhāke vā passissāma ati gacchanti tatra tesam ñātī ca upaṭṭhākā ca sakkāram
translated: they should take the Invitation from the Sangha and go. If they go thinking, “We’ll see our relatives or supporters,”

original: karonti. Ettha pana ye jānanti, te gahetvā gantuṃ vaṭṭati.🔽Yo pana atilābhī hoti, sakaṭṭhānañca āgantukaṭṭhānañca ekasadisaṃ, sabbattha manussā
analyzed: karonti ettha pana ye jānanti te gahetvā gantum vaṭṭati  yo pana ati lābhī hoti saka ṭhānam ca āgantuka ṭṭhānam ca eka sadisam sabbattha manussā
translated: and if their relatives or supporters do them an honor there, then those who know about it may take them and go.

original: saṅghabhattaṃ sajjetvāva nisīdanti, tena saṅghatova gahetvā gantabbanti ayaṃ nimantane
analyzed: saṅgha bhattam sajjetvā ava nisīdanti tena saṅghataḥ uva gahetvā gantabbanti ayam nimantane
translated: But if someone is very well off and the place where he lives and the place where the newly arrived monks stay are the same, and the people there prepare a meal for the Sangha everywhere, then he should take the Invitation from the Sangha and go. This is the difference in the case of an invitation.

original: viseso. Avaseso sabbapañho uddesabhatte vuttanayeneva veditabbo. Kurundiyaṃ pana
analyzed: visesaḥ avasesaḥ sabba pañho uddesa bhatte vutta nayena iva veditabbaḥ kurundiyam pana
translated: The rest of the questions should be understood according to the method used in the section on the meal by invitation.

original: “aṭṭha mahāthere dethā”ti vutte “aṭṭha mahātherāva dātabbā”ti vuttaṃ. Esa nayo majjhimādīsu.
analyzed: aṭṭha mahā there detha iti vutte aṭṭha mahā therāḥ ava dātabbā ti vuttam esa nayaḥ majjhima ādīsu
translated: But in the Kurundi, it is said, “If it is said, ‘Give to eight senior monks,’ then only eight senior monks should be given.” The same applies to the “middling” and the rest.

original: Sace pana avisesetvā “aṭṭha bhikkhū dethā”ti vadati, saṅghato dātabbā.
analyzed: sace pana a visesetvā aṭṭha bhikkhū detha iti vadati saṅghataḥ dātabbā
translated: But if he says, “Give to eight bhikkhus,” without specifying, then it should be given by the Sangha.

original: Nimantanabhattakathā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: nimantana bhatta kathā niṭṭhitā
translated: The discussion of invited meals is finished.

original: Salākabhattakathā
analyzed: salākabhatta kathā
translated: The discussion of tickets🔽“I allow you to write on a stick or on a label and to tie it on,

original: Salākabhatte pana “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, salākāya vā paṭṭikāya vā upanibandhitvā
analyzed: salāka bhatte pana anujānāmi bhikkhave salākāya vā paṭṭikāya vā upanibandhitvā
translated: to mark it, and to announce it.”🔽A stick can be made of heartwood or of bamboo, or of leaves such as the palmyra palm.

original: opuñjitvā uddisitu”nti vacanato rukkhasāramayāya salākāya vā veḷuvilīvatālapaṇṇādimayāya
analyzed: opuñjitvā uddisitun ti vacanataḥ rukkha sāra mayāya salākāya vā veḷu vilīva tālapaṇṇa ādi mayāya
translated: A label can be made of bark or of cloth.

original: paṭṭikāya vā “asukassa nāma salākabhatta”nti evaṃ akkharāni upanibandhitvā pacchiyaṃ
analyzed: paṭṭikāya vā asukassa nāma salāka bhattanti evam akkharāni upanibandhitvā pacchiyam
translated: The letters are written on it like this: “This is a ticket for a meal.”🔽The tickets are then tied to the end of a bamboo robe rack or to a clothesline.

original: vā cīvarabhoge vā katvā sabbā salākāyo opuñjitvā punappunaṃ heṭṭhuparivaseneva āloḷetvā
analyzed: vā cīvara bhoge vā katvā sabbā salākāyaḥ opuñjitvā punappunam heṭṭhu parivasena iva āloḷetvā
translated: The tickets are then marked one by one, starting from the bottom, and they are shaken up.

original: pañcaṅgasamannāgatena bhattuddesakena sace ṭhitikā atthi, ṭhitikato paṭṭhāya; no
analyzed: pañcaṅga samannāgatena bhattuddesakena sace ṭhitikā atthi ṭhitikato paṭṭhāya no
translated: The tickets should be distributed by a meal announcer who possesses five qualities. If there is a permanent meal, the tickets should be distributed starting from the permanent meal.🔽If there is no permanent meal, the tickets should be distributed starting from the senior most seat.

original: ce atthi, therāsanato paṭṭhāya salākā dātabbā. Pacchā āgatānampi ekābaddhavasena
analyzed: ce atthi thera āsanato paṭṭhāya salākā dātabbā pacchā āgatānam pi ekābaddha vasena
translated: Even if they arrive later, they should be given to those who are together.

original: dūre ṭhitānampi uddesabhatte vuttanayeneva dātabbā.
analyzed: dūre ṭhitānam pi uddesa bhatte vutta nayena iva dātabbā
translated: Even if they are far away, they should be given in the same way as the meal announcer does.

original: Sace vihārassa samantato bahū gocaragāmā, bhikkhū pana na bahukā, gāmavasenapi salākāyo
analyzed: sace vihārassa samantataḥ bahū gocara gāmāḥ bhikkhū pana na bahukāḥ gāma vasena api salākāyaḥ
translated: If there are many alms-giving villages all round the monastery but few bhikkhus, then the tickets may be distributed according to the villages.

original: pāpuṇanti, “tumhākaṃ asukagāme salākabhattaṃ pāpuṇātī”ti gāmavaseneva gāhetabbā.
analyzed: pāpuṇanti tumhākam asuka gāme salāka bhattam pāpuṇāti iti gāma vasena iva gāhetabbā
translated: They should be distributed thus: “Your ticket falls on a meal in such-and-such a village.”

original: Evaṃ gāhentena sacepi ekekasmiṃ gāme nānappakārāni saṭṭhisalākabhattāni, sabbāni
analyzed: evam gāhentena sace pi ekekasmin gāme nānappakārāni saṭṭhi salāka bhattāni sabbāni
translated: When they are distributed in this way, even if there are sixty different kinds of meal in each village, all

original: gāhitāneva honti, tassa pattagāmasamīpe aññānipi dve tīṇi salākabhattāni honti, tānipi
analyzed: gāhitāni eva honti tassa patta gāma samīpe aññāni pi dve tīṇi salākabhattāni honti tāni pi
translated: are included. If there are two or three other meals in a village near the ticket-holder’s alms-giving village,

original: tasseva dātabbāni. Na hi sakkā tesaṃ kāraṇā aññaṃ bhikkhuṃ pahiṇitunti.
analyzed: tassa iva dātabbāni na hi sakkā tesam kāraṇā aññam bhikkhum pahiṇitunti
translated: they should be given to him too. For it is not possible to send another bhikkhu there on account of them.

original: Sace ekaccesu gāmesu bahūni salākabhattāni sallakkhetvā sattannampi aṭṭhannampi bhikkhūnaṃ
analyzed: sace ekaccesu gāmesu bahūni salākabhattāni sallakkhetvā sattannam pi aṭṭhannam pi bhikkhūnaṃ
translated: If there are many meals in some villages, they can be given to seven or eight bhikkhus.

original: dātabbāni. Dadantena pana catunnaṃ pañcannaṃ bhattānaṃ salākāyo ekato bandhitvā dātabbā.
analyzed: dātabbāni dadantena pana catunnam pañcannam bhattānam salākāyaḥ ekatas bandhitvā dātabbā
translated: But when they are given, the tickets for four or five meals should be tied together and given.

original: Sace taṃ gāmaṃ atikkamitvā añño gāmo hoti, tasmiñca ekameva salākabhattaṃ, taṃ pana
analyzed: sace tam gāmam atikkamitvā aññaḥ gāmaḥ hoti tasmin ca ekam eva salākabhattam tam pana
translated: If there is another village beyond that village, and if there is only one meal there,

original: pātova denti, tampi etesu bhikkhūsu ekassa niggahena datvā “pātova taṃ gahetvā pacchā🔽orimagāme itarāni bhattāni gaṇhāhī”ti vattabbo. Sace orimagāme salākabhattesu agāhitesveva
analyzed: pātova denti tam pi etesu bhikkhūsu ekassa niggahena da tvā pātova tam gahetvā pacchā  orima gāme itarāni bhattāni gaṇhāhi iti vattabbo sace orima gāme salāka bhattesu a gāhitesu eva
translated: If they give it in the morning, then after one of these monks has been stopped from taking it, he should be told, “Take it in the morning and then🔽take the other meals in the next village.” If, without taking a share in the meal by tickets in the next village,

original: gāhitasaññāya gacchati, parabhāgagāme salākabhattaṃ gāhetvā puna vihāraṃ āgantvā
analyzed: gāhita saññāya gacchati parabhāga gāme salāka bhattam gāhetvā puna vihāram āgantvā
translated: he goes to the village beyond that, takes a share in the meal by tickets there, returns to the monastery,

original: itarāni gāhetvā orimagāmo gantabbo. “Na hi bahisīmāya saṅghalābho gāhetuṃ labbhatī”ti
analyzed: itarāni gāhetvā orima gāmaḥ gantabbo na hi bahi sīmāya saṅgha lābhaḥ gāhetum labbhati iti
translated: takes the other meals, and then goes to the next village, he commits an offense entailing confession. “You can’t take a share of the Sangha’s gains outside the monastery zone.”

original: ayaṃ nayo kurundiyaṃ vutto.
analyzed: ayam nayaḥ kurundiyam vutto
translated: This is the rule given in the Kurundī story.

original: Sace pana bhikkhū bahū honti, gāmavasena salākā na pāpuṇanti, vīthivasena vā vīthiyaṃ
analyzed: sace pana bhikkhū bahū honti gāma vasena salākāḥ na pāpuṇanti vīthi vasena vā vīthiyam
translated: But if there are many monks and the tickets don’t cover everyone, then the tickets should be distributed by street or

original: ekagehavasena vā kulavasena vā gāhetabbā. Vīthiādīsu ca yattha bahūni bhattāni, tattha
analyzed: eka geha vasena vā kula vasena vā gāhetabbāḥ vīthi ādīsu ca yattha bahūni bhattāni tattha
translated: by house or by family. And in the streets, etc., where there are many meals,

original: gāme vuttanayeneva bahūnaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ gāhetabbāni. Salākāsu asati uddisitvāpi gāhetabbāni.
analyzed: gāme vutta nayena iva bahūnam bhikkhūnam gāhetabbāni salākāsu asati uddisitvā api gāhetabbāni
translated: the tickets should be distributed to many monks in the same way as in the village. If there are no tickets, the meals can be taken by nomination.

original: Salākadāyakena pana vattaṃ jānitabbaṃ. Tena hi kālasseva vuṭṭhāya pattacīvaraṃ gahetvā
analyzed: salāka dāyakena pana vattam jānitabbam tena hi kālassa iva vuṭṭhāya patta cīvaram gahetvā
translated: But the one who distributes the tickets should know the proper conduct. He should get up early in the morning, take his bowl and robe,

original: bhojanasālaṃ gantvā asammaṭṭhaṭṭhānaṃ sammajjitvā pānīyaṃ paribhojanīyaṃ upaṭṭhāpetvā🔽“idāni bhikkhūhi vattaṃ kataṃ bhavissatī”ti kālaṃ sallakkhetvā ghaṇṭiṃ paharitvā
analyzed: bhojana sālam gantvā a sammaṭṭha ṭṭhānam sammajjitvā pānīyam paribhojanīyam upaṭṭhāpetvā  idāni bhikkhūhi vattam katam bhavissati iti kālam sallakkhetvā ghaṇṭim paharitvā
translated: go to the dining hall, sweep it if it is not already swept, set out drinking water and washing water,🔽and then wait for the time to strike the gandi.

original: bhikkhūsu sannipatitesu paṭhamameva vāragāme salākabhattaṃ gāhetabbaṃ. “Tuyhaṃ asukasmiṃ🔽nāma vāragāme salākā pāpuṇāti tatra gacchā”ti vattabbaṃ.🔽Sace atirekagāvute gāmo hoti, taṃ divasaṃ gacchantā kilamanti, “sve tuyhaṃ vāragāme
analyzed: bhikkhūsu sannipatitesu paṭhamam eva vāragāme salāka bhattam gāhetabbam tuyham asukasmin  nāma vāragāme salākā pāpuṇāti tatra gacchāti vattabbam  sace tam divasam gacchantā kilamanti sve vāragāme
translated: When the monks have assembled, he should first distribute the tickets for the alms meal in the village. He should say, “Your ticket for alms in such-and-such a village has come up. Go there.”🔽If the village is more than a league away, those who go there will get tired. He should say, “Your ticket for alms in the village comes up tomorrow. You should go today.”

original: pāpuṇātī”ti ajjeva gāhetabbaṃ. Yo vāragāmaṃ pesiyamāno na gacchati, aññaṃ salākaṃ
analyzed: pāpuṇāti iti ajja iva gāhetabbam yaḥ vāragāmam pesiyamānaḥ na gacchati aññam salākam
translated: If someone who has been sent to a village does not go, but asks for another ticket, he should not be given one.

original: maggati, na dātabbā. Saddhānañhi manussānaṃ puññahāni saṅghassa ca lābhacchedo hoti,
analyzed: maggati na dātabbā saddhānam hi manussānam puñña hāni saṅghassa ca lābha chedaḥ hoti
translated: For the merit of the faithful will be lost and the Sangha will lose its gains.

original: tasmā tassa dutiyepi tatiyepi divase aññā salākā na dātabbā, “attano pattaṭṭhānaṃ🔽gantvā bhuñjāhī”ti vattabbo, tīṇi pana divasāni agacchantassa vāragāmato orimavāragāme
analyzed: tasmā tassa dutiye pi tatiye pi divase aññā salākā na dātabbā attano patta ṭṭhānam  gantvā bhuñjāhi iti vattabbo tīṇi pana divasāni agacchantassa vāragāmato orima vāragāme
translated: Therefore, on the second and third days, he should not be given another tally. He should be told, “Go to your own place and eat.” But if he does not return for three days, he should be given a tally for the village to the west of the village where he lives.

original: salākā gāhetabbā. Tañce na gaṇhāti, tato paṭṭhāya tassa aññaṃ salākaṃ dātuṃ na vaṭṭati,
analyzed: salākā gāhetabbā tat ce na gaṇhāti tatas paṭṭhāya tassa aññam salākam dātum na vaṭṭati
translated: So on the second and third days he should not be given another ticket. He should be told, “Go to your own place and eat.” But if he does not come for three days, the ticket should be taken back from him in the village west of the river and given to someone else. If he does not take it, he should not be given another ticket from then on.

original: daṇḍakammaṃ pana gāḷhaṃ kātabbaṃ, saṭṭhito vā paṇṇāsato vā na parihāpetabbaṃ. Vāragāme
analyzed: daṇḍa kammam pana gāḷham kātabbam saṭṭhitaḥ vā paṇṇāsataḥ vā na parihāpetabbam vāragāme
translated: But the penalty should be made heavy, not less than sixty or forty.

original: gāhetvā vihāravāro gāhetabbo, “tuyhaṃ vihāravāro pāpuṇātī”ti vattabbaṃ. Vihāravārikassa
analyzed: gāhetvā vihāra vāraḥ gāhetabbo tuyham vihāra vāraḥ pāpuṇāti iti vattabbam vihāravārikassa
translated: After taking it back in the village west of the river, the turn for the dwelling place should be taken back. He should be told, “Your turn for a dwelling place has come.”

original: dve tisso yāgusalākāyo tisso catasso vā bhattasalākāyo ca dātabbā, nibaddhaṃ katvā
analyzed: dve tissaḥ yāgu salākāyo tissaḥ catasso vā bhatta salākāyo ca dātabbāḥ nibaddham katvā
translated: The ticket for the turn for the dwelling place and two or three tickets for gruel and rice should be given to the one who has the turn for the dwelling place. But they should not be given to him regularly.

original: pana na dātabbā. Yāgubhattadāyakā hi “amhākaṃ yāgubhattaṃ vihāragopakāva bhuñjantī”ti
analyzed: pana na dātabbā yāgu bhatta dāyakāḥ hi amhākam yāgu bhattam vihāra gopakāḥ ava bhuñjanti iti
translated: For the givers of gruel and rice might think, “They who eat our gruel and rice are the caretakers of the dwelling places.”

original: aññathattaṃ āpajjeyyuṃ, tasmā aññesu kulesu dātabbā.
analyzed: aññathattam āpajjeyyum tasmai aññesu kulesu dātabbā
translated: So they should be given to others.

original: Sace vihāravārikānaṃ sabhāgā āharitvā denti, iccetaṃ kusalaṃ; no ce, vāraṃ gāhetvā🔽tesaṃ yāgubhattaṃ āharāpetabbaṃ. Tāva nesaṃ salākā phātikammameva bhavanti, vassaggena🔽pattaṭṭhāne pana aññampi paṇītabhattasalākaṃ gaṇhituṃ labhantiyeva. Atirekauttaribhaṅgassa
analyzed: sace vihāra vāri kānam sabhāgāḥ āharitvā denti kusalam no ce vāram  tesam yāgu bhattam āhara apetabbam tāva nesam salākā phāti kammam eva bhavanti vassaggena  patta ṭṭhāne pana aññam pi paṇīta bhatta salākam gaṇhitum labhantiyā iva atireka ottari bhaṅgassa
translated: If they bring back the share of those who are in charge of the dwelling, that is good. If not, they should take their turn🔽and have rice gruel and rice brought back for them. The tickets are only for the purpose of a record. The one in charge of the rains🔽can also take a ticket for fine rice in the place where the bowl is. But he should give out tickets for the extra and the leftovers

original: ekacārikabhattassa visuṃ ṭhitikaṃ katvā salākā dātabbā.🔽Sace yena salākā laddhā, so taṃdivasaṃ taṃ bhattaṃ na labhati, punadivase gāhetabbaṃ.
analyzed: ekacārika bhattassa visum ṭhitikam katvā salākā dātabbā  sace yena salākā laddhā saḥ taṃ divasam tam bhattam na labhati puna divase gāhetabbam
translated: separately from the tickets for the daily meal.🔽If the one who has received a ticket does not get that meal on that day, he should take it on the following day.

original: Bhattameva labhati, na uttaribhaṅgaṃ; evampi puna gāhetabbaṃ. Khīrabhattassa salākāyapi
analyzed: bhattam eva labhati na uttari bhaṅgam evam pi puna gāhetabbam khīra bhattassa
translated: If he only gets the meal and not the leftovers, he should take it again. The tickets for milk rice

original: eseva nayo. Sace pana khīrameva labhati, na bhattaṃ; khīralābhato paṭṭhāya puna na
analyzed: esa iva nayo sace pana khīram eva labhati na bhattam khīra lābhato paṭṭhāya puna na
translated: follow the same method. But if he only gets the milk and not the rice, he should not take it again

original: gāhetabbaṃ. Dve tīṇi ekacārikabhattāni ekasseva pāpuṇanti, dubbhikkhasamaye saṅghanavakena
analyzed: gāhetabbam dve tīṇi ekacārikabhattāni ekassa iva pāpuṇanti dubbhikkha samaye saṅgha navakena
translated: from the time he has received the milk. Two or three daily meals may be given to one person. If there is a famine, the senior monk should give out tickets to the monks in the following order:

original: laddhakāle vijaṭetvā visuṃ gāhetabbāni, pākatikasalākabhattaṃ aladdhassāpi punadivase gāhetabbaṃ.🔽Sace khuddako vihāro hoti, sabbe bhikkhū ekasambhogā, ucchusalākaṃ gāhentena yassa🔽kassaci sammukhībhūtassa pāpetvā mahātherādīnaṃ divā tacchetvā dātuṃ vaṭṭati. Rasasalākaṃ
analyzed: laddha kāle vijaṭetvā visum gāhetabbāni pākatika salāka bhattam a laddhassa api puna divase gāhetabbam  sace khuddakaḥ vihāraḥ hoti sabbe bhikkhū eka sambhogāḥ ucchu salākam gāhentena yassa  kassaci sammukhībhūtassa mahā thera ādīnam divā tat śetvā dātum vaṭṭati rasa salākam
translated: When they are distributed, they should be untied and taken separately. The regular rice and curry should be taken again on the following day even if they are not distributed.

original: pāpetvā pacchābhattaṃ parissāvetvā vā phāṇitaṃ vā kāretvā piṇḍapātikādīnampi dātabbaṃ.
analyzed: pāpetvā pacchābhattam parissāvetvā vā phāṇitam vā kāretvā piṇḍapātika ādīnam pi dātabbam
translated: If the dwelling is small, all the resident monks should share it. The one who distributes the rice should give it to anyone who is present. He can cut the large pieces of boiled rice into small pieces and give them to the senior monks, etc., during the day. The one who distributes the curry should give it to the senior monks, etc., after the meal. He should then have the curry cooked again or have molasses boiled down and give it to the alms-collectors, etc.

original: Āgantukānaṃ āgatānāgatabhāvaṃ ñatvā gāhetabbā, mahāāvāse ṭhitikaṃ katvā gāhetabbā.
analyzed: āgantukānam āgata anāgata bhāvam ñatvā gāhetabbā mahā āvāse ṭhitikam katvā gāhetabbā
translated: The distribution should be made after finding out whether there are any resident monks who have come or who have yet to come. In a large monastery, the distribution should be made after making an announcement.

original: Takkasalākampi sabhāgaṭṭhāne pāpetvā vā pacāpetvā vā dhūmāpetvā vā therānaṃ dātuṃ
analyzed: takkasalākam pi sabhāgaṭṭhāne pāpetvā vā pacāpetvā vā dhūmāpetvā vā dātum
translated: The distribution of the rice from Takkasilā should be given to the senior monks, etc., after having it cooked or boiled or roasted in a place where there are resident monks.

original: vaṭṭati. Mahāāvāse vuttanayeneva paṭipajjitabbaṃ phalasalākapūvasalākabhesajjagandhamālasalākāyopi
analyzed: vaṭṭati mahā āvāse vutta nayena iva paṭipajjitabbam phala salāka pūva salāka bhesajja gandha māla salākāyaḥ api
translated: The distribution of the fruit, the distribution of the cakes, the distribution of the medicine, and the distribution of the perfume and garlands should be treated in the same way as the distribution of the rice from Takkasilā.

original: visuṃ ṭhitikāya gāhetabbā. Bhesajjādisalākāyo cettha kiñcāpi piṇḍapātikānampi vaṭṭanti,
analyzed: visum ṭhitikāya gāhetabbā ca ittha kiñcā api vaṭṭanti
translated: He should take it by means of a separate record. As regards the tickets for medicines, etc., though they are allowable for those who go on continuous alms round,

original: salākavasena gāhitattā pana na sāditabbā. Aggabhikkhāmattaṃ salākabhattaṃ denti,
analyzed: salāka vasena gāhita ttā pana na sāditabbā agga bhikkhā mattam salāka bhattam denti
translated: they should not be used because they have been taken by means of a ticket. If they give the first alms round or a meal by ticket,

original: ṭhitikaṃ pucchitvā gāhetabbaṃ. Asatiyā ṭhitikāya therāsanato paṭṭhāya gāhetabbaṃ.
analyzed: ṭhitikam pucchitvā gāhetabbam asatiyā ṭhitikāya thera āsanataḥ paṭṭhāya gāhetabbam
translated: he should take it after asking about the record. If there is no record, he should take it starting from the senior elder’s place.

original: Sace tādisāni bhattāni bahūni honti, ekekassa bhikkhuno dve tīṇi dātabbāni; no ce,
analyzed: sace tādisāni bhattāni bahūni honti ekekassa bhikkhunaḥ dve tīṇi dātabbāni no ce
translated: If there are many such meals, two or three should be given to each bhikkhu. If not,

original: ekekameva datvā paṭipāṭiyā gatāya puna therāsanato paṭṭhāya dātabbaṃ. Sace antarāva
analyzed: ekekam eva da tvā paṭipāṭiyā gatāya puna thera āsanataḥ paṭṭhāya dātabbam sace
translated: after giving one to each, it should be given again starting from the senior elder’s place when the turn comes round. If it is interrupted in the meantime,

original: upacchijjati, ṭhitikā sallakkhetabbā. Yadi pana tādisaṃ bhattaṃ nibaddhameva hoti,
analyzed: upacchijjati ṭhitikā sallakkhetabbā yadi pana tādisam bhattam nibaddham eva hoti
translated: the record should be checked. But if such meals are regular,

original: yassa pāpuṇāti, so vattabbo “laddhā vā aladdhā vā svepi gaṇheyyāsī”ti. Ekaṃ anibaddhaṃ
analyzed: yassa pāpuṇāti saḥ vattabbaḥ laddhā vā a laddhā vā sve pi gaṇheyyāsi iti ekam anibaddham
translated: the one who gets them should be told, “You can take them tomorrow whether you get them today or not.” If one is irregular,

original: hoti, labhanadivase pana yāvadatthaṃ labhati, alabhanadivasā bahutarā honti, taṃ
analyzed: hoti labhana divase pana yāvadattham labhati a labhana divasāḥ bahutarāḥ honti tam
translated: but on the day it is obtained one gets as much as one wants, and the days one does not get it are more numerous than those on which one does,🔽then

original: yassa pāpuṇāti, so alabhitvā “sve gaṇheyyāsī”ti vattabbo.
analyzed: yassa pāpuṇāti saḥ a labhitvā sve gaṇheyyāsi iti vattabbo
translated: If he does not get one, he should be told, “You can take one tomorrow.”

original: Yo salākāsu gāhitāsu pacchā āgacchati, tassa atikkantāva salākā na upaṭṭhāpetvā dātabbā.
analyzed: yaḥ salākāsu gāhitāsu pacchā āgacchati tassa atikkantā ava salākā na upaṭṭhāpetvā dātabbā
translated: If he comes after the voting tickets have been taken, his ticket should be given to him without being counted.

original: Salākaṃ nāma ghaṇṭippaharaṇato paṭṭhāya āgantvā hatthaṃ pasārentova labhati. Aññassa
analyzed: salākam nāma ghaṇṭi ppaharaṇataḥ paṭṭhāya āgantvā hattham pasārentaḥ iva labhati aññassa
translated: As for the voting ticket, he gets it as soon as he arrives and puts out his hand, starting from the moment the bell is rung.

original: āgantvā samīpe ṭhitassāpi atikkantā atikkantāva hoti. Sace panassa añño gaṇhanto
analyzed: āgantvā samīpe ṭhitassa api atikkantā atikkantā ava hoti sace panassa aññaḥ gaṇhanto
translated: If another comes and stands near him, his ticket is counted as already counted. But if there is someone else taking the tickets,

original: atthi, sayaṃ anāgatopi labhati. Sabhāgaṭṭhāne asuko anāgatoti ñatvā “ayaṃ tassa salākā”ti🔽ṭhapetuṃ vaṭṭati. Sace “anāgatassa na dātabbā”ti katikaṃ karonti, adhammikā hoti.
analyzed: atthi sayam anāgataḥ api labhati sabhāgaṭṭhāne asukaḥ anāgataḥ ti ñatvā ayam tassa salākā ati  ṭhapetum vaṭṭati sace anāgatassa na dātabbā ati katikam karonti adhammikā hoti
translated: he gets it even though he himself has not come. If it is known that such and such a person is absent in the same region, it is allowable to set aside a ticket and say, “This is his.”🔽If they make a rule, saying, “It should not be given to one who is absent,” it is illegitimate.

original: Antoupacāre ṭhitassa hi bhājanīyabhaṇḍaṃ pāpuṇāti. Sace pana “anāgatassa dethā”ti
analyzed: antoupacāre ṭhitassa hi bhājanīya bhaṇḍam pāpuṇāti sace pana anāgatassa detha ati
translated: For property that is to be shared is given to one who is present within the enclosure. But if they make a great noise, saying, “Give it to the absent one,”

original: mahāsaddaṃ karonti, daṇḍakammaṃ ṭhapetabbaṃ, “āgantvā gaṇhantū”ti vattabbaṃ.
analyzed: mahā saddam karonti daṇḍa kammam ṭhapetabbam āgantvā gaṇhantu iti vattabbam
translated: the punishment should be suspended and it should be announced, “Let them take it who come.”

original: Chappañcasalākā naṭṭhā honti, bhattuddesako dāyakānaṃ nāmaṃ nassarati, so ce naṭṭhasalākā
analyzed: chappañca salākāḥ naṭṭhāḥ honti bhattuddesakaḥ dāyakānam nāmam nassarati saḥ ce naṭṭha salākā
translated: The five or six voting tickets are lost, the assigner of meals forgets the names of the donors, and the voting tickets are lost.

original: mahātherassa vā attano vā pāpetvā bhikkhū vadeyya, “mayā asukagāme salākabhattaṃ
analyzed: mahā therassa vā attanaḥ vā pāpetvā bhikkhū vadeyya mayā asuka gāme salākabhattam
translated: If five or six shares are lost, and the assigner of meals forgets the names of the donors, then if he has the meals assigned to himself or to the senior elder and then tells the monks, “I have had meals assigned for tomorrow in such-and-such a village,

original: mayhaṃ pāpitaṃ, tumhe tattha laddhaṃ salākabhattaṃ bhuñjeyyāthā”ti, vaṭṭati. Vihāre
analyzed: mayham pāpitam tumhe tattha laddham salāka bhattam bhuñjeyyātha ati vaṭṭati vihāre
translated: you may eat the share that falls to you,” it is allowable.

original: apāpitaṃ pana āsanasālāya taṃ bhattaṃ labhitvā tattheva pāpetvā bhuñjituṃ na vaṭṭati.🔽“Ajja paṭṭhāya mayhaṃ salākabhattaṃ gaṇhathā”ti vutte tatra āsanasālāya gāhetuṃ na
analyzed: a pāpitam pana āsana sālāya tam bhattam labhitvā tattha iva pāpetvā bhuñjitum na vaṭṭati  ajja paṭṭhāya mayham salāka bhattam gaṇhatha iti vutte tatra āsana sālāya gāhetum na
translated: If the meals are not assigned in the dwelling place, but the monks get the meals in the assembly hall, then it is not allowable to have the meals assigned there and then eat them there.🔽If the assigner of meals says, “From today on, take my share,” then it is not allowable to take it there in the assembly hall. It should be taken to the dwelling place.🔽If he says, “From tomorrow on,” then the assigner of meals should inform the monks, “From tomorrow on, such-and-such a family is giving meals by the share.

original: vaṭṭati, vihāraṃ ānetvā gāhetabbaṃ. “Sve paṭṭhāyā”ti vutte pana bhattuddesakassa
analyzed: vaṭṭati vihāram ānetvā gāhetabbam sve paṭṭhāya ati vutte pana bhattuddesakassa
translated: When the shares are being taken,🔽please remember that.”

original: ācikkhitabbaṃ “sve paṭṭhāya asukakulaṃ nāma salākabhattaṃ deti, salākaggāhaṇakāle🔽sareyyāsī”ti. Dubbhikkhe salākabhattaṃ pacchinditvā subhikkhe jāte kiñci disvā “ajja
analyzed: ācikkhitabbam sve paṭṭhāya asuka kulam nāma salāka bhattam deti salāka ggāhaṇa kāle 🔽sareyyāsi iti dubbhikkhe salākabhattam pacchinditvā subhikkhe jāte kiñci disvā ajja
translated: If, during a famine, the meals by the share are discontinued, and then, when the famine is over, someone says, “Today

original: paṭṭhāya amhākaṃ salākabhattaṃ gaṇhathā”ti puna paṭṭhapenti, antogāme agāhetvā vihāraṃ🔽ānetvāva gāhetabbaṃ. Idañhi “salākabhattaṃ” nāma. Uddesabhattasadisaṃ na hoti, vihārameva
analyzed: paṭṭhāya amhākam salāka bhattam gaṇhatha ati puna paṭṭhapenti antogāme a gāhetvā vihāraṃ  ānetvā ava gāhetabbam idam hi salāka bhattam nāma uddesa bhatta sadisam na hoti vihāram eva
translated: If they say, “From now on, please accept our regular meal,” they should be told, “We won’t accept it in the village. You should bring it to the monastery.”🔽For this is not like the meal by invitation. It is not like the meal that is announced.

original: sandhāya diyyati, tasmā bahiupacāre gāhetuṃ na vaṭṭati. “Sve paṭṭhāyā”ti vutte pana
analyzed: sandhāya diyyati tasmai bahi upacāre gāhetum na vaṭṭati sve paṭṭhāya ati vutte pana
translated: If they give it again, saying, “From now on, please accept our regular meal,” it should be accepted only after the meal has been brought into the monastery. For this is called “a regular meal”. It is not like a meal given by appointment. It is given with reference to the monastery. Therefore it is not allowable to accept it outside the monastery zone. But if they say, “From now on, please accept it tomorrow”,

original: vihāre gāhetabbameva.
analyzed: vihāre gāhetabbam eva
translated: it should be accepted in the monastery.

original: Gamiko bhikkhu yaṃ disābhāgaṃ gantukāmo, tattha aññena vāragāmasalākā laddhā hoti,
analyzed: gamikaḥ bhikkhu yam disā bhāgam gantu kāmo tattha aññena vāragāma salākā laddhā hoti
translated: If a monk who is going away gets a regular meal in a village in the direction he is going, and another monk has already got a regular meal in that village,

original: taṃ gahetvā itaraṃ bhikkhuṃ “mayhaṃ pattasalākaṃ tvaṃ gaṇhāhī”ti vatvā gantuṃ vaṭṭati.
analyzed: tam gahetvā itaram bhikkhum mayham patta salākam tvam gaṇhāhi iti vatvā gantum vaṭṭati
translated: the first monk should say to the second, “Please accept my regular meal”, and then he may go.

original: Tena pana upacārasīmaṃ anatikkanteyeva tasmiṃ tassa salākā gāhetabbā.
analyzed: tena pana upacāra sīmam tasmin tassa salākā gāhetabbā
translated: But the second monk should accept it before the first monk has left the monastery zone.

original: Chaḍḍitavihāre manussā bodhicetiyādīni jaggitvā bhuñjantūti salākabhattaṃ paṭṭhapenti,
analyzed: chaḍḍita vihāre manussāḥ bodhi cetiya ādīni jaggitvā bhuñjantu uti salāka bhattam paṭṭhapenti
translated: If people give a regular meal, saying, “Let them eat after worshipping the Bodhi Tree, the shrine, etc.”,

original: bhikkhū sakaṭṭhānesu vasitvā kālasseva gantvā tattha vattaṃ karitvā taṃ bhattaṃ bhuñjanti,🔽vaṭṭati. Sace tesu svātanāya attano pāpetvā gatesu āgantuko bhikkhu chaḍḍitavihāre
analyzed: bhikkhū saka ṭṭhānesu vasitvā kālassa iva gantvā tattha vattam karitvā tam bhattam bhuñjanti  vaṭṭati sace tesu pāpetvā gatesu āgantukaḥ bhikkhu chaḍḍita vihāre
translated: After staying in the places where they had stopped, they went on in the morning, did the duties there, and ate that meal.

original: vasitvā kālasseva vattaṃ katvā ghaṇṭiṃ paharitvā salākabhattaṃ attano pāpetvā āsanasālaṃ🔽gacchati, sova tassa bhattassa issaro. Yo pana bhikkhūsu vattaṃ karontesuyeva bhūmiyaṃ
analyzed: vasitvā kālassa iva vattam katvā ghaṇṭim paharitvā salāka bhattam attanaḥ pāpetvā āsana sālam  gacchati saḥ uva tassa bhattassa issaraḥ yaḥ pana bhikkhūsu vattam karontesu yeva bhūmiyam
translated: It is allowable. If a newly arrived monk stayed in an abandoned monastery, did the duties in the morning, rang the gong, had a portion of the meal brought to himself, and went to the assembly hall,

original: dve tayo sammuñjanippahāre datvā ghaṇṭiṃ paharitvā “dhuragāme salākabhattaṃ mayhaṃ🔽pāpuṇātī”ti gacchati, tassa taṃ corikāya gahitattā na pāpuṇāti, vattaṃ katvā pāpetvā
analyzed: dve tayo sammuñja nippahāre da tvā ghaṇṭim paharitvā dhura gāme salāka bhattam mayham  pāpuṇāti iti gacchati tassa tam corikāya gahita ttā na pāpuṇāti vattam katvā pāpetvā
translated: he was the owner of that meal. But if, while the monks were doing the duties, he gave two or three strokes on the ground, rang the gong, and said, “The meal in the village of Dhurā is mine,”

original: pacchā gatabhikkhūnaṃyeva hoti.
analyzed: pacchā gata bhikkhūnam yeva hoti
translated: and then went, he did not get it, because it had been taken by theft. It belonged only to the monks who had gone after doing the duties and having it brought.

original: Eko gāmo atidūre hoti, bhikkhū niccaṃ gantuṃ na icchanti, manussā “mayaṃ puññena
analyzed: ekaḥ gāmaḥ atidūre hoti bhikkhū niccam gantum naḥ icchanti manussāḥ mayam puññena
translated: A certain village was too far away. The monks did not want to go there regularly. The people said,

original: paribāhirā homā”ti vadanti, ye tassa gāmassa āsannavihāre sabhāgabhikkhū, te vattabbā
analyzed: vadanti ye tassa gāmassa āsanna vihāre sabhāga bhikkhū te vattabbā
translated: “We are excluded from the meal.”🔽The resident monks should say to the monks who belong to the same Buddhist sect and who live in a monastery nearby,

original: “imesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ anāgatadivase tumhe bhuñjathā”ti. Salākā pana devasikaṃ pāpetabbā,
analyzed: imesam bhikkhūnam anāgata divase tumhe bhuñjatha ati salākā pana devasikam pāpetabbā
translated: “You eat on the day after tomorrow.” The tickets should be given out day by day.

original: tā ca kho pana ghaṇṭippaharaṇamattena vā pacchicālanamattena vā pāpitā na honti,
analyzed: tā ca kho pana ghaṇṭi ppaharaṇa mattena vā pacchicālana mattena vā pāpitāḥ na honti
translated: But they are not given out just by ringing the bell or by announcing it.

original: pacchiṃ pana gahetvā salākā pīṭhake ākiritabbā, pacchi pana mukhavaṭṭiyaṃ na gahetabbā.
analyzed: pacchim pana gahetvā salākā pīṭhake ākiritabbā pacchi pana mukha vaṭṭiyam na gahetabbā
translated: The tickets should be put in a bowl and distributed by the senior monk. The bowl should not be held in the crook of the elbow.

original: Sace hi tattha ahi vā vicchiko vā bhaveyya, dukkhaṃ uppādeyya; tasmā heṭṭhā gahetvā
analyzed: sace hi tattha ahi vā vicchikaḥ vā bhaveyya dukkham uppādeyya tasmā heṭṭhā gahetvā
translated: For if there were a snake or a scorpion in the bowl, it might cause pain. The bowl should therefore be held

original: pacchiṃ parammukhaṃ katvā salākā ākiritabbā “sacepi sappo bhavissati, ettova palāyissatī”ti.
analyzed: pacchim parammukham katvā salākā ākiritabbā sace pi sappaḥ bhavissati ettas va palāyissati iti
translated: with the elbow straight. The tickets should be distributed with the thought, “If there is a snake, it will escape.”

original: Evaṃ salākā ākiritvā gāmādivasena pubbe vuttanayeneva gāhetabbā. Apica ekaṃ mahātherassa
analyzed: evam salākāḥ ākiritvā gāma ādi vasena pubbe vutta nayena iva gāhetabbāḥ apica ekam mahā therassa
translated: After distributing the tickets in this way, they should be collected back in the same way as they were given out, that is, according to the village, etc. Moreover, after giving one ticket to a senior monk,

original: pāpetvā “avasesā mayhaṃ pāpuṇantī”ti attano pāpetvā vattaṃ katvā cetiyaṃ vanditvā
analyzed: pāpetvā avasesāḥ mayham pāpuṇanti iti attanaḥ pāpetvā vattam katvā cetiyam vanditvā
translated: saying, “The rest are for me,” he should give himself his own ticket, perform the duties, pay homage at the shrine,

original: vitakkamāḷake ṭhitehi bhikkhūhi “pāpitā, āvuso, salākā”ti vutte “āma, bhante, tumhe
analyzed: vitakkamāḷake ṭhitehi bhikkhūhi pāpitā āvuso salākā iti vutte āma bhante tumhe
translated: If the monks who are standing in the refectory say, “The tickets are bad, Venerable,” he should say, “Yes, but you

original: gatagatagāme salākabhattaṃ gaṇhathā”ti vattabbaṃ; evaṃ pāpitāpi hi supāpitāva honti.
analyzed: gata gata gāme salāka bhattam gaṇhatha iti vattabbam evam pāpitā api hi su pāpitā ava honti
translated: have taken a ticket for a meal at every village you have visited.” In this way, even if they are bad, they are good.

original: Bhikkhū sabbarattiṃ dhammasavanatthaṃ aññaṃ vihāraṃ gacchantā “mayaṃ tattha dānaṃ🔽aggahetvāva amhākaṃ gocaragāmeva piṇḍāya caritvā āgamissāmā”ti salākā aggahetvāva🔽gatā, vihāre therassa pattasalākabhattaṃ bhuñjituṃ āgacchanti, vaṭṭati. Atha mahātheropi
analyzed: bhikkhū sabbarattim dhamma savana attham aññam vihāram gacchantā mayam tattha dānam  aggahetvā ava amhākam gocaragāmā iva piṇḍāya caritvā āgamissāma ati salākāḥ aggahetvā ava  gatāḥ vihāre therassa patta salāka bhattam bhuñjitum āgacchanti vaṭṭati atha mahā theraḥ api
translated: If monks go to another monastery to listen to the Teaching all night, they should not take a ticket, thinking, “We will go for alms in our own village and then return.”

original: “ahaṃ idha kiṃ karomī”ti tehiyeva saddhiṃ gacchati, tehi gatavihāre abhuñjitvāva
analyzed: aham idha kim karomi iti tehiyā iva saddhim gacchati tehi gata vihāre a bhuñjitvā ava
translated: If they go without taking a ticket, and if the senior monk in the monastery eats the meal that was intended for the ticket-holder, it is allowable. But if the senior monk thinks, “What am I doing here?” and goes with them, and if they do not eat at the monastery where they have gone,

original: gocaragāmaṃ anuppattehi “detha, bhante, patte salākayāguādīni āharissāmā”ti vutte
analyzed: gocaragāmam an uppattehi detha bhante patte salāka yāgu ādīni āharissāma ati vutte
translated: but go for alms in the village where they had intended to eat the meal for which they had the ticket, and if they say, “Give us rice and rice porridge, Venerable, we will bring the bowls,”

original: pattā na dātabbā. “Kasmā, bhante, na dethā”ti “vihāraṭṭhakaṃ bhattaṃ vihāre vutthānaṃ
analyzed: pattā na dātabbā kasmai bhante na detha ati vihāraṭṭhakam bhattam vihāre
translated: the bowls should not be given to them. If they ask, “Why don’t you give them to us?” they should be told,

original: pāpuṇāti, mayaṃ aññasmiṃ vihāre vutthā”ti. “Detha, bhante, na mayaṃ vihāre pālikāya
analyzed: pāpuṇāti mayam aññasmin vihāre bhante na mayam vihāre pālikāya
translated: “We’ll get it later. We’ve stayed in another monastery.” “Give it to them, Venerables. We’re not keeping it for ourselves.

original: dema, tumhākaṃ dema, gaṇhatha amhākaṃ bhikkha”nti vutte pana vaṭṭati.
analyzed: dema tumhākam dema gaṇhatha amhākam bhikkhanti vutte pana vaṭṭati
translated: We’re giving it to you. Take it and eat it.”

original: Salākabhattakathā niṭṭhitā.🔽Pakkhikabhattādikathā🔽Pakkhikādīsu pana yaṃ abhilakkhitesu cātuddasī pañcadasī pañcamī aṭṭhamīti imesu
analyzed: salākabhatta kathā niṭṭhitā  pakkhika bhatta ādi kathā  pakkhika ādīsu pana yam abhilakkhitesu cātuddasī pañcadasī pañcamī aṭṭhamī iti imesu
translated: The discussion of the sharing of food is finished.🔽The discussion of food given every half-month, etc.

original: pakkhesu kammappasutehi uposathaṃ kātuṃ satikaraṇatthāya diyyati, taṃ pakkhikaṃ nāma.🔽Taṃ salākabhattagatikameva hoti, gāhetvā bhuñjitabbaṃ. Sace salākabhattampi pakkhikabhattampi
analyzed: pakkhesu kamma ppasutehi uposatham kātum sati karaṇa tthāya diyyati tam pakkhikam nāma  tam salāka bhatta gatikam eva hoti gāhetvā bhuñjitabbam sace salāka bhattam pi pakkhika bhattam pi
translated: As for food given every half-month, etc., food given to those who are busy with their duties on the fourteenth, fifteenth, and eighth day of the half-month, and on the days of the sabbath, in order to help them keep the observance day, is called “food given every half-month”.🔽This is shared out in the same way as the sharing of food. It should be taken and eaten. If there is a lot of shared food and food given every half-month,

original: bahu sabbesaṃ vinivijjhitvā gacchati, dvepi bhattāni visuṃ visuṃ gāhetabbāni. Sace
analyzed: bahu sabbesam vinivijjhitvā gacchati dve api bhattāni visum visum gāhetabbāni sace
translated: all of it should be shared out and then distributed. If there is

original: bhikkhusaṅgho mahā, pakkhikaṃ gāhetvā tassa ṭhitikāya salākabhattaṃ gāhetabbaṃ, salākabhattaṃ
analyzed: bhikkhu saṅghaḥ mahā pakkhikam gāhetvā tassa ṭhitikāya salākabhattam gāhetabbam salākabhattam
translated: a large Sangha, the food given every half-month should be taken for the sake of continuity, and the shared food should be distributed.

original: vā gāhāpetvā tassa ṭhitikāya pakkhikaṃ gāhetabbaṃ. Yesaṃ na pāpuṇāti, te piṇḍāya
analyzed: vā gāhāpetvā tassa ṭhitikāya pakkhikam gāhetabbam yesam na pāpuṇāti te piṇḍāya
translated: and he should have them given out for the day of the observance. Those who do not get any should go wandering for alms.

original: carissanti. Sace dvepi bhattāni bahūni, bhikkhū mandā; salākabhattaṃ nāma devasikaṃ
analyzed: carissanti sace dve pi bhattāni bahūni bhikkhū mandā salākabhattam nāma devasikam
translated: If there are two meals and the monks are few, the meal by portions is given day by day.

original: labbhati, tasmā taṃ ṭhapetvā “pakkhikaṃ āvuso bhuñjathā”ti pakkhikameva gāhetabbaṃ.
analyzed: labbhati tasmā tam ṭhapetvā pakkhikam āvuso bhuñjatha ati pakkhikam eva gāhetabbam
translated: But since the meal by invitation is given every half-month, he should set that aside and have the meal by invitation given out, saying, “Venerables, eat the meal by invitation.”

original: Pakkhikaṃ paṇītaṃ denti, visuṃ ṭhitikā kātabbā. “Sve pakkho”ti ajja pakkhikaṃ na
analyzed: pakkhikam paṇītam denti visum ṭhitikā kātabbā sve pakkho ti ajja pakkhikam na
translated: If they give out the meal by invitation and it is good, a separate meal by invitation should be given out for the following day. “Tomorrow is the observance day,” he should not give out the meal by invitation for that day.

original: gāhetabbaṃ. Sace pana dāyakā vadanti “sve amhākaṃ ghare lūkhabhattaṃ bhavissati,
analyzed: gāhetabbam sace pana dāyakāḥ vadanti sve amhākam ghare lūkhabhattam bhavissati
translated: But if the donors say, “Tomorrow there will be a coarse meal in our house,

original: ajjeva pakkhikabhattaṃ uddisathā”ti, evaṃ vaṭṭati.
analyzed: ajja iva pakkhika bhattam uddisatha ati evam vaṭṭati
translated: please assign the meal by invitation for today,” then that is allowable.

original: Uposathikaṃ nāma anvaḍḍhamāse uposathaṅgāni samādiyitvā yaṃ attanā bhuñjati, tadeva
analyzed: uposathikam nāma anvaḍḍha māse uposathaṅgāni samādiyitvā yam bhuñjati tat eva
translated: The observance-day meal: this is what is given when one has undertaken the observance-day precepts and then eats what one has been offered.

original: diyyati. Pāṭipadikaṃ nāma “uposathe bahū saddhā pasannā bhikkhūnaṃ sakkāraṃ karonti,
analyzed: diyyati pāṭipadikam nāma uposathe bahū saddhā pasannāḥ bhikkhūnam sakkāram karonti
translated: The first-of-the-month meal: on the observance day, many faithful and confident people make offerings to the monks,

original: pāṭipade pana bhikkhū kilamanti, pāṭipade dinnaṃ dubbhikkhadānasadisaṃ mahapphalaṃ
