analyzed: pāṭipade pana bhikkhū kilamanti pāṭipade dinnam dubbhikkha dāna sadisam mahapphalam
translated: But if it is given on the Observance day, the monks are tired out. What is given on the Observance day is like a famine-time gift and is very fruitful.

original: hoti, uposathakammena vā parisuddhasīlānaṃ dutiyadivase dinnaṃ mahapphalaṃ hotī”ti🔽sallakkhetvā pāṭipade diyyanakadānaṃ, tampi ubhayaṃ salākabhattagatikameva. Iti imāni
analyzed: hoti uposatha kammena vā parisuddha sīlānam dutiya divase dinnam mahapphalam hoti iti  sallakkhetvā pāṭipade diyyanaka dānam tam pi ubhayam salākabhattagatikam eva iti imāni
translated: Or what is given on the second day to those whose virtue is purified by the Observance ceremony is very fruitful.

original: sattapi bhattāni piṇḍapātikānaṃ na vaṭṭanti, dhutaṅgabhedaṃ karontiyeva.🔽Aparānipi cīvarakkhandhake visākhāya varaṃ yācitvā dinnāni āgantukabhattaṃ gamiyabhattaṃ
analyzed: satta pi bhattāni piṇḍapātikānam na vaṭṭanti dhutaṅga bhedam  aparāni pi cīvarakkhandhake visākhāya varam yācitvā dinnāni āgantuka bhattam gamiya bhattam
translated: Having considered thus, the alms given on the Observance day, and the alms given on the Invitation day, are both of them only for one who goes on continuous alms round. So these seven kinds of alms are not allowable for one who goes on continuous alms round; they cause him to break his ascetic practice.

original: gilānabhattaṃ gilānupaṭṭhākabhattanti cattāri bhattāni pāḷiyaṃ āgatāneva, tattha🔽āgantukānaṃ dinnaṃ bhattaṃ “āgantukabhattaṃ”. Esa nayo sesesu. Sace panettha āgantukabhattānipi
analyzed: gilāna bhattam gilāna upaṭṭhāka bhattanti cattāri bhattāni pāḷiyam āgatāna eva tattha  āgantukānam dinnam bhattam āgantuka bhattam esa nayaḥ sesesu sace pana ittha āgantuka bhattāni pi
translated: There are also four kinds of alms mentioned in the texts, namely, alms for visitors, alms for those going on a long journey, alms for the sick, and alms for those who tend the sick. Herein

original: āgantukāpi bahū honti, sabbesaṃ ekekaṃ gāhetabbaṃ, bhattesu appahontesu ṭhitikāya
analyzed: āgantukāḥ api bahū honti sabbesam ekekam gāhetabbam bhattesu ṭhitikāya
translated: Alms given for visitors: alms given to visitors are ‘alms for visitors.’ The same method applies in the case of the rest. But if there are many visitors and the alms for visitors are small, and if there are few sick and many who tend them, then all the visitors should take one share each, and the rest should be given to the sick.🔽If there are many sick and few visitors, then all the sick should take one share each, and the rest should be given to the visitors.🔽If there are many visitors and many sick, the sick should take one share each, and the visitors two shares each.🔽If there are few sick and many visitors, the sick should take two shares each, and the visitors one share each.

original: gāhetabbaṃ. Eko āgantuko paṭhamameva āgantvā sabbaṃ āgantukabhattaṃ attano gāhetvā
analyzed: gāhetabbam ekaḥ āgantukaḥ paṭhamam eva āgantvā sabbam āgantuka bhattam attanaḥ gāhetvā
translated: should be taken. If a single incoming monk arrives first and takes all the food for incoming monks,🔽

original: nisīdati, sabbaṃ tasseva hoti, pacchā āgatehi āgantukehi tena dinnāni paribhuñjitabbāni.
analyzed: nisīdati sabbam tassa iva hoti pacchā āgatehi āgantukehi tena dinnāni paribhuñjitabbāni
translated: He should take it. If a visitor comes first and takes all the food meant for visitors for himself and sits down, it is all his; what he gives to those who come later is what they should eat.

original: Tenapi ekaṃ attano gahetvā sesāni dātabbāni. Ayaṃ uḷāro.🔽Sace pana yo paṭhamaṃ āgantvāpi attano aggahetvā tuṇhībhūto nisīdati, pacchā āgatehi
analyzed: tena api ekam attanaḥ gahetvā sesāni dātabbāni ayam uḷāraḥ  sace pana yaḥ paṭhamam āgantvā api attanaḥ aggahetvā tuṇhībhūtaḥ nisīdati pacchā āgatehi
translated: And he should take one himself and give the rest to them. This is the generous way.

original: saddhiṃ paṭipāṭiyā gaṇhitabbaṃ. Sace niccaṃ āgantukā āgacchanti, āgatadivaseyeva
analyzed: saddhim paṭipāṭiyā gaṇhitabbam sace niccam āgantukāḥ āgacchanti āgata divaseya iva
translated: But if he comes first and sits down without taking anything for himself, then what has been taken by those who come later should be shared out with him. If visitors come regularly,

original: bhuñjitabbaṃ, antarantarā ce āgacchanti, dve tīṇi divasāni bhuñjitabbaṃ. Mahāpaccariyaṃ
analyzed: bhuñjitabbam antarantarā ce āgacchanti dve tīṇi divasāni bhuñjitabbam mahāpaccariyam
translated: they should be given food on the day they come. But if they come from time to time, they should be given food for two or three days. But it is said in the Mahāpaccariya that

original: pana “satta divasāni bhuñjituṃ vaṭṭatī”ti vuttaṃ.🔽Āvāsiko katthaci gantvā āgato, tenāpi āgantukabhattaṃ paribhuñjitabbaṃ. Sace pana
analyzed: pana satta divasāni bhuñjitum vaṭṭati iti vuttam  āvāsikaḥ katthaci gantvā āgataḥ tena api āgantuka bhattam paribhuñjitabbam sace pana
translated: they can be given food for seven days.

original: taṃ vihāre nibandhāpitaṃ hoti, vihāre gāhetabbaṃ. Atha vihāro dūre hoti, āsanasālāya
analyzed: tam vihāre nibandhāpitam hoti vihāre gāhetabbam atha vihāraḥ dūre hoti āsana sālāya
translated: If a resident monk goes somewhere and returns, he should eat the food meant for visitors. But if it has been stored in the dwelling, he should take it from the dwelling. If the dwelling is far away, he should take it from the sitting hall.

original: nibandhāpitaṃ āsanasālāya gāhetabbaṃ. Sace pana dāyakā “āgantukesu asati āvāsikāpi
analyzed: nibandhāpitam āsana sālāya gāhetabbam sace pana dāyakā āgantukesu asati āvāsikā api
translated: The one who has had it prepared should take it to the assembly hall. But if the donors say, “If there are no newly arrived monks, then the resident monks

original: paribhuñjantū”ti vadanti, vaṭṭati.
analyzed: paribhuñjantu iti vadanti vaṭṭati
translated: If the donors have it prepared, it should be taken to the assembly hall. But if the donors say, “If there are no visitors, let the resident monks use it,” it is allowable.

original: Gamiyabhattepi ayameva kathāmaggo. Ayaṃ pana viseso – āgantuko āgantukabhattameva
analyzed: gamiya bhatte pi ayam eva kathā maggaḥ ayam pana visesaḥ āgantukaḥ āgantuka bhattam eva
translated: The same method of explanation applies to going-to-be-accepted food. But there is this difference. The visitor gets only visitor food;

original: labhati, gamiko āgantukabhattampi gamiyabhattampi. Āvāsikopi pakkamitukāmo gamiko🔽hoti; gamiyabhattaṃ labhati. Yathā pana āgantukabhattaṃ; evamidaṃ dve vā tīṇi vā🔽satta vā divasāni na labbhati. “Gamissāmī”ti bhutto taṃdivasaṃ kenacideva kāraṇena🔽na gato, punadivasepi bhuñjituṃ vaṭṭati, saussāhattā. “Gamissāmī”ti bhuttassa corā
analyzed: labhati gamikaḥ āgantuka bhattam pi gamiya bhattam pi āvāsikaḥ api pakkamitu kāmaḥ gamiko  hoti gamiya bhattam labhati yathā pana āgantuka bhattam evam idam dve vā tīṇi vā  satta vā divasāni na labbhati gamissāmi iti bhuttaḥ tam divasam kenacid eva kāraṇena  na gataḥ puna divase pi bhuñjitum vaṭṭati saussāha ttā gamissāmi iti bhuttassa corā
translated: the one going on a journey gets both visitor food and going-to-be-accepted food. The resident monk who is about to set out on a journey is one going on a journey;

original: vā panthaṃ rundhanti udakaṃ vā, devo vā vassati, sattho vā na gacchati, saussāhena
analyzed: vā pantham rundhanti udakam vā devaḥ vā vassati satthaḥ vā na gacchati saussāhena
translated: he gets going-to-be-accepted food. But this is not allowable for two, three, or seven days as is the case with visitor food. If he has eaten thinking, “I will set out on a journey,” and he does not go on that day because of some reason or other, it is allowable for him to eat it on the following day too, because of the urgency. If he has eaten thinking, “I will set out on a journey,” and he is unable to go because thieves have taken over the road or because the water has flooded it or because it is raining or because the caravan will not go, it is allowable for him to eat it on the following day too, because of the urgency.

original: bhuñjitabbaṃ. Ete upaddave olokentena “dve tayo divase bhuñjituṃ vaṭṭatī”ti mahāpaccariyaṃ
analyzed: bhuñjitabbam ete upaddave olokentena dve tayo divase bhuñjitum vaṭṭati iti mahā paccariyam
translated: He should eat it. When he is looking at these dangers, it is proper for him to eat for two or three days.

original: vuttaṃ. “Gamissāmī”ti pana lesaṃ oḍḍetvā bhuñjituṃ na labhati.
analyzed: vuttam gamissāmi iti pana lesam oḍḍetvā bhuñjitum na labhati
translated: The Great Elder says in the Mahā-paccaya-sutta: “I shall go away” but he is not allowed to eat after storing up a reserve.

original: Gilānabhattampi sace sabbesaṃ gilānānaṃ pahoti, sabbesaṃ dātabbaṃ; no ce, ṭhitikaṃ
analyzed: gilāna bhattam pi sace sabbesam gilānānam pahoti sabbesam dātabbam no ce ṭhitikam
translated: If there is enough of the sick man’s food to go round, it should be given to everyone. If not, it should be taken

original: katvā gāhetabbaṃ. Eko gilāno arogarūpo sakkoti antogāmaṃ gantuṃ, eko na sakkoti,
analyzed: katvā gāhetabbam ekaḥ gilānaḥ aroga rūpo sakkoti antogāmam gantum ekaḥ na sakkoti
translated: after making a share for each. If one sick man is able to go to the village for alms but the other is not,

original: ayaṃ “mahāgilāno” nāma. Etassa gilānabhattaṃ dātabbaṃ. Dve mahāgilānā – eko lābhī🔽abhiññāto bahuṃ khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyaṃ labhati, eko anātho appalābhatāya antogāmaṃ
analyzed: ayam mahāgilānaḥ nāma etassa gilāna bhattam dātabbam dve mahāgilānā ekaḥ lābhī  abhiññātaḥ bahum khādanīyam bhojanīyam labhati ekaḥ anāthaḥ appalābha tāya antogāmam
translated: the latter is called “very sick.” His food should be given. There are two kinds of very sick man: one is a recipient of robes, etc.,

original: pavisati – etassa gilānabhattaṃ dātabbaṃ. Gilānabhatte pana divasaparicchedo natthi.
analyzed: pavisati etassa gilāna bhattam dātabbam gilāna bhatte pana divasa paricchedaḥ na atthi
translated: and gets much fresh and cooked food, the other is helpless and gets little. The latter’s food should be given. But there is no restriction of time in the case of sick man’s food.

original: Yāva rogo na vūpasammati, sappāyabhojanaṃ abhuñjanto na yāpeti, tāva bhuñjitabbaṃ.
analyzed: yāva rogaḥ na vūpasammati sappāya bhojanam a bhuñjantaḥ na tāva bhuñjitabbam
translated: As long as the sickness has not subsided, he may eat it as long as he does not fail to get suitable food.

original: Yadā pana missakayāguṃ vā missakabhattaṃ vā bhuttassāpi rogo na kuppati, tato paṭṭhāya na bhuñjitabbaṃ.
analyzed: yadā pana missaka yāgum vā missaka bhattam vā bhuttassa api rogaḥ na kuppati tatas paṭṭhāya na bhuñjitabbam
translated: But when he is not troubled by the disease even after eating a mixed gruel or a mixed meal, then he should not eat it.

original: Gilānupaṭṭhākabhattampi yaṃ sabbesaṃ pahoti, taṃ sabbesaṃ dātabbaṃ; no ce pahoti,
analyzed: gilāna upaṭṭhāka bhattam pi yam sabbesam pahoti tam sabbesam dātabbam no ce pahoti
translated: The meal for the nurse should be given to all if it is enough for all. If not,

original: ṭhitikaṃ katvā gāhetabbaṃ. Idampi dvīsu gilānesu mahāgilānupaṭṭhākassa gāhetabbaṃ,🔽dvīsu mahāgilānesu anāthagilānupaṭṭhākassa. Yaṃ kulaṃ gilānabhattampi deti gilānupaṭṭhākabhattampi,
analyzed: ṭhitikam katvā gāhetabbam idam api dvīsu gilānesu mahā gilāna upaṭṭhākassa gāhetabbam  dvīsu mahā gilānesu anātha gilāna upaṭṭhākassa yam kulam gilāna bhattam pi deti gilāna upaṭṭhāka bhattam pi
translated: it should be taken by ticket. This should be taken by the one nursing the more important of two patients.🔽In the case of two important patients, it should be taken by the one nursing the one who got sick first. If a family gives a meal for a sick person and a meal for a nurse,

original: tattha yassa gilānassa bhattaṃ pāpuṇāti tadupaṭṭhākassāpi tattheva gāhetabbaṃ. Gilānupaṭṭhākabhattepi
analyzed: tattha yassa gilānassa bhattam pāpuṇāti tad upaṭṭhākassa api tattha iva gāhetabbam gilāna upaṭṭhāka bhatte pi
translated: then the nurse should take it there where the sick person gets his meal.

original: divasaparicchedo natthi, yāva gilāno labhati, tāvassa upaṭṭhākopi labhatīti. Imāni
analyzed: divasa paricchedaḥ natthi yāva gilānaḥ labhati tāva assa upaṭṭhākaḥ api labhati iti imāni
translated: There is no restriction of time in the case of the meal for the nurse. The nurse gets it as long as the sick person gets it.

original: cattāri bhattāni sace evaṃ dinnāni honti “āgantukagamikagilānupaṭṭhākā mama bhikkhaṃ
analyzed: cattāri bhattāni sace evam dinnāni honti āgantuka gamika gilāna upaṭṭhākāḥ mama bhikkham
translated: These are the four kinds of meals. If they are given in this way: “Give alms to the incoming and outgoing monks, to the sick and to those nursing the sick, and to me too,”

original: gaṇhantū”ti, piṇḍapātikānampi vaṭṭati. Sace pana āgantukādīnaṃ bhattaṃ nibandhāpemi,
analyzed: gaṇhantu uti piṇḍapātikānam pi vaṭṭati sace pana āgantuka ādīnam bhattam nibandhāpemi
translated: and they can be accepted by those who go on alms round. If he thinks, “I’ll have the meal of the newly arrived monks prepared,”🔽

original: “mama bhattaṃ gaṇhantū”ti evaṃ dinnāni honti, piṇḍapātikānaṃ na vaṭṭati.
analyzed: mama bhattam gaṇhantu iti evam dinnāni honti piṇḍapātikānam na vaṭṭati
translated: It is allowable for those who go on for alms round. But if he has had a meal for newcomers, etc., arranged, and they are given saying, “Let them take my meal,” it is not allowable for those who go on for alms round.

original: Aparānipi “dhurabhattaṃ, kuṭibhattaṃ, vārabhatta”nti tīṇi bhattāni. Tattha dhurabhattanti🔽niccabhattaṃ vuccati, taṃ duvidhaṃ – saṅghikaṃ puggalikañca. Tattha yaṃ “saṅghassa🔽dhurabhattaṃ demā”ti nibandhāpitaṃ, taṃ salākabhattagatikaṃ. “Mama nibaddhaṃ bhikkhaṃ
analyzed: aparāni pi dhurabhattam kuṭibhattam vārabhattanti tīṇi bhattāni tattha dhurabhattanti  niccabhattam vuccati tam duvidham saṅghikam puggalikam ca tattha yam saṅghassa  dhurabhattam dema iti nibandhāpitam tam salākabhatta gatikam mama nibaddham bhikkham
translated: There are three other kinds of meals, that is, the meal on the monastery ground, the meal in the rest house, and the meal on the invitation of a family.

original: gaṇhantū”ti vatvā dinnaṃ pana piṇḍapātikānampi vaṭṭati. Puggalikepi “tumhākaṃ dhurabhattaṃ🔽dammī”ti vutte piṇḍapātiko ce, na vaṭṭati. “Mama nibaddhaṃ bhikkhaṃ gaṇhathā”ti vutte
analyzed: gaṇhantu uti vatvā dinnam pana piṇḍapātikānam pi vaṭṭati puggalike pi tumhākam dhura bhattam  dammi iti vutte piṇḍapātiko ce na vaṭṭati mama nibaddham bhikkham gaṇhatha ati vutte
translated: Herein, the meal on the monastery ground is called a regular meal. That is of two kinds, that is to say, belonging to the Community and belonging to an individual. Herein, that which is arranged by saying, “We give a meal on the monastery ground to the Community” is included in the meal given by a ticket. But that given by saying, “Let them take my regular meal” is allowable for those who go on for alms round.🔽As regards that belonging to an individual, if it is said, “I give you a meal on the monastery ground,” it is not allowable for one who goes on for alms round. But if it is said, “Take my regular meal,” it is allowable. It should be accepted.

original: pana vaṭṭati, sāditabbaṃ. Sacepi pacchā katipāhe vītivatte “dhurabhattaṃ gaṇhathā”ti
analyzed: pana vaṭṭati sāditabbam sace pi pacchā kati pāhe vītivatte dhurabhattam gaṇhatha ati
translated: And if after a few days have passed it is said, “Take the meal on the monastery ground,”

original: vadati, mūle suṭṭhu sampaṭicchitattā vaṭṭati.🔽Kuṭibhattaṃ nāma yaṃ saṅghassa āvāsaṃ kāretvā “amhākaṃ senāsanavāsino amhākaṃyeva🔽bhattaṃ gaṇhantū”ti evaṃ nibandhāpitaṃ, taṃ salākabhattagatikameva hoti, gahetvā🔽bhuñjitabbaṃ. “Amhākaṃ senāsanavāsino amhākaṃyeva bhikkhaṃ gaṇhantū”ti vutte pana🔽piṇḍapātikānampi vaṭṭati. Yaṃ pana puggale pasīditvā tassa vā āvāsaṃ katvā “tumhākaṃ
analyzed: vadati mūle suṭṭhu sampaṭicchita tā vaṭṭati  kuṭibhattam nāma yam saṅghassa āvāsam kāretvā amhākam senāsana vāsinaḥ amhākam yeva  bhattam gaṇhantu iti evam nibandhāpitam tam salāka bhatta gatikam eva hoti gahetvā  bhuñjitabbam amhākam senāsana vāsinaḥ amhākam yeva bhikkham gaṇhantu iti vutte pana  piṇḍapātikānam pi vaṭṭati yam pana puggale pasīditvā tassa vā āvāsam katvā tumhākam
translated: If he says, “I’ve already accepted it at the root,” it’s allowable.

original: demā”ti dinnaṃ, taṃ tasseva hoti, tasmiṃ katthaci gate nissitakehi bhuñjitabbaṃ.🔽Vārabhattaṃ nāma dubbhikkhasamaye “vārena bhikkhū jaggissāmā”ti dhuragehato paṭṭhāya
analyzed: dema ati dinnam tam tassa iva hoti tasmin katthaci gate nissitakehi bhuñjitabbam  vārabhattam nāma dubbhikkha samaye vārena bhikkhū jaggissāma ati dhura gehataḥ paṭṭhāya
translated: House-to-house food: if someone has a dwelling built for the Sangha, saying, “Those who use my dwelling should get their food from me,” then that food is to be shared out. It should be eaten after it has been received. But if he says, “Those who use my dwelling should get their alms from me,” then it’s allowable for those who go for alms too. But if he has faith in a certain person and has a dwelling built for him, saying, “I give this to you,” then it belongs to that person. When he has gone somewhere else, it should be eaten by those who are left, without a sharing-out.

original: dinnaṃ, tampi bhikkhāvacanena dinnaṃ piṇḍapātikānaṃ vaṭṭati. “Vārabhatta”nti vutte
analyzed: dinnam tam pi bhikkhā vacanena dinnam piṇḍapātikānam vaṭṭati vārabhattam ti vutte
translated: Turn-by-turn food: if, during a time of famine, people say, “We’ll look after the monks by turns,” then the food given by the head of the household is to be shared out. It’s allowable for those who go for alms if it’s given by saying, “This is alms.” But if it’s said, “This is turn-by-turn food,”

original: pana salākabhattagatikaṃ hoti. Sace taṇḍulādīni pesenti, “sāmaṇerā pacitvā dentū”ti,
analyzed: pana salākabhatta gatikam hoti sace taṇḍula ādīni pesenti sāmaṇerā pacitvā dentu iti
translated: but he is one who gets a share of the rice. If they send rice, etc., he should say, “Let the novices cook it and give it.”

original: piṇḍapātikānaṃ vaṭṭati. Iti imāni ca tīṇi āgantukabhattādīni ca cattārīti satta,
analyzed: piṇḍapātikānam vaṭṭati iti imāni ca tīṇi āgantuka bhatta ādīni ca cattāri iti satta
translated: It is allowable for those who go on the alms round. So these three and the forty beginning with the incoming alms make fifty-seven.

original: tāni saṅghabhattādīhi saha cuddasa bhattāni honti.🔽Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana vihārabhattaṃ, aṭṭhakabhattaṃ, catukkabhattaṃ, guḷhakabhattanti
analyzed: tāni saṅgha bhatta ādīhi saha cuddasa bhattāni honti  pana vihāra bhattam aṭṭhaka bhattam catukka bhattam guḷhaka bhattanti
translated: Together with the “alms for the Community” and the rest, they make sixty-four kinds of alms.🔽But in the commentary four other kinds of alms are mentioned, that is, “alms for the monastery, alms for eight, alms for four, alms for a group. ”

original: aññānipi cattāri bhattāni vuttāni. Tattha vihārabhattaṃ nāma vihāre tatruppādabhattaṃ,
analyzed: aññāni pi cattāri bhattāni vuttāni tattha vihāra bhattam nāma vihāre tatruppāda bhattam
translated: Herein, “alms for the monastery” is alms for those living in the monastery that has arisen by reason of that monastery.

original: taṃ saṅghabhattena gahitaṃ. Taṃ pana tissamahāvihāracittalapabbatādīsu paṭisambhidāpattehi
analyzed: tam saṅgha bhattena gahitam tam pana tissa mahāvihāra cittala pabbata ādīsu paṭisambhidā pattehi
translated: That is included in “alms for the Community.” But in the three great monasteries of Jeta’s Wood, Veḷuvana, and the Palace, and on the Cittalapabbata, etc.,

original: khīṇāsavehi yathā piṇḍapātikānampi sakkā hoti paribhuñjituṃ, tathā paṭiggahitattā
analyzed: khīṇa āsavehi yathā piṇḍapātikānam pi sakkā hoti paribhuñjitum tathā paṭiggahita ttā
translated: it is allowable for those who go on the alms round to eat it too, because it is received in such a way that it can be eaten by those who go on the alms round as well as by those who are perfected in the analytical knowledges and have destroyed the taints.

original: tādisesu ṭhānesu piṇḍapātikānampi vaṭṭati. “Aṭṭhannaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ dema, catunnaṃ demā”ti
analyzed: tādisesu ṭhānesu piṇḍapātikānam pi vaṭṭati aṭṭhannam bhikkhūnam dema catunnam dema ati
translated: “We give to eight bhikkhus,” “We give to four bhikkhus,”

original: evaṃ dinnaṃ pana aṭṭhakabhattañceva catukkabhattañca; tampi bhikkhāvacanena dinnaṃ
analyzed: evam dinnam pana aṭṭhaka bhattam ca iva catukka bhattam ca tat pi bhikkhā vacanena dinnam
translated: But alms food given thus as a meal for eight or four is allowable for those who go for alms, if it is given with the words “alms food.”

original: piṇḍapātikānaṃ vaṭṭati. Mahābhisaṅkhārikena atirasakapūvena pattaṃ pūretvā thaketvā
analyzed: piṇḍapātikānam vaṭṭati mahābhisaṅkhārikena atirasaka pūvena pattam pūretvā thaketvā
translated: The meal called “a lump of boiled rice” is that given by filling a bowl with very tasty cooked rice prepared on a large scale and then setting it aside.

original: dinnaṃ guḷhakabhattaṃ nāma. Imāni tīṇi salākabhattagatikāneva.🔽Aparampi guḷakabhattaṃ nāma atthi, idhekacce manussā mahādhammasavanañca vihārapūjañca🔽kāretvā sakalasaṅghassa dātuṃ na sakkomāti, “dve tīṇi bhikkhusatāni amhākaṃ bhikkhaṃ
analyzed: dinnam guḷhaka bhattam nāma imāni tīṇi  aparam pi guḷakabhattam nāma atthi idha ekacce manussāḥ mahā dhamma savanañca vihāra pūjañca  kāretvā sakala saṅghassa dātum na sakkoma ati dve tīṇi bhikkhu satāni amhākam bhikkham
translated: These three kinds of meals are only for those who go on an invitation-day alms round.

original: gaṇhantū”ti bhikkhuparicchedajānanatthaṃ guḷake denti, idaṃ piṇḍapātikānampi vaṭṭati.
analyzed: gaṇhantu uti bhikkhu pariccheda jānana attham guḷake denti idam piṇḍapātikānam pi vaṭṭati
translated: There is another kind of meal called “a lump of boiled rice.” Here some people, after holding a great preaching of the Dhamma or a festival for a shrine, are unable to give to the whole Order, so they give lumps of boiled rice to find out how many there are in the Order, saying, “Let two or three hundred bhikkhus take alms from us.” This is allowable for those who go for alms too.

original: Iti cīvarakkhandhake cīvarabhājanīyaṃ, imasmiṃ pana senāsanakkhandhake senāsanabhājanīyañceva
analyzed: iti cīvara kkhandhake cīvara bhājanīyam imasmin pana senāsana kkhandhake senāsana bhājanīyam ca iva
translated: So in the chapter on robes the distribution of robes is told, and in this chapter on the resting place the distribution of resting places and

original: piṇḍapātabhājanīyañca vuttaṃ.
analyzed: piṇḍapāta bhājanīyañca vuttam
translated: alms food is told.

original: Gilānapaccayabhājanīyaṃ pana evaṃ veditabbaṃ – sappiādīsu bhesajjesu rājarājamahāmattā
analyzed: gilāna paccaya bhājanīyam pana evam veditabbam sappi ādīsu bhesajjesu rāja rāja mahāmattā
translated: The distribution of requisites for the sick should be understood as follows. As regards the medicines such as ghee, etc.,

original: sappissa tāva kumbhasatampi kumbhasahassampi vihāraṃ pesenti, ghaṇṭiṃ paharitvā therāsanato
analyzed: sappissa tāva kumbha satam pi kumbha sahassam pi vihāram pesenti ghaṇṭim paharitvā thera āsanataḥ
translated: They send a hundred or a thousand pots of ghee to the monastery, and after striking the gong, they invite the senior monk to accept it.

original: paṭṭhāya gahitabhājanaṃ pūretvā dātabbaṃ, piṇḍapātikānampi vaṭṭati. Sace alasajātikā🔽mahātherā pacchā āgacchanti, “bhante, vīsativassānaṃ diyyati, tumhākaṃ ṭhitikā atikkantā”ti
analyzed: paṭṭhāya gahita bhājanam pūretvā dātabbam piṇḍapātikānam pi vaṭṭati sace alasa jātikā  mahā therā pacchā āgacchanti bhante vīsati vassānam diyyati tumhākam ṭhitikā atikkantā ati
translated: Even a hundred or a thousand pots of ghee are sent to the monastery. After the monastery bell has been rung, it should be given to those who have taken their bowls in order, starting from the senior elder’s place. It is also allowable for those who eat what they have been given in the almsbowl. If lazy monks

original: na vattabbā, ṭhitikaṃ ṭhapetvā tesaṃ datvā pacchā ṭhitikāya dātabbaṃ.
analyzed: na vattabbā ṭhitikam ṭhapetvā tesam datvā pacchā ṭhitikāya dātabbam
translated: come later, they should not be told, “Venerables, it is given to those with twenty years of seniority or more. Your time has passed.” They should be given after setting aside a portion for them.

original: “Asukavihāre bahu sappi uppanna”nti sutvā yojanantaravihāratopi bhikkhū āgacchanti,🔽sampattasampattānaṃ ṭhitaṭṭhānato paṭṭhāya dātabbaṃ. Asampattānampi upacārasīmaṃ
analyzed: asuka vihāre bahu sappi uppannanti sutvā yojana antara vihārataḥ pi bhikkhū āgacchanti  sampatta sampattānam ṭhita ṭṭhānataḥ paṭṭhāya dātabbam a sampattānam pi upacāra sīmam
translated: If they hear that a lot of ghee has been brought to a monastery, monks may come from a monastery a league away.

original: paviṭṭhānaṃ antevāsikādīsu gaṇhantesu dātabbameva. “Bahiupacārasīmāya ṭhitānaṃ dethā”ti
analyzed: paviṭṭhānam antevāsika ādīsu gaṇhantesu dātabbam eva bahi upacāra sīmāya ṭhitānam detha iti
translated: It should be given to those who have arrived, starting from the place where the senior most monk stands. It should also be given to those who are taking it to their pupils and so on, if they have entered the vicinity of the monastery. If they say, “Give it to those who are standing outside the vicinity of the monastery,”

original: vadanti, na dātabbaṃ. Sace pana upacārasīmaṃ okkantehi ekābaddhā hutvā attano vihāradvāre
analyzed: vadanti na dātabbam sace pana upacāra sīmam okkantehi eka ābaddhāḥ hutvā attanaḥ vihāra dvāre
translated: it should not be given. But if they have entered the vicinity of the monastery and are connected with the monastery by having come to its gate,

original: vā antovihāreyeva vā honti, parisāvasena vaḍḍhitā nāma sīmā hoti, tasmā dātabbaṃ.
analyzed: vā vā antovihāreya iva vā honti parisā vasena vaḍḍhitā nāma sīmā hoti tasmai dātabbam
translated: If they are in the monastery or in the surrounding area, then the territory is extended by the assembly. So it should be given.

original: Saṅghanavakassa dinnepi pacchā āgatānaṃ dātabbameva. Dutiyabhāge pana therāsanaṃ
analyzed: saṅgha navakassa dinne pi pacchā āgatānam dātabbam eva dutiya bhāge pana thera āsanam
translated: And when it has been given to the seniormost monk, it should be given to those who arrive later. But when the senior monk has taken his place on the senior monk’s seat,

original: āruḷhe pacchā āgatānaṃ paṭhamabhāgo na pāpuṇāti, dutiyabhāgato vassaggena dātabbaṃ.
analyzed: āruḷhe pacchā āgatānam paṭhama bhāgaḥ na pāpuṇāti dutiya bhāgataḥ vassaggena dātabbam
translated: those who arrive later do not get a share of the first portion. They should be given a share of the second portion by the one who is the senior monk for that occasion.

original: Upacārasīmaṃ pavisitvā yattha katthaci dinnaṃ hoti, sabbasannipātaṭṭhāneyeva bhājetabbaṃ.🔽Yasmiṃ vihāre dasa bhikkhū, daseva ca sappikumbhā diyyanti, ekekakumbhavaseneva bhājetabbaṃ.

translated: “Should be removed”: the grass should be taken away. “The chaff should be winnowed”: the fine straw mixed with the grain should be winnowed. “Should be cleaned”: the fine straw should be removed. “You should take care of the household duties”: you should look after the household duties. “I shall go forth”: “I shall go forth with you.” Here, wanting to say this suddenly out of affection for his friend, he said “I shall go forth” . But then, out of greed for the glory of kingship,

original: parikaḍḍhiyamānahadayo “ahaṃ tayā”ti ettakameva vatvā sesaṃ vattuṃ nāsakkhīti evamattho veditabbo.

original: 340. Patthaddhena kāyenāti potthakarūpasadisena niccalena kāyena.
analyzed: patthaddhena kāyena ati potthaka rūpa sadisena niccalena kāyena
translated: “With a stiff body”: with a body as stiff as a log.

original: 342. Mayaṃ kho bhaṇe rājañātakā nāmāti rājā amhe jānātīti rājañātakassa bhāvena attānaṃ ukkaṃsanto āha. Pahaṭṭhakaṇṇavāloti bandhane niccale katvā.
analyzed: mayam kho bhaṇe rāja ñātakāḥ nāma ati rājā amhe jānāti iti rāja ñātakassa bhāvena attānam ukkaṃsantaḥ āha pahaṭṭha kaṇṇa vālaḥ iti bandhane niccale katvā
translated: “We are the king’s kinsmen, good man”: he says this in order to exalt himself, “The king knows us as his kinsmen.” “With ears and hair standing on end”: making them stiff and motionless.

original: Dukkhañhi kuñjara nāgamāsadoti bho kuñjara buddhanāgaṃ āsādanaṃ vadhakacittena upagamanaṃ nāma dukkhaṃ. Nāgahatassāti buddhanāgaṃ ghātakassa.
analyzed: dukkham hi kuñjara nāgam āsadaḥ ti bho kuñjara buddha nāgam āsādanam vadhaka cittena upagamanam nāma dukkham nāga hatassa ati buddha nāgam ghātakassa
translated: “For it is hard, O elephant, to attack a dragon,” etc.: to approach a dragon, a Buddha-dragon, with the intention of killing him, is hard, O elephant. “To kill a dragon”: to kill a Buddha-dragon.

original: Paṭikuṭiyova osakkīti tathāgatābhimukhoyeva piṭṭhimehi pādehi avasakki. Alakkhikoti
analyzed: paṭikuṭiyā uva osakkī iti tathāgata abhimukhaḥ yā iva piṭṭhimehi pādehi avasakkī alakkhiko ti
translated: “He fell back right there,” etc.: he fell back right there, with his heels in the air, facing the Tathāgata. “He is not a man,” etc.:

original: ettha na lakkhetīti alakkhiko; na jānātīti attho, ahaṃ pāpakammaṃ karomīti na jānāti.
analyzed: ettha na lakkheti iti alakkhikaḥ na jānāti iti atthaḥ aham pāpa kammam karomi iti na jānāti
translated: herein, he does not discern, thus he is not a man ; the meaning is, he does not know, “I am doing evil.”

original: Na lakkhitabboti vā alakkhiko; na passitabboti attho.🔽343. Tikabhojananti ettha tīhi janehi bhuñjitabbabhojanaṃ. Taṃ paññāpessāmīti taṃ🔽anujānissāmi. Gaṇabhojane pana yathādhammo kāretabboti. Pañcavatthuyācanakathā saṅghādisesavaṇṇanāyaṃ
analyzed: na lakkhitabbaḥ iti vā alakkhikaḥ na passitabbaḥ iti attho  tika bhojanam ti ettha tīhi janehi bhuñjitabba bhojanam tam paññāpessāmi iti tam  anujānissāmi gaṇa bhojane pana yathādhammo kāretabbo ti pañca vatthu yācana kathā saṅgha ādisesa vaṇṇanāyam
translated: ‘Not to be marked’: not to be seen.

original: vuttā. Kappanti āyukappaṃ. Brahmaṃ puññanti seṭṭhaṃ puññaṃ. Kappaṃ saggamhīti āyukappameva.
analyzed: vuttā kappanti āyu kappam brahmam puññanti seṭṭham puññam kappam saggamhi iti āyu kappam eva
translated: ‘A meal for three’: a meal for three people. ‘I will lay down’: I will allow. But in the case of a meal for a group, the proper procedure is to be done. The discussion of the asking for five things is given in the commentary on the offense entailing suspension. ‘For an eon’: for the human lifespan. ‘A great deal of merit’: the best kind of merit. ‘For an eon in heaven’: for the human lifespan.

original: Pakāsanīyakammādikathā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: pakāsanīya kamma ādi kathā niṭṭhitā
translated: The discussion of the legal procedure of information, etc. is finished.

original: Saṅghabhedakakathā
analyzed: saṅgha bhedaka kathā
translated: The discussion of schism in the Sangha🔽Then Devadatta, having split the Sangha,

original: 344. Atha kho devadatto saṅghaṃ bhinditvāti so kira evaṃ salākaṃ gāhetvā tattheva āveṇikaṃ uposathaṃ katvā gato, tenetaṃ vuttaṃ.
analyzed: atha kho devadattaḥ saṅgham bhinditvā ati saḥ kira evam salākam gāhetvā tattha iva āveṇikam uposatham katvā gataḥ tena itam vuttaṃ
translated: he took sides and did the observance-day ceremony there. That’s why it says “having split the Sangha”.

original: 345. Piṭṭhi me āgilāyatīti ciranisajjāya vedanābhibhūtā bādhati. Tamahaṃ āyamissāmīti
analyzed: me āgilāyati iti cira nisajjāya vedanā abhibhūtā bādhati tam aham āyamissāmi iti
translated: ‘My back aches’: he was afflicted by pain from sitting too long. ‘I’ll stretch it’:

original: taṃ ahaṃ pasāressāmi. Ādesanāpāṭihāriyānusāsanī nāma “evampi te mano, tathāpi te
analyzed: tam aham pasāressāmi ādesanā pāṭihāriya anusāsanī nāma evam pi te mano tathā api te
translated: I’ll please him. ‘Persuasion, demonstration, instruction’: “Your mind is like this, your mind is like that.”

original: mano”ti evaṃ parassa cittaṃ jānitvā tadanurūpā dhammadesanā.
analyzed: evam parassa cittam jānitvā tad anurūpā dhamma desanā
translated: and he knew the other’s mind, and he gave him a suitable talk on Dhamma.

original: 346. Mamānukubbanti mamānukiriyaṃ kurumāno. Kapaṇoti dukkhito. Mahāvarāhassāti mahānāgassa.
analyzed: mama anukubbanti mama anukiriyam kurumānaḥ kapaṇaḥ ti dukkhitaḥ mahāvarāhassa ati mahā nāgassa
translated: “They imitate me”: they do what I do. “Poorly”: wretchedly. “The great elephant”: the great tusker.

original: Mahiṃ vikubbatoti pathaviṃ padālentassa. Bhisaṃ ghasamānassāti bhisaṃ khādantassa.🔽Nadīsu jaggatoti ettha so kira hatthināgo sāyanhasamayaṃ taṃ nadināmakaṃ pokkharaṇiṃ
analyzed: mahim vikubbataḥ ti pathavim padālentassa bhisam ghasamānassa ati bhisam khādantassa  nadīsu jaggato ti ettha saḥ kira hatthi nāgaḥ sāyanha samayam tam nadi nāmakam pokkharaṇim
translated: “Who breaks up the earth”: who digs up the earth with his feet. “Who eats grass”: who chews grass.

original: ogāhetvā kilanto sabbarattiṃ vītināmesi, jālikaṃ karoti, tena vuttaṃ “nadīsu jaggato”ti.🔽347. Sutāti sotā. Asandiddho ca akkhātīti nissandeho hutvā akkhāti anusandhivasena yojetvā yojetvā.
analyzed: ogāhetvā kilantaḥ sabba rattim vītināmesi jālikam karoti tena vuttam nadīsu jaggato ti  sutā ati sotā asandiddho ca akkhāti iti nissandehaḥ hutvā akkhāti anusandhi vasena yojetvā yojetvā
translated: “Who wanders in the rivers”: it seems that this tusker elephant went down into a lotus pond called “The River” in the evening, and after spending the whole night there, he made a dam, and therefore it was said, “Who wanders in the rivers.”🔽“The hearer”: the listener. “And speaks without reserve”: he speaks without holding anything back.

original: 350. Apāye nibbattissatīti āpāyiko. Evaṃ nerayiko. Kappaṃ ṭhassatīti kappaṭṭho. Idāni buddhasahassenāpi tikicchituṃ na sakkāti atekiccho.
analyzed: apāye nibbattissati iti āpāyikaḥ evam nerayiko kappam ṭhassati iti kappaṭṭho idāni buddha sahassena api tikicchitum na sakkā ati atekicchaḥ
translated: “Will be reborn in the states of deprivation”: he will be reborn in the states of deprivation. Thus he is a hell being. “Will last for an eon”: he will last for an eon. “Incurable”: he cannot be cured even by a thousand Buddhas.

original: Mā jātu koci lokasminti mā kadācipi koci satto lokasmiṃ. Udapajjathāti upapajjatha.🔽Jalaṃva yasasā aṭṭhāti yasasā jalanto viya ṭhito. Devadattoti me sutanti “īdiso devadatto”ti
analyzed: mā jātu koci lokasmin ti mā kadācid pi koci sattaḥ lokasmin udapajjatha ati upapajjatha  yasasā yasasā jalantaḥ viya ṭhitaḥ devadattā uti me īdisaḥ devadattā iti
translated: ‘May no one ever in the world’: may no being ever in the world. ‘Be reborn’: be reborn.

original: bhagavatā sutampi atthi, tadeva gahetvā idaṃ vuttaṃ. So pamādamanuciṇṇoti ettha pamādaṃ
analyzed: bhagavatā sutam pi atthi tat eva gahetvā idam vuttam saḥ ettha pamādam
translated: ‘Standing in glory like a lake’: standing like a lake full of glory. ‘I have heard of Devadatta’: there is what has been heard by the Exalted One that ‘Devadatta is like this’;🔽taking that, this is said. ‘He who has fallen into heedlessness’: here, he who has fallen into heedlessness is one who has fallen into heedlessness,

original: anucinātīti anuciṇṇo, pamādo appahīnoti attho. Āsajja nanti pāpakena cittena patvā,🔽visosetvāti vā attho. Avīcinirayaṃ pattoti idaṃ pana āsīsāyaṃ atītavacanaṃ. Bhesmāti bhayānako.🔽Saṅghabhedakakathā niṭṭhitā.🔽Upālipañhākathā🔽351. Ekato upāli ekoti dhammavādipakkhe eko. Ekato dveti adhammavādipakkhe dve. Catuttho
analyzed: anucināti iti anuciṇṇaḥ pamādaḥ appahīno ti attho āsajja nanti pāpakena cittena patvā  visosetvā iti vā atthaḥ avīci nirayam patto ti idam pana atīta vacanam bhesma ati bhayānakaḥ  saṅgha bhedaka kathā niṭṭhitā  upāli pañhā kathā  ekatas upāli ekaḥ iti dhamma vādi pakkhe ekaḥ ekatas dve iti adhamma vādi pakkhe dve catutthaḥ
translated: who has not abandoned heedlessness, is the meaning. ‘Having fallen into evil’: having fallen with an evil mind,

original: anussāvetīti saṅghaṃ bhindissāmīti adhammavādicatuttho hutvā anussāveti; anunayanto
analyzed: anussāveti iti saṅgham bhindissāmi iti adhamma vādi catutthaḥ hutvā anussāveti anunayantaḥ
translated: having fallen into evil, is the meaning. ‘Has fallen into Avīci Hell’: this is a past tense expression for one who is falling. ‘Terrible’: fearful.

original: sāveti “na tumhākaṃyeva narakabhayaṃ atthi, amhākampi atthi, na amhākaṃ avīcimaggo🔽pihito, na mayaṃ akusalā na bhāyāma. Yadi hi ayaṃ adhammo avinayo asatthusāsanaṃ🔽vā bhaveyya, na mayaṃ gaṇheyyāmā”tiādinā nayena “adhammaṃ dhammo”ti evaṃ aṭṭhārasa
analyzed: na tumhākam yeva naraka bhayam atthi amhākam pi atthi na amhākam avīci maggo  pihitaḥ na mayam akusalāḥ na bhāyāma yadi hi ayam adhammaḥ avinayaḥ a satthu sāsanam  vā bhaveyya na mayam gaṇheyyāma ati ādinā nayena adhammam dhammo ti evam aṭṭhārasa
translated: “It is not only you who have the fear of hell, we have it too. The road to Avīci is not closed to us. We are not unskilful, we are not afraid. If this were an unrighteous, un-Dhamma, not the Teacher’s Dispensation,🔽we would not accept it.” In this way, “unrighteous as righteous,” and so on,🔽

original: bhedakaravatthūni bodhetīti attho. Salākaṃ gāhetīti evaṃ anussāvetvā pana “idaṃ gaṇhatha,🔽idaṃ rocethā”ti vadanto salākaṃ gāheti.
analyzed: bheda kara vatthūni bodheti iti attho salākam gāheti iti evam anussāvetvā pana idam gaṇhatha  idam rocetha ati vadantaḥ salākam gāha iti
translated: “You are not the only ones who have fear of hell; we have it too. The path to Avīci is not closed to us. We are not unskilled; we are not afraid. For if this were a non-Dhamma, a non-discipline, a non- teaching of the Master, we would not accept it.” In this way he informs them of the eighteen grounds for schism, “Non-Dhamma as Dhamma,” and so on. He takes up a vote: having thus informed them, he says, “Take this, approve this,” and so he takes up a vote.

original: Ekato upāli dve hontītiādīsupi eseva nayo. Evaṃ kho upāli saṅgharāji ceva hoti saṅghabhedo cāti evaṃ hoti; na pana ettāvatā saṅgho bhinno hoti.
analyzed: ekatas upāli dve honti iti ādīsu pi eṣa iva nayaḥ evam kho upāli saṅgha rāji ca iva hoti saṅgha bhedo ca ati evam hoti na pana ettāvatā saṅghaḥ bhinnaḥ hoti
translated: In the passages beginning, “Upāli, when there are two sides” , the meaning should be understood in the same way. Thus, Upāli, there is a schism in the Sangha and a breaking of the wheel: but the Sangha is not yet split.

original: Bhikkhu kho upāli pakatatto samānasaṃvāsako samānasīmāyaṃ ṭhito saṅghaṃ bhindatīti
analyzed: bhikkhu kho upāli pakatattaḥ samāna saṃvāsakaḥ samāna sīmāyam ṭhitaḥ saṅgham bhindati iti
translated: Upāli, a regular monk, a co-residing pupil of his, standing in the same territory, splits the Sangha.”

original: ettha siyā evaṃ “devadatto kathaṃ pakatatto”ti. Kathaṃ tāva na pakatatto, rañño ghātāpitattā
analyzed: ettha siyā evam devadatto katham pakatatto ti katham tāva na pakatatto raññaḥ ghāta āpita ttā
translated: Here it may be asked: “How is Devadatta a regular monk?” How, then, is he not a regular monk? Because he is one who has had a king’s punishment inflicted on him.

original: ruhiruppādassa ca katattāti? Tattha vadāma – āṇattiyā tāva viraddhattā rañño ghātāpanaṃ🔽natthi. “Tena hi tvaṃ, kumāra, pitaraṃ hantvā rājā hohi, ahaṃ bhagavantaṃ hantvā
analyzed: ruhira uppādassa ca kata ttā ti tattha vadāma āṇattiyā tāva raññaḥ ghātāpanam  natthi tena hi tvam kumāra pitaram hantvā rājā hohi aham bhagavantam hantvā
translated: and the arising of the dispute? Here we say: First, as to the command: there is no killing of the king🔽because the command has failed. For the command was: “Then, prince, you be king by killing your father, and I will be Buddha by killing the Blessed One.”

original: buddho bhavissāmī”ti evañhi tassa āṇatti. Kumāro pana rājā hutvā pacchā pitaraṃ māresi;
analyzed: buddhaḥ bhavissāmi iti evam hi tassa āṇatti kumāraḥ pana rājā hutvā pacchā pitaram māresi
translated: But the prince became king and later killed his father.

original: evaṃ tāva āṇattiyā viraddhattā rañño ghātāpanaṃ natthi. Ruhiruppāde pana katamatteyeva🔽ruhiruppādapaccayā bhagavatā abhabbatā na vuttā, na ca sakkā bhagavato vacanaṃ vināyeva
analyzed: evam tāva āṇattiyāḥ viraddha ttā rañño ghātāpanam natthi ruhira uppāde pana  ruhira uppāda paccayāḥ bhagavatā abhabba tā na vuttā na ca sakkā bhagavataḥ vacanam vināya iva
translated: So firstly, as to the command: there is no killing of the king because the command has failed. But when the dispute had arisen,

original: tassa abhabbatā āropetuṃ.
analyzed: tassa abhabba tā āropetum
translated: the Blessed One did not say that he was incapable because of the arising of the dispute. And it is not possible to impute his incapacity without the Blessed One’s saying so.

original: “Ruhiruppādako, bhikkhave, anupasampanno na upasampādetabbo, upasampanno nāsetabbo”ti –
analyzed: ruhiruppādakaḥ bhikkhave anupasampannaḥ na upasampādetabbaḥ upasampannaḥ na āsetabbaḥ
translated: “Bhikkhus, one who causes a schism in the Order, being unaccepted, should not be accepted; if accepted, he should be expelled” .

original: Idaṃ pana bhagavatā saṅghabhedato pacchā vuttaṃ, tasmā pakatatteneva tena saṅgho bhinnoti.
analyzed: idam pana bhagavatā saṅgha bhedato pacchā vuttam tasmā pakata ttena iva tena saṅghaḥ bhinno ti
translated: But this was said by the Blessed One after the schism in the Order. So the Order was split by him as an ordinary man.

original: Adhammaṃ dhammoti dīpentītiādīsu aṭṭhārasasu bhedakaravatthūsu suttantapariyāyena
analyzed: adhammam dhammo ti dīpenti itiādīsu aṭṭhārasasu bheda kara vatthūsu suttanta pariyāyena
translated: In the eighteen grounds for schism beginning with “He misrepresents what is contrary to the Dhamma as being the Dhamma” ,

original: tāva dasa kusalakammapathā dhammo, dasa akusalakammapathā adhammo. Tathā cattāro
analyzed: tāva dasa kusala kamma pathāḥ dhammo dasa akusala kamma pathāḥ adhammo tathā cattāro
translated: the ten courses of wholesome kamma are the Dhamma according to the Suttanta method, and the ten courses of unwholesome kamma are contrary to the Dhamma.

original: satipaṭṭhānā, cattāro sammappadhānā, cattāro iddhipādā, pañcindriyāni, pañca balāni,
analyzed: sati paṭṭhānā cattāro sammappadhānā cattāro iddhipādā pañca indriyāni pañca balāni
translated: Likewise the four foundations of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four bases for spiritual success, the five spiritual faculties, the five powers,

original: satta bojjhaṅgā, ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggoti sattatiṃsa bodhipakkhiyadhammā dhammo nāma;
analyzed: satta bojjhaṅgāḥ ariyaḥ aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ maggo ti sattatiṃsa bodhi pakkhiya dhammāḥ dhammo nāma
translated: the seven factors of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path—these thirty-seven states partaking of enlightenment are the Dhamma;

original: tayo satipaṭṭhānā, tayo sammappadhānā, tayo iddhipādā, cha indriyāni, cha balāni,
analyzed: tayo sati paṭṭhānā tayo sammappadhānā tayo iddhipādā cha indriyāni cha balāni
translated: the three foundations of mindfulness, the three right efforts, the three bases for spiritual success, the six spiritual faculties, the six powers,🔽the eight factors of the noble path, and the nine factors of the supramundane path are the Dhamma;

original: aṭṭha bojjhaṅgā, navaṅgiko maggoti ca cattāro upādānā, pañca nīvaraṇā, satta anusayā,
analyzed: aṭṭha bojjhaṅgā navaṅgikaḥ maggo ti ca cattāro upādānā pañca nīvaraṇā satta anusayā
translated: the four kinds of clinging, the five hindrances, the seven underlying tendencies,

original: aṭṭha micchattāti ca ayaṃ adhammo.
analyzed: aṭṭha micchattā ati ca ayam adhammaḥ
translated: and the eight wrongnesses are contrary to the Dhamma.

original: Tattha yaṃkiñci ekaṃ adhammakoṭṭhāsaṃ gahetvā “imaṃ adhammaṃ dhammoti karissāma;
analyzed: tattha yaṃ kiñci ekam adhamma koṭṭhāsam gahetvā imam adhammam dhammoti karissāma
translated: Herein, taking any one of the items contrary to the Dhamma, he thinks: “I will make this contrary to the Dhamma into the Dhamma;

original: evaṃ amhākaṃ ācariyakulaṃ nissāya niyyānikaṃ bhavissati, mayañca loke pākaṭā bhavissāmā”ti
analyzed: evam amhākam ācariya kulam nissāya niyyānikam bhavissati mayam ca loke pākaṭāḥ bhavissāma ati
translated: “In this way, the going forth will be dependent on our teacher’s family, and we will be well known in the world.”

original: taṃ adhammaṃ “dhammo aya”nti kathayantā adhammaṃ dhammoti dīpenti nāma. Tatheva dhammakoṭṭhāsesu🔽ca ekaṃ gahetvā ayaṃ adhammoti kathentā dhammaṃ adhammoti dīpenti nāma. Vinayapariyāyena
analyzed: tam adhammam dhammo ayanti kathayantāḥ adhammam dhammo ti dīpenti nāma tathā iva dhammakoṭṭhāsesu  ca ekam gahetvā ayam adhammaḥ ti kathentā dhammam adhammaḥ ti dīpenti nāma vinaya pariyāyena
translated: When they say that what is contrary to the Teaching is the Teaching, they misrepresent what is the Teaching as the Teaching.🔽In the same way, when they say that what is contrary to the Teaching is the Teaching, they misrepresent what is the Teaching as the Teaching.

original: pana bhūtena vatthunā codetvā sāretvā yathāpaṭiññāya kātabbaṃ kammaṃ dhammo nāma,
analyzed: pana bhūtena vatthunā codetvā sāretvā yathāpaṭiññāya kātabbam kammam dhammaḥ nāma
translated: But when they accuse someone of an offense, remind him of it, and do the procedure according to his admission, using genuine grounds, this is the Teaching.

original: abhūtena vatthunā acodetvā asāretvā apaṭiññāya kātabbaṃ kammaṃ adhammo nāma.
analyzed: abhūtena vatthunā a codetvā a sāretvā a paṭiññāya kātabbam kammam adhammaḥ nāma
translated: When they do a procedure without accusing someone of an offense, without reminding him of it, and without his admission, using spurious grounds, this is contrary to the Teaching.

original: Suttantapariyāyena rāgavinayo dosavinayo mohavinayo saṃvaro pahānaṃ paṭisaṅkhāti
analyzed: suttanta pariyāyena rāga vinayaḥ dosa vinayaḥ moha vinayo saṃvaro pahānam paṭisaṅkhāti
translated: In the discourses, the abandoning of sensual desire, the abandoning of ill will, and the abandoning of confusion; restraint, giving up, being on one’s guard:🔽this is the Monastic Law.🔽The non-abandoning of sensual desire, the non-abandoning of ill will, and the non-abandoning of confusion; unrestraint, not giving up, not being on one’s guard:

original: ayaṃ vinayo nāma, rāgādīnaṃ avinayo asaṃvaro appahānaṃ appaṭisaṅkhāti ayaṃ avinayo
analyzed: ayam vinayaḥ nāma rāga ādīnam avinayaḥ asaṃvaraḥ appahānam ayam avinayaḥ
translated: this is contrary to the Monastic Law.

original: nāma. Vinayapariyāyena vatthusampatti ñattisampatti anussāvanasampatti sīmāsampatti
analyzed: nāma vinaya pariyāyena vatthu sampatti ñatti sampatti anussāvana sampatti sīmā sampatti
translated: In the Monastic Law, the success of the grounds, the success of the invitation, the success of the proclamation, the success of the monastery zone,

original: parisāsampattīti ayaṃ vinayo nāma, vatthuvipatti…pe… parisāvipattīti ayaṃ avinayo nāma.
analyzed: parisā sampattī iti ayam vinayaḥ nāma vatthu vipatti pe parisā vipattī iti ayam avinayaḥ nāma
translated: ‘The success of the assembly’ is what is called the Monastic Law. ‘Failure of the subject matter’ … ‘Failure of the assembly’ is what is called the non-Monastic Law.

original: Suttantapariyāyena cattāro satipaṭṭhānā… aṭṭhaṅgiko maggoti idaṃ bhāsitaṃ lapitaṃ

analyzed: hoti yattha ekasmin padese bhuñjanti ekasmin padese udakam diyyati tattha yathāsukham bhuñjitabbam  na tāva udakan ti idam hattha dhovana odakam sandhāya vuttam antarā pipāsitena pana  gale vilagga amisena vā pānīyam pivitvā hatthāḥ na dhovitabbā sace manussāḥ dhovatha
translated: But where there is a large dining hall, where people eat in one place and water is served in another, then one can eat as one likes.🔽“Not until the water has been offered”: this refers to the water for washing the bowl. analyzed: katham navakehi iti sabbam daṭṭhabbam sambādhesu hi gharesu mahā therānam nikkhamana ukāsaḥ

translated: “After putting the bowl in the bag” means if there is no water outside the village, then after doing the alms round in the village

original: thavikāya pakkhipitabbo.🔽Paribhojanīyaṃ upaṭṭhāpetabbanti sace bhājanāni nappahonti, pānīyameva paribhojanīyampi🔽katvā upaṭṭhāpetabbaṃ. Bhājanaṃ alabhantena veḷunāḷikāyapi upaṭṭhāpetabbaṃ. Tampi
analyzed: thavikāya pakkhipitabbaḥ  paribhojanīyam upaṭṭhāpetabbanti sace bhājanāni na pahonti pānīyam eva paribhojanīyam pi  katvā upaṭṭhāpetabbam bhājanam a labhantena upaṭṭhāpetabbam tam pi
translated: and washing the bowl, you should put it in the bag.

original: alabhantassa yathā samīpe udakaāvāṭo hoti, evaṃ kātabbaṃ. Araṇisahite sati aggiṃ
analyzed: a labhantassa yathā samīpe udaka āvāṭaḥ hoti evam kātabbam araṇi sahite sati aggim
translated: “You should set out the drinking water and the water for washing” means if there are not enough vessels, you should use the drinking water as washing water. If you do not have a vessel, you should set out the water using a hollow bamboo stem. If you do not have that either, you should make a place for the water nearby. If you have a fire-making kit, you should make a fire.

original: akātumpi vaṭṭati. Yathā ca āraññikassa, evaṃ kantārappaṭipannassāpi araṇisahitaṃ
analyzed: a kātum pi vaṭṭati yathā ca āraññikassa evam kantāra ppaṭipannassa api araṇi sahitam
translated: and it is allowable not to make one. And just as for the forest-dweller, so also for the one who has entered for the Rains in the jungle-thicket, the fire-sticks should be taken along.

original: icchitabbaṃ. Gaṇavāsino pana tena vināpi vaṭṭati. Nakkhattāneva nakkhattapadāni.
analyzed: icchitabbam gaṇa vāsinaḥ pana tena vinā api vaṭṭati nakkhattāna eva nakkhattapadāni
translated: But for the one who lives in a community it is allowable without them.🔽The “star-groups” are the stars.

original: Āraññikavattakathā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: āraññikavatta kathā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Discussion of the Observance for the Rains-residence is finished.

original: Senāsanavattakathā
analyzed: senāsanavattakathā
translated: The Discussion of the Observance for the Monastery

original: 369. Senāsanavatte – dvāraṃ nāma yasmā mahāvaḷañjaṃ, tasmā tattha āpucchanakiccaṃ
analyzed: senāsana vatte dvāram nāma yasmai mahā vaḷañjam tasmai tattha āpucchana kiccam
translated: In the Observance for the Monastery, the “door” is the great outer enclosure, so there is no need to inform about that.

original: natthi, sesāni pana uddesadānādīni āpucchitvāva kātabbāni. Devasikampi āpucchituṃ
analyzed: natthi sesāni pana uddesa dāna ādīni āpucchitvā ava kātabbāni devasikam pi āpucchitum
translated: But the other things beginning with the announcement should be done after informing. It is allowable to inform even every day.

original: vaṭṭati. Athāpi “bhante āpucchitameva hotū”ti vutte vuḍḍhataro “sādhū”ti sampaṭicchati,
analyzed: vaṭṭati atha api bhante āpucchitam eva hotu uti vutte vuḍḍhataraḥ sādhu iti sampaṭicchati
translated: And if someone says, “Let it be as if informed, venerable sir,” and the senior monk assents, saying, “Very well,”🔽or if he himself says, “You may live as you like,” it is allowable too.

original: sayameva vā “tvaṃ yathāsukhaṃ viharāhī”ti vadati; evampi vaṭṭati. Sabhāgassa vissāsenāpi
analyzed: sayam eva vā tvam yathāsukham viharāhi iti vadati evam pi vaṭṭati sa bhāgassa vissāsena api
translated: It is allowable too by the confidence of a fellow member.

original: vaṭṭatiyeva. Yena vuḍḍho tena parivattitabbanti vuḍḍhābhimukhena parivattitabbaṃ.
analyzed: vaṭṭatiyā iva yena vuḍḍhaḥ tena parivattitabbanti vuḍḍha abhimukhena parivattitabbam
translated: “He should turn it over to the senior” means he should turn it over to the senior in the presence of the senior.

original: Bhojanasālādīsupi evameva paṭipajjitabbaṃ.
analyzed: bhojana sāla ādīsu pi evam eva paṭipajjitabbam
translated: He should behave in the same way in the dining hall, etc.

original: Senāsanavattakathā niṭṭhitā.🔽Jantāgharavattādikathā
analyzed: senāsana vatta kathā niṭṭhitā  jantā gharavat tā ādi kathā
translated: The Discussion of the Duties Concerning the Resting Place is finished.🔽The Discussion of the Duties Concerning the Sauna, etc.

original: 371. Jantāgharavatte – paribhaṇḍanti bahijagati.🔽373. Ācamanavatthusmiṃ – sati udaketi ettha sace udakaṃ atthi, paṭicchannaṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: jantāghara vat te paribhaṇḍanti bahijagati  ācamana vatthusmim sati udaka iti ettha sace udakam atthi paṭicchanna ṭṭhānam
translated: In the section on the sauna: the outer area is the area outside the sauna.

original: pana natthi, bhājanena nīharitvā ācamitabbaṃ. Bhājane asati pattena nīharitabbaṃ.
analyzed: pana natthi bhājanena nīharitvā ācamitabbam bhājane asati pattena nīharitabbam
translated: In the section on the water for washing: if there is water but no covered place, then one should take it out in a vessel and wash. If there is no vessel, one should take it out in one’s bowl.

original: Pattepi asati asantaṃ nāma hoti. “Idaṃ ativivaṭaṃ purato aññaṃ udakaṃ bhavissatī”ti🔽gatassa udakaṃ alabhantasseva bhikkhācāravelā hoti, kaṭṭhena vā kenaci vā puñchitvā
analyzed: patte pi asati asantam nāma hoti idam ati vivaṭam puratas aññam udakam bhavissati iti  gatassa udakam a labhantassa iva bhikkhācāra velā hoti kaṭṭhena vā kenacid vā puñchitvā
translated: If there is no bowl, then there is no offense. If one thinks, “This is too exposed. There will be water in front,”

original: gantabbaṃ, bhuñjitumpi anumodanampi kātuṃ vaṭṭati. Āgatapaṭipāṭiyāti vaccakuṭiyaṃ
analyzed: gantabbam bhuñjitum pi anumodanam pi kātum vaṭṭati vacca kuṭiyam
translated: and then, on arriving, one finds no water, one should dig with a stick or something else and then go. It is allowable to eat, to give thanks, and to do the observance-day ceremony.

original: passāvaṭṭhāne nhānatittheti tīsupi āgatapaṭipāṭiyeva pamāṇaṃ.
analyzed: passa avaṭṭhāne nhāna tittha iti tīsu pi āgata paṭipāṭiyā iva pamāṇam
translated: The measure is the order of arrival at the three places: the sauna, the place for urinating and defecating, and the bathing place.

original: 374. Vaccakuṭivatte – na dantakaṭṭhaṃ khādantenāti ayaṃ vaccakuṭiyāpi avaccakuṭiyāpi
analyzed: vacca kuṭi vatte na danta kaṭṭham khādantena ati ayam vacca kuṭiyā api a vacca kuṭiyā api
translated: In the section on the sauna: “without chewing tooth cleaner” applies to both the sauna and the place for defecating and urinating.

original: sabbattheva paṭikkhepo. Na pharusena kaṭṭhenāti phālitakaṭṭhena vā kharena vā gaṇṭhikena🔽vā kaṇṭakena vā susirena vā pūtinā vā na avalekhitabbaṃ. Avalekhanakaṭṭhaṃ pana aggahetvā
analyzed: sabbattha iva paṭikkhepaḥ na pharusena kaṭṭhena ati phālita kaṭṭhena vā kharena vā gaṇṭhikena  vā kaṇṭakena vā susirena vā pūtinā vā na avalekhitabbam avalekhana kaṭṭham pana aggahetvā
translated: There is a prohibition in every case. Not with a rough stick: not with a split stick, nor with a rough one, nor with a knotted one,

original: paviṭṭhassa āpatti natthi.
analyzed: paviṭṭhassa āpatti natthi
translated: nor with a prickly one, nor with a rotten one, nor with a sharp one. But if he enters without taking a stick for scraping, there is no offense.

original: Na ācamanasarāvaketi sabbasādhāraṇaṭṭhānaṃ sandhāyetaṃ vuttaṃ. Tatra hi aññe aññe🔽āgacchanti, tasmā udakaṃ na sesetabbaṃ. Yaṃ pana saṅghikepi vihāre ekadese nibaddhagamanatthāya
analyzed: na ācamana sarāvaka iti sabba sādhāraṇa ṭṭhānam sandhāya itam vuttam tatra hi aññe aññe  āgacchanti tasmai udakam na sesetabbam yam pana saṅghike pi vihāre eka dese nibaddha gamana atthāya
translated: Not in the drinking-water trough: this is said with reference to a place used in common by all. For others and others come there,🔽and therefore water should not be left there. But if there is a place set aside in a certain place in a dwelling belonging to the Community or in a private dwelling,

original: kataṃ ṭhānaṃ hoti puggalikaṭṭhānaṃ vā, tasmiṃ vaṭṭati. Virecanaṃ pivitvā punappunaṃ🔽pavisantassāpi vaṭṭatiyeva.
analyzed: katam ṭhānam hoti puggalika ṭṭhānam vā tasmin vaṭṭati virecanam pivitvā punappunam  pavisantassa api vaṭṭatiyā iva
translated: it is allowable. And it is also allowable for one who has drunk a purgative to enter there again and again.

original: Ūhatāti ūhaditā; bahi vaccamakkhitāti attho. Dhovitabbāti udakaṃ āharitvā dhovitabbā.
analyzed: ūhatā ati ūhaditā bahi vaccamakkhitā ti attho dhovitabbā iti udakam āharitvā dhovitabbā
translated: “To be scraped”: to be scraped outside; the meaning is, to be scraped after being taken outside. “To be washed”: to be washed after bringing water.

original: Udakaṃ atthi, bhājanaṃ natthi, asantaṃ nāma hoti. Bhājanaṃ atthi, udakaṃ natthi,
analyzed: udakam atthi bhājanam na atthi asantam nāma hoti bhājanam atthi udakam na atthi
translated: If there is water but no vessel, it is as if there were none. If there is a vessel but no water,

original: etampi asantaṃ. Ubhaye pana asati asantameva, kaṭṭhena vā kenaci vā puñchitvā gantabbaṃ.
analyzed: etam pi asantam ubhaye pana asati asantam eva kaṭṭhena vā kenacid vā puñchitvā gantabbam
translated: This is also non-existent. But if both are non-existent, one should go after digging with a stick or something.

original: Sesaṃ sabbattha uttānamevāti.🔽Jantāgharavattādikathā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sesam sabbattha uttānam eva ati  jantā ghara vat tā ādi kathā niṭṭhitā
translated: The rest is clear in all cases.🔽The Discussion of the Duties in the Steam-Room, etc. is finished.

original: Vattakkhandhakavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: vattakkhandhaka vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Commentary on the Chapter on Duties is finished.

original: 9. Pātimokkhaṭṭhapanakkhandhakaṃ
analyzed: pātimokkha ṭṭhapana khandhakam
translated: The Chapter on the Suspension of the Pāṭimokkha

original: Pātimokkhuddesayācanakathā
analyzed: pātimokkha uddesa yācana kathā
translated: The Discussion of the Request for the Recital of the Pāṭimokkha

original: 383. Pātimokkhaṭṭhapanakkhandhake – (nandimukhiyā rattiyāti aruṇuṭṭhitakālepi hi
analyzed: pātimokkha ṭṭhapana khandhake nandimukhiyā rattiyā ati aruṇuṭṭhita kāle pi hi
translated: In the Chapter on the Suspension of the Pāṭimokkha— (At the time of the dawn, even at the time of the rising of the dawn,

original: nandimukhā viya ratti khāyati. Tenāha “nandimukhiyā rattiyā”ti. Antopūtinti attacittasantāne
analyzed: nandimukhā viya ratti tena āha nandimukhiyā rattiyā ati atta citta santāne
translated: the night appears as if it were the face of one who is pleased. Therefore it is said, “at the time of the dawn.” Rotten within: rotten within by the rottenness of defilements in one’s own mind-continuum.

original: kilesapūtibhāvena antopūtiṃ. Avassutanti kilesavassanavasena avassutaṃ. Kasambukajātanti🔽ākiṇṇadosatāya saṃkiliṭṭhajātaṃ.) Yāva bāhāgahaṇāpi nāmāti “aparisuddhā ānanda parisā”ti
analyzed: kilesa pūti bhāvena antopūtim avassutam ti kilesa vassana vasena avassutam kasambuka jātam ti  ākiṇṇa dosa tāya saṃkiliṭṭha jātam yāva bāhā gahaṇā api nāma ati aparisuddhā ānanda parisā ati
translated: Corrupted: corrupted by the corruption of defilements. Full of inward corruption: full of corruption by the defilements.🔽(Even if they seize me by the arms:) for even if he does not depart in this way after hearing the words, “Ānanda, the assembly is not pure,”

original: vacanaṃ sutvāyeva hi tena pakkamitabbaṃ siyā, evaṃ apakkamitvā yāva bāhāgahaṇāpi
analyzed: vacanam sutvāya iva hi tena pakkamitabbam siyā evam a pakkamitvā yāva bāhā gahaṇā api
translated: but even if they seize him by the arms,

original: nāma so moghapuriso āgamessati, acchariyamidanti dasseti.
analyzed: nāma saḥ mogha purisaḥ āgamessati dasseti
translated: “He will come, you fool, he will come,” he shows that it is a wonder.

original: 384. Na āyatakeneva papātoti na paṭhamameva gambhīro; anupubbena gambhīroti attho.
analyzed: na āyatakena iva papāto ti na paṭhamam eva gambhīraḥ anupubbena gambhīraḥ ti attho
translated: Not by a long way: not deep at first; the meaning is, it is deep by degrees.

original: Ṭhitadhammo velaṃ nātivattatīti vīcīnaṃ osakkanakandaraṃ mariyādavelaṃ nātikkamati.🔽Tīraṃ vāhetīti tīrato appeti; ussāretīti attho. Aññāpaṭivedhoti arahattappatti.
analyzed: ṭhita dhammaḥ velam na ativattati iti vīcīnam osakkana kandaram mariyāda velam na atikkamati  tīram vāheti iti tīrataḥ appeti ussāreti iti attho aññāpaṭivedhaḥ ti arahatta ppatti
translated: It stands firm: it does not overstep the tide’s limit, the cliff that is the end of the waves’ going out.🔽It carries to the further shore: it conveys to the other side; the meaning is, it conveys to the further shore. Penetration of another’s mind is the acquisition of Arahantship.

original: 385. Channamativassatīti āpattiṃ āpajjitvā paṭicchādento aññaṃ navaṃ āpattiṃ āpajjati🔽idametaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ. Vivaṭaṃ nātivassatīti āpattiṃ āpajjitvā vivaranto aññaṃ
analyzed: channam ativassati iti āpattim āpajjitvā paṭicchādentaḥ aññam navam āpattim āpajjati  idam etam sandhāya vuttam vivaṭam na ativassati iti āpattim āpajjitvā vivarantaḥ aññam
translated: It rains on the hidden: one who commits an offence and conceals it commits another fresh offence.🔽This is what is intended here. It does not rain on the open: one who commits an offence and does not conceal it does not commit another.

original: nāpajjati idametaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ.
analyzed: na āpajjati idam etam sandhāya vuttam
translated: This is what is intended here.

original: Pātimokkhuddesayācanakathā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: pātimokkha uddesa yācana kathā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Discussion of the Request for the Recital of the Pāṭimokkha is ended.

original: Pātimokkhasavanārahakathā
analyzed: pātimokkha savana āraha kathā
translated: The Discussion of Those Deserving to Listen to the Pāṭimokkha

original: 386. Ṭhapitaṃ hoti pātimokkhanti ettha pure vā pacchā vā ṭhapitampi aṭṭhapitaṃ hoti,
analyzed: ṭhapitam hoti ettha pure vā pacchā vā ṭhapitam pi a ṭhapitam hoti
translated: “The Pāṭimokkha is suspended”: whether it is suspended before or after, it is still suspended.

original: khette ṭhapitameva pana ṭhapitaṃ nāma hoti. Tasmā “suṇātu me, bhante saṅgho, ajjuposatho
analyzed: khette ṭhapitam eva pana ṭhapitam nāma hoti tasmā suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ ajjuposatho
translated: But when it is set up in the field, it is then set up.

original: pannaraso, yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho uposathaṃ kareyyā”ti ettha yāva re-kāraṃ🔽bhaṇati, tāva ṭhapetabbaṃ, idañhi khettaṃ. Yya-kāre pana vutte ṭhapentena pacchā
analyzed: pannarasaḥ yadi saṅghassa patta kallam saṅghaḥ uposatham kareyyāti ettha yāva rekāram  bhaṇati tāva ṭhapetabbam idam hi khettam yyakāre pana vutte ṭhapentena pacchā
translated: Therefore, “Venerable sirs, let the Order listen to me. Today is the Uposatha of the fifteenth. If it seems right to the Order, the Order may hold the Uposatha” , as long as he says the syllable re,

original: ṭhapitaṃ nāma hoti. “Suṇātu me”ti anāraddheyeva ṭhapentena pure ṭhapitaṃ hoti.
analyzed: ṭhapitam nāma hoti suṇātu mā iti an āraddheya iva ṭhapet ena pure ṭhapitam hoti
translated: it should be set up, for this is the field. But when he says the syllable yya, if he sets up, it is then set up afterwards. If he sets up before he has even begun with “Let the Order listen to me”, it is then set up before.

original: Pātimokkhasavanārahakathā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: pātimokkha savana āraha kathā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Discussion of the One Worthy to Listen to the Pāṭimokkha is finished.

original: Dhammikādhammikapātimokkhaṭṭhapanakathā🔽387. Amūlikāya sīlavipattiyā pātimokkhaṃ ṭhapeti akatāyāti tena puggalena sā vipatti
analyzed: dhammika adhammika pātimokkha ṭṭhapana kathā  amūlikāya sīla vipattiyā pātimokkham ṭhapeti akatāya ati tena puggalena sā vipatti
translated: The Discussion of the Legality of the Postponement of the Pāṭimokkha

original: katā vā hotu akatā vā, pātimokkhaṭṭhapanakassa saññāamūlikavasena amūlikā hoti. Katākatāyāti
analyzed: katā vā hotu a katā vā pātimokkha ṭṭhapanakassa saññā amūlika vasena amūlikā hoti kata akatāya ati
translated: “He postpones the Pāṭimokkha on the grounds of a failure in morality that is groundless and unconfessed” : whether that failure has been confessed by that person or not, it is groundless for the one who postpones the Pāṭimokkha in virtue of the groundlessness. “Confessed and unconfessed” :

original: katañca akatañca ubhayaṃ gahetvā vuttaṃ.
analyzed: katam ca a katam ca ubhayam gahetvā vuttam
translated: both confessed and unconfessed are taken and mentioned.

original: Dhammikaṃ sāmaggiṃ na upetīti kammaṃ kopetukāmatāya saṅghassa kamme karīyamāne neva
analyzed: dhammikam sāmaggim na upeti iti kammam kopetu kāma tāya saṅghassa kamme karīyamāne na iva
translated: He does not attend on a legitimate legal procedure of a complete assembly: when a legal procedure is being carried out by the Sangha, he does not

original: āgacchati, na chandaṃ deti, sammukhībhūtova paṭikkosati, tena dukkaṭaṃ āpajjati.
analyzed: āgacchati na chandam deti sammukhībhūtaḥ iva paṭikkosati tena dukkaṭam āpajjati
translated: come, he does not give his consent, and he does not express his disagreement face-to-face. He commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: Iccassāpi sāpattikasseva pātimokkhaṃ ṭhapitaṃ hoti. Paccādiyatīti “puna kātabbaṃ🔽kamma”nti paccādiyati, tena ukkoṭanakena pācittiyaṃ āpajjati. Iccassāpi sāpattikasseva
analyzed: iccassa api sa āpattikassa iva pātimokkham ṭhapitam hoti paccādiyati iti puna kātabbam  kammanti paccādiyati tena ukkoṭanakena pācittiyam āpajjati iccassa api sa āpattikassa iva
translated: And his observance-day ceremony is suspended, even though he is present.

original: pātimokkhaṃ ṭhapitaṃ hoti.
analyzed: pātimokkham ṭhapitam hoti
translated: He overturns it: he overturns it, saying, “This legal procedure should be done again.” He commits an offense entailing confession for overturning it. And his observance-day ceremony is suspended, even though he is present.

original: Dhammikādhammikapātimokkhaṭṭhapanakathā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: dhammika adhammika pātimokkha ṭṭhapana kathā niṭṭhitā
translated: The discussion of the legitimate and illegitimate suspension of the observance-day ceremony is finished.

original: Dhammikapātimokkhaṭṭhapanakathā🔽388. Yehi ākārehi yehi liṅgehi yehi nimittehīti ettha maggenamaggapaṭipādanādīsu
analyzed: dhammika pātimokkha ṭṭhapana kathā  yehi ākārehi yehi liṅgehi yehi nimittehi iti ettha maggena magga paṭipādana ādīsu
translated: The discussion of the legitimate suspension of the observance-day ceremony🔽In regard to the words “by whatever act, by whatever sign, by whatever method”: the terms “act”, etc., should be understood as follows.🔽“Act” is the performance of the act of suspension.🔽“Sign” is the announcement of the motion.🔽“Method” is the announcement of the resolution.

original: ākārādisaññā veditabbā. Tena diṭṭhena tena sutena tāya parisaṅkāyāti ettha diṭṭhañca🔽sutañca pāḷiyaṃ āgatameva. Sace pana tehi diṭṭhasutehi parisaṅkaṃ uppādeyya, taṃ
analyzed: ākāra ādi saññā veditabbā tena diṭṭhena tena sutena tāya parisaṅkāya ati ettha diṭṭham ca 🔽sutam ca pāḷiyam āgatam eva sace pana tehi diṭṭha sutehi parisaṅkam uppādeyya tam
translated: “By whatever act, by whatever sign, by whatever method”: by whatever act, by whatever sign, by whatever method the Sangha has suspended the observance-day ceremony, by that very act, by that very sign, by that very method.

original: sandhāya vuttaṃ “tāya parisaṅkāyā”ti.🔽Dhammikapātimokkhaṭṭhapanakathā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sandhāya vuttam tāya parisaṅkāya ati  dhammika pātimokkha ṭṭhapana kathā niṭṭhitā
translated: “Because of that suspicion” is said with reference to that.🔽The Discussion of the Upholding of the Monastic Code According to the Rules is finished.

original: Attādānaaṅgakathā
analyzed: attā ādāna aṅga kathā
translated: The Discussion of the Bases for Settling a Legal Issue

original: 398. Attādānaṃ ādātukāmenāti ettha sāsanaṃ sodhetukāmo bhikkhu yaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ attanā🔽ādiyati, taṃ attādānanti vuccati. Akālo imaṃ attādānaṃ ādātunti ettha rājabhayaṃ
analyzed: attā ādānam ādātu kāmena ati ettha sāsanam sodhetu kāmaḥ bhikkhu yam adhikaraṇam attanā  ādiyati tam attā ādānam ti vuccati akālaḥ imam attā ādānam ādātunti ettha rāja bhayam
translated: One who wants to take up a legal issue: a monk who wants to purify the dispensation takes up a legal issue. That legal issue is called “a legal issue that one has taken up.”

original: corabhayaṃ dubbhikkhabhayaṃ vassārattoti ayaṃ akālo, viparīto kālo.🔽Abhūtaṃ idaṃ attādānanti asantamidaṃ, mayā adhammo vā dhammoti, dhammo vā adhammoti,🔽avinayo vā vinayoti, vinayo vā avinayoti, dussīlo vā puggalo sīlavāti, sīlavā vā
analyzed: cora bhayam dubbhikkha bhayam ayam akālaḥ viparītaḥ kālo  abhūtam idam attā adānan ti asantam idam mayā adhammaḥ vā dhammo ti dhammaḥ vā adhammo iti  avinayaḥ vā vinayo ti vinayaḥ vā avinayo ti dussīlaḥ vā puggalo sīlavā ati sīlavā vā
translated: It’s the wrong time to take up this legal issue: there is danger from kings, danger from bandits, danger from fire, danger from water, danger from humans, danger from spirits.

original: dussīloti gahitoti attho; vipariyāyena bhūtaṃ veditabbaṃ. Anatthasaṃhitaṃ idaṃ attādānanti🔽ettha yaṃ jīvitantarāyāya vā brahmacariyantarāyāya vā saṃvattati, idaṃ anatthasaṃhitaṃ,
analyzed: dussīlaḥ ti gahitaḥ iti atthaḥ vipariyāyena bhūtam veditabbam anattha saṃhitam idam attā ādānam ti 🔽ettha yam jīvita antarāyāya vā brahmacariya antarāyāya vā saṃvattati idam anattha saṃhitam
translated: This legal issue is groundless: this is non-existent, taken up by me as illegitimate or legitimate, as illegitimate or legitimate, as non-Dhamma or Dhamma, as Dhamma or non-Dhamma, as non-discipline or discipline, as discipline or non-discipline, as a person who is not a good speaker or a person who is a good speaker, as a person who is a good speaker or a person who is not a good speaker. The opposite of this is “grounded”.🔽This legal issue is unbeneficial: it leads to harm and suffering, to despair and to bondage.🔽This legal issue is beneficial: it leads to benefit and happiness, to non-despair and to release.

original: viparītaṃ atthasaṃhitaṃ nāma.🔽Na labhissāmi sandiṭṭhe sambhatte bhikkhūti appekadā hi rājabhayādīsu evarūpā attano
analyzed: viparītam atthasaṃhitam nāma  na labhissāmi sandiṭṭhe sambhatte bhikkhū iti appa ekadā hi rāja bhaya ādīsu evarūpāḥ attanaḥ
translated: The opposite is called “beneficial.”

original: pakkhassa upatthambhakā bhikkhū laddhuṃ na sakkā honti, taṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ “na labhissāmī”ti.
analyzed: pakkhassa upatthambhakāḥ bhikkhū laddhum na sakkāḥ honti tam sandhāya vuttam na labhissāmi iti
translated: “I shall not get bhikkhus who are upright and wish for training”: sometimes, in such circumstances as danger from kings, etc., it is not possible to get bhikkhus of this kind to support one’s faction. That is why it is said, “I shall not get.”

original: Appekadā pana khemasubhikkhādīsu laddhuṃ sakkā honti, taṃ sandhāya “labhissāmī”ti vuttaṃ.🔽Bhavissati saṅghassa tatonidānaṃ bhaṇḍananti kosambakānaṃ viya bhaṇḍanaṃ kalaho viggaho
analyzed: appekadā pana khema subhikkha ādīsu laddhum sakkāḥ honti tam sandhāya labhissāmi iti vuttam  bhavissati saṅghassa tatonidānam bhaṇḍanan ti kosambakānam viya bhaṇḍanam kalahaḥ viggahaḥ
translated: But sometimes it is possible to get them, as in the case of Khema, Subhadda, etc. That is why it is said, “I shall get.”

original: vivādo saṅghabhedo ca bhavissatīti. Pacchāpi avippaṭisārakaraṃ bhavissatīti subhaddaṃ
analyzed: vivādaḥ saṅgha bhedo ca bhavissati iti pacchā api a vippaṭisāra karam bhavissati iti su bhaddam
translated: “There will be a dispute in the Order on account of it”: there will be a dispute, a quarrel, a difference, a schism in the Order, as in the case of the Kosambī monks.

original: vuḍḍhapabbajitaṃ niggahetvā pañcasatikasaṅgītiṃ karontassa mahākassapattherasseva,
analyzed: vuḍḍha pabbajitam niggahetvā pañca satika saṅgītim karontassa mahākassapa therassa iva
translated: “There will be no regret afterwards”: as in the case of the Elder Mahā Kassapa, who, after he had suspended the monk Subhadda, held the Council of the Elders with five hundred bhikkhus.

original: dasavatthuke adhikaraṇe dasabhikkhusahassāni niggahetvā sattasatikasaṅgītiṃ karontassa
analyzed: dasa vatthuke adhikaraṇe dasa bhikkhu sahassāni niggahetvā sattasatika saṅgītim karontassa
translated: And as in the case of the Elder Tissa, who, after he had suspended ten thousand bhikkhus in the ten dwelling places, held the Council of the Elders with seven hundred bhikkhus.

original: āyasmato yasasseva, saṭṭhibhikkhusahassāni niggahetvā sahassikasaṅgītiṃ karontassa
analyzed: āyasmataḥ yasassa iva saṭṭhi bhikkhu sahassāni niggahetvā sahassika saṅgītim karontassa
translated: and the six hundred thousand bhikkhus who were expelled by the venerable Yasa and the recitation of the True Dhamma in the First Great Rehearsal,

original: moggaliputtatissattherasseva ca pacchā samanussaraṇakaraṇaṃ hoti, sāsanassa ca vigatupakkilesacandimasūriyasassirikatāya saṃvattati.
analyzed: moggaliputta tissa therassa iva ca pacchā samanussaraṇa karaṇam hoti sāsanassa ca vigata upakkilesa candima sūriya sassirikatāya saṃvattati
translated: and the subsequent recollection by the Elder Moggaliputtatissa, and the True Dhamma’s becoming like the moon’s disk when it is full and clear.

original: Attādānaaṅgakathā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: atta ādāna aṅga kathā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the “taking up again” is ended.

original: Codakenapaccavekkhitabbadhammakathā

original: gihīnaṃ gaṇḍaphālanādīni vejjakammāni vā katāni, tassa kāyasamācāro upacikāhi khāyitatālapaṇṇamiva

original: chiddo ca paṭimāsituṃ yattha katthaci gahetvā ākaḍḍhituṃ sakkuṇeyyatāya sappaṭimaṃso
analyzed: chiddo ca paṭimāsitum yattha katthaci gahetvā ākaḍḍhitum sakkuṇeyya tāya sa paṭimaṃsaḥ

original: ca hoti, viparīto acchiddo appaṭimaṃsoti veditabboti. Vacīsamācāro pana musāvādaomasavādapesuññaamūlakānuddhaṃsanādīhi
analyzed: ca hoti viparītaḥ acchiddaḥ appaṭimaṃso ti veditabbo ti vacī samācāraḥ pana musāvāda omasavāda pesuñña amūlaka anuddhaṃsana ādīhi
translated: The opposite kind should be understood as “without a cleft” and “without flesh to mend it.” But his verbal conduct is “with a cleft” and “with flesh to mend it” in that it can be grasped anywhere and pulled apart by means of lying, malicious tale-bearing, and gossip,

original: chiddo ca sappaṭimaṃso ca hoti, viparīto acchiddo appaṭimaṃso.
analyzed: chiddaḥ ca sa paṭimaṃsaḥ ca hoti viparītaḥ acchiddaḥ appaṭimaṃso
translated: He is one who has cut off and has a counterpart. The opposite is one who has not cut off and has no counterpart.

original: Mettaṃ nu kho me cittanti palibodhe chinditvā kammaṭṭhānabhāvanānuyogena adhigataṃ
analyzed: nu kho me cittam ti palibodhe chinditvā kammaṭṭhāna bhāvanā anuyogena adhigatam
translated: ‘Is my mind full of loving-kindness?’—having cut off the hindrance, he has attained loving-kindness of mind by undertaking the development of the meditation subject.

original: mettacittaṃ. Anāghātanti āghātavirahitaṃ, vikkhambhanavasena vihatāghātanti attho.
analyzed: metta cittam anāghātam ti āghāta virahitam vikkhambhana vasena vihata āghātam ti attho
translated: ‘Without ill-will’ means without annoyance. The meaning is: having dispelled annoyance by suppression.

original: Idaṃ panāvuso kattha vuttaṃ bhagavatāti idaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ katarasmiṃ nagare vuttanti attho.
analyzed: idam pana āvuso kattha vuttam bhagavatā ati idam sikkhāpadam katarasmim nagare vuttanti attho

analyzed: ca udakena upaṭṭhāpetabba kathā  kālena vakkhāmi iti ādīsu ekaḥ ekam okāsam kāretvā codentaḥ kālena vadati nāma

original: 402. Bhikkhunikkhandhake – alaṃ gotami mā te ruccīti kasmā paṭikkhipati, nanu sabbesampi🔽buddhānaṃ catasso parisā hontīti? Kāmaṃ honti, kilametvā pana anekakkhattuṃ yācitena
analyzed: bhikkhu nikkhandhake alam gotami mā te rucci iti kasmā paṭikkhipati nanu sabbesam pi  buddhānam catasso parisāḥ honti iti kāmam honti kilametvā pana aneka khattum yācitena
translated: In the Bhikkhunī Khandhaka, why did he refuse when she said, “It is enough, Gotami, do not delight in that”? Did not all the Buddhas have four assemblies?

original: anuññātaṃ pabbajjaṃ “dukkhena laddhā ayaṃ amhehī”ti sammā paripālessantīti bhaddakaṃ
analyzed: anuññātam pabbajjam dukkhena laddhā ayam amhehi iti sammā paripālessanti iti bhaddakam
translated: Though they did have them, he refused because he wanted to allow the going forth after making it excellent, thinking, “This going forth, which was allowed after she asked many times and was troublesome, will be properly maintained by us, having been obtained with difficulty.”

original: katvā anujānitukāmo paṭikkhipati. Aṭṭhagarudhammakathā mahāvibhaṅgeyeva kathitā.
analyzed: katvā anujānitu kāmo paṭikkhipati aṭṭha garu dhamma kathā kathitā
translated: The explanation of the eight serious rules is given in the Mahavibhanga.

original: 403. Kumbhathenakehīti kumbhe dīpaṃ jāletvā tena ālokena paraghare bhaṇḍaṃ vicinitvā thenakacorehi.
analyzed: kumbha thenakehi iti kumbhe dīpam jāletvā tena ālokena para ghare bhaṇḍam vicinitvā thenaka corehi
translated: “With pot-thieves” : having lit a lamp in a pot, they searched for goods in other people’s houses by its light, like thieves.

original: Setaṭṭhikā nāma rogajātīti eko pāṇako nāḷimajjhagataṃ kaṇḍaṃ vijjhati, yena viddhattā nikkhantampi sālisīsaṃ khīraṃ gahetuṃ na sakkoti.🔽Mañjiṭṭhikā nāma rogajātīti ucchūnaṃ antorattabhāvo. Mahato taḷākassa paṭikacceva
analyzed: setaṭṭhikā nāma roga jātī iti ekaḥ pāṇakaḥ nāḷi majjha gatam kaṇḍam vijjhati yena viddhattā nikkhantam pi sāli sīsam khīram gahetum na sakkoti 🔽mañjiṭṭhikā nāma roga jātī iti ucchūnam antoratta bhāvaḥ mahato taḷākassa paṭikaccā iva
translated: “White-bone disease” : a kind of disease. A worm pierces the grain in the middle of the stalk, and because of that the rice-grain is unable to take up sap when it comes out.🔽“Red-berry disease” : a swelling inside the body.

original: āḷinti iminā pana etamatthaṃ dasseti – yathā mahato taḷākassa āḷiyā abaddhāyapi kiñci
analyzed: āḷinti iminā pana etam attham dasseti yathā mahataḥ taḷākassa āḷiyā kiñci
translated: By this he shows the meaning of “bank” in the way stated in the passage beginning, “Even though the bank of a great lake is not bound with anything … ” .

original: udakaṃ tiṭṭheyya, paṭhamameva baddhāya pana yaṃ abaddhapaccayā na tiṭṭheyya, tampi
analyzed: udakam tiṭṭheyya paṭhamam eva baddhāya pana yam abaddha paccayā na tiṭṭheyya tam pi
translated: By this he shows the meaning in this way: Just as if the embankment of a great lake were not closed, some water would remain, but if it were closed from the beginning, that which would remain by reason of the non-closing would remain;

analyzed: tiṭṭheyya evam eva ye ime anuppanne vatthusmim paṭikacca iva a vītikkamana tthāya garu dhammā  paññattā tesu a paññattesu pi mātugāmassa pabbajita ttā pañca iva vassa satāni saddhammo
translated: even so, these rules of training which were laid down for the purpose of non-transgression even before the occasion for them arose,
