analyzed: tiṭṭheyya paṭikaccā iva paññatta ttā pana aparāni pi pañca vassa satāni evam  paṭhamam vuttam vassa sahassam eva ṭhassati iti ca itam paṭisambhidā apabheda patta khīṇa āsava vasena iva
translated: if they were not laid down, the True Idea would remain for five hundred years only because of the going forth of women. But because they were laid down even before the occasion for them arose, it will remain for another five hundred years. Thus

analyzed: vuttam tatas pana uttarim pi sukkha vipassaka khīṇāsava vasena vassa sahassam anāgāmi vasena

But after that, for another thousand years in the case of those who have destroyed the cankers but are dry-insight workers, and for another🔽thousand years in the case of non-returners.

original: pañcavassasahassāni paṭivedhasaddhammo ṭhassati. Pariyattidhammopi tāniyeva. Na hi

analyzed: anujānāmi bhikkhave bhikkhūhi bhikkhuniyaḥ upasampādetun ti imāya anupaññattiyā

analyzed: anujānāmi bhikkhave bhikkhūhi bhikkhunīnam kammam ropetvā niyyādetun ti ettha  tajjanīya ādīsu idam nāma kammam etissā kātabbanti evam ropetvā tam dāni tumhā iva  karotha ati niyyādetabbam sace pana aññasmin ropite aññam karonti

translated: having charged them, saying, “This legal procedure should be done against her,” you should send them away, saying, “Now you should do it.” But if they do something else after charging something else, then they commit an offense entailing suspension, as stated in the rule on the legal procedure of demotion.

original: yena kenaci osiñcantassa dukkaṭameva. Avandiyo so bhikkhave bhikkhu bhikkhunisaṅghena
analyzed: yena kenacid osiñcantassa dukkaṭam eva a vandiyaḥ saḥ bhikkhave bhikkhu bhikkhuni saṅghena

analyzed: kātabbaḥ ti bhikkhuni passaye sannipatitvā asukaḥ nāma ayyaḥ bhikkhunīnam apasādanīyam

analyzed: dasseti etassa ayyassa a vandiya karaṇam ruccati iti evam tikkhattum sāvetabbam ettāvatā  a vandiyaḥ kataḥ hoti tatas paṭṭhāya yathā sāmaṇere disvā na vandanti evam eva disvā api

original: na vanditabbo. Tena bhikkhunā sammā vattantena bhikkhunupassayaṃ āgantvā vihāreyeva

analyzed: bhikkhuni saṅghaḥ mayham khamatu uti khamāpetabbam tena bhikkhunā bhikkhunīnam santikam
translated: and say, “May the Sangha of nuns forgive me.”🔽That monk should then go to the nuns and say, “This monk is asking for your forgiveness.”

analyzed: saṅkhepaḥ vitthāram pana kamma vibhaṅge vakkhāma 🔽obhāsenti iti asat dhammena obhāsenti bhikkhunīhi saddhim sampayojenti iti bhikkhunīhi

analyzed: kālam karoti tassāḥ parikkhāraḥ bhikkhunīnam yeva hoti  purāṇa mallī iti purāṇe gihi kāle mallakassa bhariyā purisa byañjanam ti purisa nimittam  chinnam vā hotu a chinnam vā paṭicchannam vā appaṭicchannam vā sace etasmin ṭhāne

analyzed: attano paribhoga tthāya dinnam nāma yam tumheya iva paribhuñjatha ati vatvā dinnam

original: taṃ aññassa dadato dukkaṭaṃ. Aggaṃ gahetvā pana dātuṃ vaṭṭati. Sace asappāyaṃ, sabbaṃ
analyzed: tam aññassa dadataḥ dukkaṭam aggam gahetvā pana dātum vaṭṭati sace asappāyam sabbam
translated: If he gives it to someone else, there is an offense of wrong conduct. But it is allowable to give it after taking the best part. If it is not suitable,

original: apanetuṃ vaṭṭati. Cīvaraṃ ekāhaṃ vā dvīhaṃ vā paribhuñjitvā dātuṃ vaṭṭati. Pattādīsupi eseva nayo.
analyzed: apanetum vaṭṭati cīvaram eka aham vā dvi iham vā paribhuñjitvā dātum vaṭṭati patta ādīsu pi esa eva nayaḥ
translated: it is allowable to remove all of it. It is allowable to give it after using the robe for one or two days. The same applies to the bowl, etc.

original: Bhikkhūnaṃ sannidhiṃ bhikkhunīhi paṭiggāhāpetvāti hiyyo paṭiggahetvā ṭhapitamaṃsaṃ
analyzed: bhikkhūnam sannidhim bhikkhunīhi paṭiggāhāpetvā ati hiyyo paṭiggahetvā ṭhapita maṃsam
translated: “Having had the nuns receive it in the presence of the monks”: Meat that was received the previous day and then stored

original: ajja aññasmiṃ anupasampanne asati bhikkhūhi paṭiggāhāpetvā bhikkhunīhi paribhuñjitabbaṃ.🔽Bhikkhūhi paṭiggahitañhi bhikkhunīnaṃ appaṭiggahitakaṭṭhāne tiṭṭhati, bhikkhunīnaṃ
analyzed: ajja aññasmin an upasampanne asati bhikkhūhi paṭiggāhāpetvā bhikkhunīhi paribhuñjitabbam  bhikkhūhi paṭiggahitam hi bhikkhunīnam a paṭiggahitaka ṭṭhāne tiṭṭhati bhikkhunīnam
translated: should be used by the nuns after having the monks receive it on that day, provided there is no one else who is not fully ordained.🔽For what has been received by the monks is not to be received again by the nuns.

original: paṭiggahitampi bhikkhūsu eseva nayo.
analyzed: paṭiggahitam pi bhikkhūsu esa iva nayo
translated: And what has been received by the nuns is not to be received again by the monks.

original: 426. Āsanaṃ saṃkasāyantiyo kālaṃ vītināmesunti aññaṃ vuṭṭhāpetvā aññaṃ nisīdāpentiyo bhojanakālaṃ atikkāmesuṃ.
analyzed: āsanam saṃkasāyantiyaḥ kālam vītināmesunti aññam vuṭṭhāpetvā aññam nisīdāpentiyaḥ bhojana kālam atikkāmesuṃ
translated: “They spent the time moving the seats around”: They spent the mealtime by having one person sit down after another.

original: Aṭṭhannaṃ bhikkhunīnaṃ yathāvuḍḍhanti ettha sace pure aṭṭhasu nisinnāsu tāsaṃ abbhantarimā
analyzed: aṭṭhannam bhikkhunīnam ettha sace pure aṭṭhasu nisinnāsu tāsam abbhantarimā
translated: “Of the eight nuns according to seniority”: If eight are sitting down, then the one among them who has the longest time as a nun

original: aññā āgacchati, sā attano navakaṃ uṭṭhāpetvā nisīdituṃ labhati. Yā pana aṭṭhahipi
analyzed: aññā āgacchati sā attanaḥ navakam uṭṭhāpetvā nisīditum labhati yā pana
translated: If another comes, she should get up and let her sit down. But if she is younger than the other by eight or more years, she should not get up for her.

original: navakatarā, sā sacepi saṭṭhivassā hoti, āgatapaṭipāṭiyāva nisīdituṃ labhati. Aññattha
analyzed: navakatarā sā sace pi saṭṭhivassā hoti āgata paṭipāṭiyā āva nisīditum labhati aññattha
translated: If she is younger by less than eight years, she should get up for her, even if she is sixty years old.

original: sabbattha yathāvuḍḍhaṃ na paṭibāhitabbanti ṭhapetvā bhattaggaṃ aññasmiṃ catupaccayabhājanīyaṭṭhāne
analyzed: sabbattha yathāvuḍḍham na paṭibāhitabbanti ṭhapetvā bhattaggam aññasmim catu paccaya bhājanīya ṭṭhāne
translated: Everywhere else, according to seniority: except at the meal hall, in any place where requisites are distributed,

original: “ahaṃ pubbe āgatā”ti vuḍḍhaṃ paṭibāhitvā kiñci na gahetabbaṃ; yathāvuḍḍhameva vaṭṭati.🔽Pavāraṇākathā kathitāyeva.
analyzed: aham pubbe āgatā ati vuḍḍham paṭibāhitvā kiñci na gahetabbam yathāvuḍḍham eva vaṭṭati  pavāraṇā kathā kathitāya iva
translated: she should not prevent a more senior nun from going ahead of her by saying, “I came first.” She should go according to seniority.🔽The invitation ceremony has already been explained.

original: 429. Itthiyuttantiādīhi sabbayānāni anuññātāni. Pāṭaṅkinti paṭapoṭṭalikaṃ.
analyzed: itthi yutta nti ādīhi sabba yānāni anuññātāni pāṭaṅkinti paṭa poṭṭalikam
translated: “In connection with a woman” and so on refer to all the kinds of consent. “A patchwork” means a patchwork robe.🔽The full ordination by messenger: any of the ten obstructions is allowable.

original: 430. Dūtena upasampadā dasannaṃ antarāyānaṃ yena kenaci vaṭṭati. Kammavācāpariyosāne
analyzed: dūtena upasampadā antarāyānam yena kenaci vaṭṭati kamma vācā pariyosāne
translated: At the end of the last announcement,

original: sā bhikkhunī bhikkhunupassaye ṭhitā vā hotu nipannā vā jāgarā vā niddaṃ okkantā vā,
analyzed: sā bhikkhunī bhikkhunu passaye ṭhitā vā hotu nipannā vā jāgarā vā niddam okkantā vā
translated: that nun is fully ordained, whether she is standing, lying down, awake, or asleep.

original: upasampannāva hoti. Tāvadeva chāyādīni āgatāya dūtabhikkhuniyā ācikkhitabbāni.
analyzed: upasampannā ava hoti tāvat eva chāyā ādīni āgatāya dūta bhikkhuniyā ācikkhitabbāni
translated: The shadow and so on should be announced to the messenger nun by the one who invited her.

original: 431. Udositoti bhaṇḍasālā. Na sammatīti nappahoti. Upassayanti gharaṃ. Navakammanti saṅghassatthāya bhikkhuniyā navakammampi kātuṃ anujānāmīti attho.
analyzed: udosito ti bhaṇḍasālā na sammatīti nappahoti upassayanti gharam nava kammanti saṅghassa atthāya bhikkhuniyāḥ nava kammam pi kātum anujānāmi iti attho
translated: ‘Storehouse’: a storehouse for goods. ‘Is not allowed’: is not able. ‘Dwelling’: a house. ‘New work’: the meaning is, I allow a nun to do new work for the benefit of the Sangha.

original: 432. Tassā pabbajitāyāti tassā pabbajitakāle. Yāva so dārako viññutaṃ pāpuṇātīti yāva khādituṃ bhuñjituṃ nahāyituñca maṇḍituñca attano dhammatāya sakkotīti attho.
analyzed: tassā pabbajitāya ati tassā pabbajita kāle yāva saḥ dārakaḥ viññu tam pāpuṇāti iti yāva khāditum bhuñjitum nahāyitum ca maṇḍitum ca attanaḥ dhamma tāya sakkoti iti attho
translated: ‘When she has gone forth’: at the time when she has gone forth. ‘Until that child has reached discernment’: the meaning is, until he is able to eat, drink, bathe, and anoint himself by himself.

original: Ṭhapetvā sāgāranti sahagāraseyyamattaṃ ṭhapetvā. Yathā aññasmiṃ purise; evaṃ dutiyikāya
analyzed: ṭhapetvā sahagāraseyya mattam ṭhapetvā yathā aññasmin purise evam dutiyikāya
translated: ‘Except for a dwelling’: except for sleeping in the same room. As with another man, so with a second nun.

original: bhikkhuniyā tasmiṃ dārake paṭipajjitabbanti dasseti. Mātā pana nahāpetuṃ pāyetuṃ
analyzed: bhikkhuniyā tasmin dārake paṭipajjitabbanti dasseti mātā pana nahāpetum pāyetum
translated: This is how it should be done with that child. But the mother is allowed to bathe him, to feed him,

original: bhojetuṃ maṇḍetuṃ ure katvā sayituñca labhati.
analyzed: bhojetum maṇḍetum ure katvā sayitum ca labhati
translated: to breastfeed him, and to sleep with him in her arms.

original: 434. Yadeva sā vibbhantāti yasmā sā vibbhantā attano ruciyā khantiyā odātāni vatthāni
analyzed: yat eva sā vibbhantā ati yasmai sā vibbhantā attanaḥ ruciyā khantiyā odātāni vatthāni
translated: ‘Whatever she is wearing’: because she has gone forth, she is wearing the white robes

original: nivatthā, tasmāyeva sā abhikkhunī, na sikkhāpaccakkhānenāti dasseti. Sā puna upasampadaṃ na labhati.
analyzed: nivatthā sā abhikkhunī na sikkhā paccakkhānena ati dasseti sā puna upasampadam na labhati
translated: she is not disavowed by the formal procedure of demotion. She does not get re-admittance.

original: Sā āgatā na upasampādetabbāti na kevalaṃ na upasampādetabbā, pabbajjampi na labhati. Odātāni gahetvā vibbhantā pana pabbajjāmattaṃ labhati.
analyzed: sā āgatā na upasampādetabbā ati na kevalam na upasampādetabbā pabbajjam pi na labhati odātāni gahetvā vibbhantā pana pabbajjā mattam labhati
translated: When she has come, she should not be given the full ordination: not only should she not be given the full ordination, she should not be given the going forth either. But if she goes forth after taking on white robes, she is allowed the going forth.

original: Abhivādanantiādīsu purisā pāde sambāhantā vandanti, kese chindanti, nakhe chindanti,
analyzed: purisā pāde sambāhantā vandanti kese chindanti nakhe chindanti
translated: In the case of paying respect, etc., men pay respect by touching the feet, by cutting the hair, by cutting the nails,

original: vaṇapaṭikammaṃ karonti, taṃ sabbaṃ kukkuccāyantā na sādiyantīti attho. Tatreke ācariyā
analyzed: vaṇa paṭikammam karonti tat sabbam kukkuccāyantā na sādiyanti iti tatra eke ācariyā
translated: and by treating wounds. The meaning is that, being scrupulous, she does not consent to any of this. Herein, some teachers say that

original: “sace ekato vā ubhato vā avassutā honti sārattā, yathāvatthukameva”. Eke ācariyā🔽“natthi ettha āpattī”ti vadanti. Evaṃ ācariyavādaṃ dassetvā idaṃ odissa anuññātaṃ
analyzed: sace ekatas vā ubhatas vā avassutāḥ honti sārattāḥ yathāvatthukam eva eke ācariyā  natthi ettha āpatti iti vadanti evam ācariya vādam dassetvā idam odissa anuññātam
translated: if both are lustful and desirous, it is according to the facts of the case. Other teachers say that🔽there is no offense here. After showing the teachers’ opinions in this way, it is said in the commentaries that what is allowed here is proper.

original: vaṭṭatīti aṭṭhakathāsu vuttaṃ. Taṃ pamāṇaṃ. “Anujānāmi bhikkhave sāditu”nti hi vacaneneva taṃ kappiyaṃ.
analyzed: vaṭṭati iti aṭṭhakathāsu vuttam tam pamāṇam anujānāmi bhikkhave sāditun ti hi vacanena iva tam kappiyam
translated: That is the standard. For it is proper by the mere statement, “I allow you, monks, to consent.”

original: 435. Pallaṅkena nisīdantīti pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā nisīdanti. Aḍḍhapallaṅkanti ekaṃ
analyzed: pallaṅkena nisīdanti iti pallaṅkam ābhujitvā nisīdanti ekam
translated: “Sitting cross-legged”: sitting with the legs crossed. “Half-cross-legged”:

original: pādaṃ ābhujitvā katapallaṅkaṃ. Heṭṭhā vivaṭe upari paṭicchanneti ettha sace kūpo🔽khato hoti, upari pana padaramattameva sabbadisāsu paññāyati, evarūpepi vaṭṭati.
analyzed: pādam ābhujitvā kata pallaṅkam heṭṭhā vivaṭe upari paṭicchannā iti ettha sace kūpaḥ  khataḥ hoti upari pana padara mattam eva sabba disāsu paññāyati evarūpe pi vaṭṭati
translated: “Sitting cross-legged”: sitting with legs crossed. “Half-cross-legged”: sitting with one leg crossed. “Open below, closed above”: if a well has been dug, but only a foot is visible above ground, it is allowable in such a case.

original: 436. Kukkusaṃ mattikanti kuṇḍakañceva mattikañca. Sesamettha uttānamevāti.
analyzed: kukkusam mattikanti kuṇḍakam ca iva mattikam ca sesam ettha uttānam eva ati
translated: “A clay bowl”: a broken bowl and clay. The rest is self-evident.

original: Bhikkhunīupasampadānujānanakathā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: bhikkhunī upasampadā anujānana kathā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Discussion of the Allowance of the Full Admission of Nuns is finished.

original: Bhikkhunikkhandhakavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: bhikkhunikkhandhaka vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Commentary on the Chapter on Nuns is finished.

original: 11. Pañcasatikakkhandhakaṃ
analyzed: pañcasatika khandhakam
translated: The Chapter on the Five Hundred

original: Khuddānukhuddakasikkhāpadakathā🔽441. Pañcasatikakkhandhake – cattāri pārājikāni ṭhapetvā avasesāni khuddānukhuddakānīti
analyzed: khuddānukhuddaka sikkhāpada kathā  pañcasatika khandhake cattāri pārājikāni ṭhapetvā avasesāni khudda anukhuddakāni iti
translated: The Explanation of the Training Rules in the Chapter on Minor Points

original: evamādi ekasikkhāpadampi apariccajitvā sabbesaṃ saṅgahetabbabhāvadassanatthaṃ pariyāyena
analyzed: evamādi eka sikkhāpadam pi a pariccajitvā sabbesam saṅgahetabba bhāva dassana ttham pariyāyena
translated: In the Chapter on the Five Hundred, the words “apart from the four offenses entailing expulsion” are said in order to show that all the rest should be included, without exception, even if it is only one training rule.

original: vuttaṃ. Idaṃ vo samaṇānanti idaṃ samaṇānaṃ. Padapūraṇamatte vokāro.
analyzed: vuttam idam vaḥ samaṇānam ti idam samaṇānam pada pūraṇa matte vokāraḥ
translated: “This is for you, monks”: this is for monks.

original: 443. Idampi te āvuso ānanda dukkaṭanti “idaṃ tayā duṭṭhu kata”nti kevalaṃ garahantehi🔽therehi vuttaṃ, na āpattiṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ. Na hi te āpattānāpattiṃ na jānanti. Idāneva
analyzed: idam pi te āvuso ānanda dukkaṭa nti idam tayā duṭṭhu kata nti kevalam gara hantehi  therehi vuttam na āpattim sandhāya vuttam na hi te āpatta anāpattim na jānanti idānā iva
translated: This too is a misdeed on your part, friend Ananda” is said by the elders who are reproving him, saying “This has been badly done by you,”🔽not with reference to an offence. For they do not not know what is and is not an offence. Just now

original: cetaṃ anussāvitaṃ – “saṅgho apaññattaṃ na paññapeti, paññattaṃ na samucchindatī”ti.
analyzed: cetam anussāvitam saṅghaḥ a paññattam na paññapeti paññattam na samucchindati iti
translated: this was recited by them: “The Order does not originate what has not been originated, nor does it abolish what has been originated.”

original: Desehi taṃ dukkaṭanti idampi ca “āma, bhante, duṭṭhu mayā kata”nti evaṃ paṭijānāhi,🔽taṃ dukkaṭanti idaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ, na āpattidesanaṃ. Thero pana yasmā asatiyā na
analyzed: desehi tam dukkaṭanti idam pi ca āma bhante duṭṭhu mayā katanti evam paṭijānāhi  tat dukkaṭam ti idam sandhāya vuttam na āpatti desanam thero pana yasmai asatiyā na
translated: “Confess that misdeed” is said with reference to “Yes, reverend sirs, it has been badly done by me,”🔽and not with reference to the confession of an offence. But since the elder did not ask through disrespect,

original: pucchi na anādarena, tasmā tattha duṭṭhukatabhāvampi asallakkhento “nāhaṃ taṃ dukkaṭaṃ
analyzed: pucchi na anādarena tasmā tattha duṭṭhukata bhāvam pi a sallakkhentaḥ na aham tam dukkaṭam
translated: therefore, not considering whether there was a misdeed there or not, he said “I do not see that misdeed,”

original: passāmī”ti vatvā theresu gāravaṃ dassento “apicāyasmantānaṃ sandhāya desemi taṃ dukkaṭa”nti
analyzed: passāmi iti vatvā theresu gāravam dassentaḥ apica ayasmantānam sandhāya desemi tam dukkaṭam ti
translated: and showing respect for the elders he said “Nevertheless, reverend sirs, I confess that misdeed with reference to you.”

original: āha. Yathā tumhe vadatha, tathā paṭijānāmīti vuttaṃ hoti. Eseva nayo avasesesu catūsu
analyzed: āha yathā tumhe vadatha tathā paṭijānāmi iti vuttam hoti esa iva nayaḥ avasesesu catūsu
translated: What is meant is that he admits it in accordance with what they say. The same method applies in the case of the remaining four.

original: ṭhānesu. Sesamettha yaṃ vattabbaṃ siyā, taṃ nidānavaṇṇanāyameva vuttaṃ.
analyzed: ṭhānesu sesam ettha yat vattabbam siyā tat nidāna vaṇṇanāyam eva vuttam
translated: The rest of what should be said here has already been said in the commentary on the origin story.

original: Khuddānukhuddakasikkhāpadakathā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: khuddānukhuddaka sikkhāpada kathā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the training rules in the chapter on minor matters is finished.

original: Pañcasatikakkhandhakavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽12. Sattasatikakkhandhakaṃ
analyzed: pañcasatika khandhaka vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  sattasatika khandhakam
translated: The commentary on the chapter on five hundred is finished.🔽The chapter on seven hundred

original: Dasavatthukathā
analyzed: dasavatthukathā
translated: The explanation of the ten topics

original: 446. Sattasatikakkhandhake – bhikkhaggenāti bhikkhuaggena, bhikkhū gaṇetvā tattake paṭivīse ṭhapesunti attho. Mahiyāti himapātasamaye himavalāhakā.
analyzed: sattasatika khandhake bhikkhu aggena ati bhikkhu aggena bhikkhū gaṇetvā tattake paṭivīse ṭhapesunti attho mahiyā iti hima pāta samaye hima valāhakā
translated: In the chapter on seven hundred: with a monk as leader means with a monk as leader, having counted the monks, he placed them in groups of seven. On the ground means like a cloud of snow at the time of snowfall.

original: 447. Avijjānivuṭāti avijjāpaṭicchannā. Posāti purisā. Piyarūpaṃ abhinandanti patthentīti
analyzed: avijjā nivuṭā ati avijjā paṭicchannā posā ati purisā piya rūpam abhinandanti patthenti iti
translated: Covered by ignorance means concealed by ignorance. Men means human beings. They delight in and long for what is likable.

original: piyarūpābhinandino. Aviddasūti avijānantā. Rāgarajehi sarajā. Magasadisāti magā.
analyzed: piya rūpa abhinandinaḥ a vijānantāḥ rāga rajehi sa rajāḥ maga sadisā ati magāḥ
translated: Those who delight in what is likable are ignorant. They are full of passion, full of greed. Like a road means like a road.

original: Saha nettiyāti sanettikā. Vaḍḍhenti kaṭasinti punappunaṃ kaḷevaraṃ nikkhipamānā bhūmiṃ
analyzed: saha nettiyā ati sa nettikāḥ vaḍḍhenti kaṭasinti punappunam kaḷevaram nikkhipamānāḥ bhūmim
translated: With guidance means with guidance. They increase the earth means they increase the earth by repeatedly laying down corpses.

original: vaḍḍhenti. Evaṃ vaḍḍhentāva ghoraṃ ādiyanti punabbhavaṃ.
analyzed: vaḍḍhenti evam vaḍḍhenta ava ghoram ādiyanti punarbhavam
translated: Increasing in this way, they take up the terrible rebirth.

original: 454. Pāpakaṃ no āvuso katanti āvuso amhehi pāpakaṃ katanti attho.
analyzed: pāpakam no āvuso katanti āvuso amhehi pāpakam katanti attho
translated: “We have done what is evil, friend”: the meaning is, “We have done what is bad, friend.”

original: 455. Katamena tvaṃ bhūmi vihārenāti ettha bhūmīti piyavacanametaṃ. Piyaṃ vattukāmo kira āyasmā sabbakāmī navake bhikkhū evaṃ āmanteti. Kullakavihārenāti uttānavihārena.
analyzed: katamena tvam bhūmi vihārena ati ettha bhūmi iti piya vacanam etam piyam vattu kāmo kira āyasmā sabbakāmī navake bhikkhū evam āmanteti kullaka vihārena ati uttāna vihārena
translated: “What kind of dwelling place do you live in?”: here “dwelling place” is a term for a pleasant place. The venerable Sabbakāmī, it seems, wanted to speak pleasantly to the newly arrived monks, so he asked them this. “A low-lying place”: a place that is damp.

original: 457. Sāvatthiyā suttavibhaṅgeti kathaṃ suttavibhaṅge paṭikkhittaṃ hoti? Tatra hi
analyzed: sāvatthiyā sutta vibhaṅge iti katham sutta vibhaṅge paṭikkhittam hoti tatra hi
translated: “The Sutta Vibhaṅga at Sāvatthī”: how is it prohibited in the Sutta Vibhaṅga? For there,

original: “sannidhi nāma ajja paṭiggahitaṃ aparajjū”ti vatvā puna “sannidhikārake asannidhikārakasaññī
analyzed: sannidhi nāma ajja paṭiggahitam aparajju iti vatvā puna sannidhi kārake a sannidhi kāraka saññī
translated: after saying, “The storing is the storing on the next day of what is received on that day,” it is said:

original: khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā khādati vā bhuñjati vā āpatti pācittiyassā”ti āpattiṃ🔽vadantena paṭikkhittaṃ hoti. Tatreke maññanti “yo pana bhikkhu sannidhikārakaṃ khādanīyaṃ
analyzed: khādanīyam vā bhojanīyam vā khādati vā bhuñjati vā āpatti pācittiyassa ati āpattim  vadantena paṭikkhittam hoti tatra eke maññanti yaḥ pana bhikkhu sannidhi kārakam khādanīyaṃ
translated: “If a monk eats fresh or cooked food after storing it, he commits an offense entailing confession,”

original: vā bhojanīyaṃ vā”ti hi vuttaṃ, idañca loṇaṃ nāma yāvajīvikattā sannidhibhāvaṃ nāpajjati.
analyzed: vā bhojanīyam vā iti hi vuttam idam ca loṇam nāma yāvajīvika ttā sannidhi bhāvam na āpajjati
translated: and that is the prohibition. In regard to this, some think that what is said in the rule is a condition for the offense, and so they say that salt does not become stored because it is for life-long use.🔽“But what is said in the rule is a condition for the offense only in the case of fresh or cooked food. Salt is not included in that. Therefore there is no offense in the case of salt.”

original: Yampi aloṇakaṃ āmisaṃ paṭiggahetvā tena saddhiṃ paribhuñjati, taṃ tadahupaṭiggahitameva,
analyzed: yam pi a loṇakam āmisam paṭiggahetvā tena saddhim paribhuñjati tam tad ahu paṭiggahitam eva
translated: If he receives plain food and then eats it together with the other, then that other is received on that day only.

original: tasmā “‘yāvakālikena, bhikkhave, yāvajīvikaṃ tadahupaṭiggahitaṃ kāle kappati, vikāle
analyzed: tasmā yāvakālikena bhikkhave yāvajīvikam tad ahu paṭiggahitam kāle kappati vikāle
translated: Therefore it is said: ‘It is wrong to say that there is an offence of wrong-doing here because of the words: “What is allowable for a time is allowable for the time, bhikkhus, and what is received on that day only is allowable on that day only,🔽not at a wrong time. ” ’ They should be told: ‘It is wrong to say that

original: na kappatī’ti vacanato dukkaṭenettha bhavitabba”nti. Te vattabbā – “tumhākaṃ matena
analyzed: na kappati iti vacanataḥ dukkaṭena ittha bhavitabban ti te vattabbā tumhākam matena
translated: there is an offence of wrong-doing here because of your view,

original: dukkaṭenapi na bhavitabbaṃ, na hi ettha yāvajīvikaṃ tadahupaṭiggahitaṃ, yāvakālikameva
analyzed: dukkaṭena api na bhavitabbam na hi ettha yāvajīvikam tad ahu paṭiggahitam yāva kālikam eva
translated: for here there is nothing received on that day only that is allowable for a time,🔽but what is received on that day only is allowable for a time only, and that is not eaten at a wrong time.

original: tadahupaṭiggahitaṃ, na ca taṃ vikāle paribhuttaṃ. Yadi vā “vikāle na kappatī”ti vacanena
analyzed: tad ahu paṭiggahitam na ca tam vikāle paribhuttam yadi vā vikāle na kappati iti vacanena
translated: If, because of the words “is not allowable at a wrong time”,

original: tumhe dukkaṭaṃ maññetha, yāvajīvikamissaṃ yāvakālikaṃ vikāle bhuñjantassa vikālabhojanapācittiyaṃ
analyzed: tumhe dukkaṭam maññetha yāvajīvikamissam yāvakālikam vikāle bhuñjantassa vikāla bhojana pācittiyam
translated: you think there is an offence of wrong-doing, then there would be no offence of Expiation for eating at a wrong time what is allowable for a time mixed with what is allowable for a lifetime.

original: na bhaveyya. Tasmā na byañjanamattaṃ gahetabbaṃ, attho upaparikkhitabbo.
analyzed: na bhaveyya tasmā na byañjana mattam gahetabbam atthaḥ upaparikkhitabbaḥ
translated: Therefore the mere letter should not be taken, the meaning should be investigated.

original: Ayañhettha attho – yāvakālikena yāvajīvikaṃ tadahupaṭiggahitaṃ yadi sambhinnarasaṃ
analyzed: ayam ha ittha atthaḥ yāvakālikena yāvajīvikam tad ahu paṭiggahitam yadi sambhinna rasam
translated: This is the meaning here: what is allowable for a time mixed with what is allowable for a lifetime, if it has a mixed appearance,

original: hoti, yāvakālikagatikameva hoti. Tasmā “yo pana bhikkhu vikāle khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ
analyzed: hoti yāvakālikagatikam eva hoti tasmā yaḥ pana bhikkhu vikāle khādanīyam vā bhojanīyam
translated: it is only a matter of time. Therefore: “If a monk, at the wrong time, should eat fresh or cooked food,

original: vā”ti iminā sikkhāpadena kāle kappati, vikāle na kappati. Na idha “na kappatī”ti🔽vacanamattenettha dukkaṭaṃ hoti. Yatheva yāvajīvikaṃ tadahupaṭiggahitaṃ yāvakālikena
analyzed: vāti iminā sikkhāpadena kāle kappati vikāle na kappati na idha na kappati iti  vacana mattena ittha dukkaṭam hoti yathā iva yāvajīvikam tad ahu paṭiggahitam yāvakālikena
translated: it is only allowable for a limited time. Therefore by this training rule “If a monk, at the wrong time, should eat fresh or cooked food” it is allowable at the right time, it is not allowable at the wrong time. Herein, it is not by the mere statement “it is not allowable”

original: sambhinnarasaṃ vikāle na kappati, vikālabhojanapācittiyāvahaṃ hoti. Evaṃ ajja paṭiggahitampi
analyzed: sambhinna rasam vikāle na kappati vikāla bhojana pācittiya āvaham hoti evam ajja paṭiggahitam pi
translated: that there is an offence of wrong-doing. Just as what is allowable for life is mixed in taste with what is allowable for a limited time when it is received on that day, and it is not allowable at the wrong time, and it causes an offence of Expiation for eating at the wrong time, so what is received today

original: aparajju yāvakālikena sambhinnarasaṃ na kappati, sannidhibhojanapācittiyāvahaṃ hoti.🔽Taṃ “sannidhikataṃ ida”nti ajānantopi na muccati. Vuttañhetaṃ – “sannidhikārake asannidhikārakasaññī
analyzed: aparajju yāvakālikena sambhinna rasam na kappati sannidhi bhojana pācittiya āvaham hoti  tam sannidhi katam idam ti a jānantaḥ api na muccati vuttam ha etam sannidhi kārake a sannidhi kāraka saññī
translated: is not allowable when it is mixed in taste with what is received the previous day, and it causes an offence of Expiation for eating stored food.

original: khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā khādati vā bhuñjati vā āpatti pācittiyassā”ti. Tasmā
analyzed: khādanīyam vā bhojanīyam vā khādati vā bhuñjati vā āpatti pācittiyassa ati tasmā
translated: Not knowing “This is stored”, he is not released. For this is said: “If it is stored, and he perceives it as such, in eating fresh or cooked food he commits an offence entailing confession.” Therefore

original: “kattha paṭikkhitta”nti imissā pucchāya “parisuddhamidaṃ byākaraṇaṃ sāvatthiyā suttavibhaṅge”ti.
analyzed: kattha paṭikkhittanti imissā pucchāya parisuddham idam byākaraṇam sāvatthiyā sutta vibhaṅge ti
translated: “Where was it laid down?” The answer is: “This rule of training was laid down by the Lord in Sāvatthī, in the Suttavibhaṅga.”

original: Rājagahe uposathasaṃyutteti idaṃ “na bhikkhave ekasmiṃ āvāse dve uposathāgārāni sammannitabbāni;
analyzed: rājagahe uposatha saṃyuttā iti idam na bhikkhave ekasmin āvāse dve uposatha āgārāni sammannitabbāni
translated: “In Rājagaha, in what is connected with the Uposatha”: this refers to “Monks, in one residence two Uposatha halls are not to be approved of.

original: yo sammanneyya, āpatti dukkaṭassā”ti etaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ. Vinayātisāre dukkaṭanti🔽“na bhikkhave ekasmiṃ āvāse dve uposathāgārāni sammannitabbānī”ti etassa vinayassa
analyzed: yaḥ sammanneyyaḥ āpatti dukkaṭassa ati etam sandhāya vuttam vinaya atisāre dukkaṭam ti  na bhikkhave ekasmin āvāse dve uposatha āgārāni sammannitabbāni iti etassa vinayassa
translated: If you should approve of them, there is an offence of wrong-doing.” In the Vinaya there is an offence of wrong-doing:🔽this refers to the Vinaya

original: atisāre dukkaṭaṃ. Campeyyake vinayavatthusminti idaṃ “adhammena ce bhikkhave vaggakammaṃ,
analyzed: atisāre dukkaṭam campeyyake vinaya vatthusmin ti idam adhammena ce bhikkhave vagga kammaṃ
translated: in the passage beginning, “Monks, in one residence two Uposatha halls are not to be approved of.” In the Campeyya section of the Vinaya there is an offence of wrong-doing: this refers to the Vinaya passage found in the Campeyya Khandhaka beginning, “If, monks, it is by an undeclared legal question, by a faction,

original: akammaṃ na ca karaṇīya”nti evamādiṃ katvā campeyyakkhandhake āgataṃ vinayavatthuṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ.
analyzed: akammam na ca karaṇīyanti evamādim katvā campeyya khandhake āgatam vinaya vatthum sandhāya vuttam
translated: it is not a legal procedure, it is not to be done.”

original: Ekacco kappatīti idaṃ dhammikaṃ āciṇṇaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ. Chedanake pācittiyanti suttavibhaṅge
analyzed: ekacco kappati iti idam dhammikam āciṇṇam sandhāya vuttam chedanake pācittiyam ti sutta vibhaṅge
translated: “Some say it is allowable”: this refers to a regular practice that is in accordance with the Dhamma. In the section on cutting down there is an offence of expiation: in the Suttavibhaṅga

original: hi “nisīdanaṃ nāma sadasaṃ vuccatī”ti āgataṃ, tasmā dvinnaṃ sugatavidatthīnaṃ upari🔽dasāyeva vidatthimattā labbhati. Dasāya vinā taṃ pamāṇaṃ karontassa idaṃ āgatameva
analyzed: hi nisīdanam nāma sadasam vuccati iti āgatam tasmā dvinnam sugata vidatthīnam upari  dasāya iva vidatthimat tā labbhati dasāya vinā tam pamāṇam karontassa idam āgatam eva
translated: “A sitting mat” is said to be a mat with fringes.🔽So only a mat with fringes ten standard handspans long is allowed.🔽If he makes one longer than that, then this is said:🔽“If he exceeds that, then for every effort there is an act of wrong conduct. When it has been made, it is to be cut down; he commits an offense entailing confession.”

original: hoti – “taṃ atikkāmayato chedanakaṃ pācittiya”nti. Tasmā “kiṃ āpajjatī”ti puṭṭho
analyzed: hoti tam atikkāmayataḥ chedanakam pācittiyanti tasmā kim āpajjati iti puṭṭhaḥ
translated: So when asked, “What does he commit?”

original: “chedanake pācittiya”nti āha. Chedanakasikkhāpade vuttapācittiyaṃ āpajjatīti attho.
analyzed: chedanake pācittiyanti āha chedanaka sikkhāpade vutta pācittiyam āpajjati iti attho
translated: he says, “An offense entailing confession for every effort.” The meaning is that he commits the offense entailing confession given in the training rule on cutting.

original: Sesaṃ sabbattha uttānamevāti.
analyzed: sesam sabbattha uttānam eva ati
translated: The rest is clear in all cases.

original: Dasavatthukathā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: dasa vatthu kathā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the ten topics is finished.

original: Samantapāsādikāya vinayasaṃvaṇṇanāya
analyzed: samanta pāsādikāya vinaya saṃvaṇṇanāya
translated: The commentary on the Monastic Law, which is entirely satisfactory,

original: Sattasatikakkhandhakavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sattasatika khandhaka vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the chapter on the seven hundred is finished.🔽The five chapters in the Two-part Khandhaka

original: Dvivaggasaṅgahā vuttā, dvāvīsatipabhedanā;
analyzed: dvi vagga saṅgahā vuttā dvāvīsati pa bhedanā
translated: are said to contain twenty-two sections.🔽They are the five chapters in the Monastic Law

original: Khandhakā sāsane pañcakkhandhadukkhappahāyino.
analyzed: khandhakā sāsane pañca kkhandha dukkha ppahāyinaḥ
translated: of the one who has given up the suffering of the five aggregates.🔽This explanation of them,

analyzed: yā tesam vaṇṇanā esā antarāyam vinā yathā
translated: which is complete except for the obstacles,🔽may the good wishes of the people be fulfilled,

original: Siddhā sijjhantu kalyāṇā, evaṃ āsāpi pāṇinanti.
analyzed: siddhā sijjhantu kalyāṇāḥ
translated: and so too may their hopes.”

original: Cūḷavagga-aṭṭhakathā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: cūḷa vagga aṭṭhakathā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the shorter section is finished.
